text: I'd like to take a moment to thank Josh and his hardworking staff for hosting my organization's recent business workshop. Josh went above and beyond to meet our needs prior to and during the event. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful toward all attendees. The delicious cocktails, lattes, and food left everyone satisfied and wanting more. The venue provided an open, clean, and inviting environment for all, and I look forward to working together again. Between the excellent customer service, mouthwatering menu, and perfect location nestled in the heart of the DTLV's Arts District, there's no other coffee shop that compares. Thank you, Makers & Finders for an amazing experience!

I came here the other day with some friends. I'm not one to go to these little coffee shops, but I'm so glad I did! I ordered an iced chai tea latte, delicious! I loved everything about it. The food wasn't the best in my opinion, but I can't complain about anything else!

Makers and finders was a hidden gym located in the Fremont District of downtown Las Vegas. The food was very good as well as the different products an atmosphere that we were privy to. I will definitely frequent this location in my near travels to the Las Vegas area and look forward to it.
The lavender infused latte is completely off the hook. The staff is friendly and so were the other customers around. A truly local feel. This is the kind of place that builds communities.
I came in and bought a coffee, tipped the bartender and sat down and was told that I was not allowed to sit down if I was not ordering food. I've never seen such a thing in a coffee shop before.
I enjoy a lot from breakfast it is tasty. I order the Mexican spicy latte and some dishes to share with my friends

Brought my mother here for a late breakfast... Moderately busy today.  Mom has the areppa Benny and the Bolivian coffee. I had the Latin hash and a salted caramel latte.  The food was excellent!  Coffee was rich and fresh!  Wait staff was polite and quick.  Two thumbs up!!

I love this place! Super cute. Not in the best part of town. Great service. Of course the coffee is absolutely amazing. I was really impressed with the food. Laptop friendly. Child friendly. Even dog friendly!

Amazing coffee place. I am not a latte drinker but theirs are incredible. Cortado, cappuccino, and pour overs equally as amazing. Probably the best coffee I've had in Las Vegas. Food is very delicious too however a bit over priced. It's ok for small bites while enjoying coffee but not for the hungry. That said place is still amazing and new go to coffee spot.
Nice place to chill and have breakfast. Friendly staff. I recommend the veggie bagel and matcha latte. Would definitely come again.

Absolutely love my skinny capuchino.  All coffee is done from scratch which is amazing, delicious .  Owners are knowledgeable on the whole process (went to South America) a definite plus .  Food is great, service is wonderful.   Finally something different in the area.  Highly recommended this place.!!!!

What a great  place, already favorite of myself and others, I recommend to everyone. They were still having their soft opening our first time there and opened for us so we could have coffee which was amazing. Thank you!
The lavender latte is my go to drink, always so delicious and difficult to find anywhere else. Great atmosphere, and friendly staff. Trendy but, not obnoxious. Chill place.

There food is sooooo good!!! Any time I could me to Vegas I want to come here. High quality, unique food and coffee. 
The waitress was super sweet and there's casual seating and couches outside where we stayed and worked after we ate for a while.

This place is an absolute gem. My mom and I stopped here during her vacation and fell in love.
The atmosphere brought in a very diverse group and the service was wonderful. Greeted with a smile the moment we walked in and both our servers were delighted to explain a Latin dish we had never tried before. Even selecting it was difficult because the whole menu looked amazing.
The lavender latte is a must, though!! 
All in all, my mom is upset that there isn't a Markers and Finders in FL for her to regularly enjoy and I am excited that I am able to return for more coconut soup on a windy day :)
The scene, the service, the presentation and taste of the beverages and food were all combined to make this the perfect place to stop and relax at.

YUM! What a random find! Not usually on this side of town since I am an out of towner but stayed at the SLS and wanted to find some good breakfast and definitely found it. This place is fantastic! Great coffee and DELICIOUS food! We had La Paisa and Chilequiles and loved them both. Best rice I've ever had in my life. Highly, highly recommend. Parking sucks but don't give up!!!!
Yeah the empandas tasted ok but they were TINY. It took forever to get the food and had a very small menu. You are paying for the "hipster" factor

Makers and Finders is a gem in the otherwise weak art district offerings.  Come here for a hand made coffee drink or the excellent food.  

We live nearby and I have never been disappointed in the inventive Latin American offerings.
Awesome coffee hang out great cortadito so smooth if you love expresso. And the yucca mash is to die for, if you love yucca with garlic. Like mundungo yummy.

Nice addition to Main Street.

First time coming was during their soft opening. Ordered the salted caramel latte and lavender latte both with almond milk to go. If you like lavender, then it's for you. Personally, it was too floral for me but definitely as it should taste. Salted caramel was delicious. At the time, there wasn't a cup sleeve with my drinks. Don't know if they've added them now.

Second time, sat in to get work done. Since they've officially opened, place was much more busier than my last. A couple and myself were just standing around the entrance because we didn't know what to do! Was it seat yourself or did we have to wait to get seated? Noone approached us as everyone was busy serving so I approached a server then got seated. There's a "community table" where I guess most of those who are solo and with a laptop go. Since it was full, I sat at the couches that was conveniently next to an outlet. Once seated, someone took my order immediately.

Ordered the chorizo brussel sprouts and a honey vanilla latte with almond milk. Both came out in a timely manner. The brussel sprouts dish was pretty amazing. Pieces of meat, mushrooms, some grilled shrimp topped with crispy onions in red wine vinegar. Mmm. Latte was good too. So far, the coffee drinks have been a hit.

Place is cool and music is spot on. I enjoyed hearing Flume, Flight Facilities, What So Not, and Disclosure. If you're into that type of music, no need to listen to your own. Parking isn't bad and there's usually spots not too far. There's also wifi but be sure to ask the pw for guest2 because the open one sucked.

I understand that they're still fairly new and working on things but checking out took me a good 20 minutes from when I asked for the check and actually left. I still give this place 4 stars because the products they represent are good. Just needs some work on service and organization but it's nothing too major that would stop me from coming back.

This place was amazing. We came here for food before heading over to Hop Mule on an early afternoon trip to downtown from the strip. It's a short walk from the SDX or Deuce to get over here.

First, the coffee. We each got a cold brew iced coffee, which was a nice, satisfyingly cold beverage for a hot afternoon. 

Then, the food. I ordered the Rajas Arepa, having never had an arepa before, but it sounded like something I'd be a fan of. Before too long, I was trying one for the first time, and... just, wow. Lots of great flavors mixed together, everything prepared proportioned nicely to the other ingredients. Plus, the sweet potato/yam/??? chips that were on the side? Those were amazing. I just wanted an entire box of those to-go, they were crunchy but melt-in-your-mouth with just the right amount of seasoning.

There's no doubt in my mind that we'll be back.

As described, well prepared and very tasty. 
Eggs poached to perfection and an excellent verde hollandaise. 
Make the effort and travel for this breakfast.

Having lived in San Francisco and Brooklyn, epicenters of hipster America, this is the first cafe I've ever been to where my water came in mason jars. Whether that's a positive is up to your personal preferences.

The coffee is great, the food is terrible (my salad was watery and wilty, my friend's arepa was meh), but the space itself is airy and inviting, so three stars on average. A nice little oasis among the antique shops on Main St.

Love this place! Everyone is super hip and I wish I owned most of the furniture.
Their drips are awesome and they have very unique drinks for coffee lovers.
My ONLY complaint is that I wish they were opened later because I'd come by more!

We stopped by this spot for some grub after a downtown event, and we were not disappointed.  The place was very busy (downtown on a Saturday usually is), but they sat us quickly, and the service was good. I had the La Paisa (arepa), and it was delicious. It had a lovely mix of ingredients that satisfied the salty, sweet and savory that's oh so very important. Everyone else at the table seemed very satisfied with their choices as well, which included one of the eggs Benedict choices and the chilaquiles (sp?).  The prices are reasonable for the food you get. Parking is a little tough on a busy day, but it's worth it for the food.
Very very good place. The food was off the charts came here after visiting Grand Canyon the night before. Best breakfast & brunch. Ordered the Latin hash and Mexican Spicy Latte

I was excited about this place because of the reviews. It was tough finding parking but that's fine. The wait was over 25min which also would have been fine but it bothered me when the hostess sat another party before us.  The party pointed out that a table was open and she sat them ahead of us.. we also saw that the table was open but we were expected to be seated there when it was ready. Aside from our server, Cody, the customer service overall was pretty poor. When I asked the bartender for more ice in my drink, she gave me a look like "really?" and then walked away for the bar and asked me to wait. The ice machine was right behind her.. As for the food and coffee, it was ok.

Here's yet another establishment that thinks it's better than it's customers. First, I was expecting a more relaxed, Bohemian coffeehouse atmosphere. Instead, It was a restaurant where a pretentious waiter (complete with an attitude) wanted to tell me where to sit - really!, there's only one table occupied - There was a small area with two sofas for the chill crowd. Both sofas were occupied and I didn't want to sit in an uptight table alone. So, I sat outside on the patio. 
The food was good, but it was expensive for the portion you get. The coffee was luke warm. 
Too expensive and no communal feel - I'm still waiting for a cool coffeehouse to make its way downtown.  The Beat it still the best going and PublicUs loves itself more that this place does.
Wonderful food and amazing coffee. You can't go wrong with the ceviche or the empanadas. Definitely, one of my favorites Downtown and they are now open for Sunday brunch.

Great coffee; Great service; I had the cold brew to go and it's perfect!
This was perfectly refreshing to walk main street to shop for some good ol things; although some spots don't allow drinks in their stores... so I chose to keep walking. I'm not leaving this cup of coffee behind anywhere except into my mouth and into my belly
I wish they were open later when I get off work but on the days I can make it, I absolutely love it here. I always get my vanilla iced coffee with the sliders. AND BANANA CHIPS!!! super yummy!
Coffee is amazing.  And food is outstanding.  Super friendly service.  Would recommend to anyone in Vegas.

its like these prople get mad if you dont leave them a tip?? cofee is $6 a cup and its to go, why would i leave you a tip???

these peopke also suck at making lattes its more milk than anything :((
shitty baristas

Wonderful gem in Vegas. If you wanna get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, and get a great cup of coffee and some Latin cuisine, this is a place to check out. Located in the arts district of Vegas, towards the downtown area, makers & finders has a wide selection of premium coffee drinks as well as some awesome Latin eats! Arepas, Empanadas, oh my!

The honey vanilla latte and arepa benny are standouts!

The food? Prepared well and presented appropriately for the theme. Read the menu and whatever you picture in your mind is what you'll get.  How good was the food?  So good that I ordered the chilaquiles, sat and sipped a French Press coffee for about 30mins, and then ordered a second entre.  Seriously, am eating breakfast and lunch in the same place.  The $10 Uber ride from the Strip was totally worth it.

The coffee?  A couple of distinctly different options.  The staff?  Nice, educated, attentive without hovering.  Coffee knowledge? I asked the staff to recommend one of their coffee's based on my taste and he nailed.

Free wifi throughout, comfy outdoor patio, dog friendly, and no smoking inside or out.  Menu is full of veggie and gluten-free options, full bar, lots of locals, and nothing but class.

I walked in and despite being a tourist I immediately felt at peace.

No slot machines, no neon signs, and no creepy stereotypical Vegas lounge-lizard types ... just normal people, nice people.

Coffee is Amazing. Just plain black coffee is to die for. I've tried the Mexican Spice and Lavender Latte and both were absolutely amazing.

Food is to die for. Sofrito sliders are perfect with the plantain chips is perfect.

It's a religious experience.

The aesthetics of this place are amazing . Perfect for people who like to photograph there food and sh** like that. Buttttt if you're here to Find delicious Mexican breakfast, you are way better off going to the casa Don Juan next door. I ordered the Lomo Saltado, with a Matcha Latte. I had so many hopes for it to be delicious, but it tasted like NOTHING HAD SALT. idk if it's because they were trying to be healthy or something, but it didn't impress me at all. The matcha also had a very chalky taste to it. But the presentation was beautiful. The waitress also looked like she needed an extra hand when it was really busy. Like you can ask for her a check and she would just get pissed off. But I don't blame her, I hated working for food service too. Anyways, super cool looking but wouldn't come here again (:

In a word, uneven. 

Service was weak and forgettable. Food was delivered Luke warm and the coffee was delivered at least 10 minutes after the food. We asked for hot sauce and never got it. We wanted desert but couldn't get waiters attention. Took a long time to get a check and pay.

Food was just mediocre. We ordered lox and bagel. Arepa Benny, and croissant sandwhich. The benny did not match the description on the menu "salsa verde hollandaise?" No salsa verde anywhere. Very basic. Grilled tomatoes?  Nada. Bagel was ok but simple. Coffee was good but nothing special.

Our bill for 4 was $70 and we left hungry.

Delish!! Their coffees are amazing!! Haven't had one that wasn't tasty! My default is the honey vanilla or lavender infused!! Im a pescatarian and their food is very friendly to my eating habits also great about trading things out! Fan of the mushroom empanadas! Love the people the work there and own it. Great ppl so love supporting an over all good thing!
Best coffee and breakfast i have ever had. Went to vegas for vacation and found this place. Went 2 days in a row and even ordered coffee and food to go. Would drive another 8 hours just to go here.

Love this spot! Been coming here since they opened and its cool to see them changing up their menus and adding new things.  I usually go with the coconut turmeric latte and the bandeja paisa.  Definitely worth stopping in!  The vibe is relaxing and I could use that in my life sometimes...

This is the BEST  breakfast/brunch place in LV. The Coconut Turmeric Latte is to die for. I ordered two. Food is delicious too and they have many gluten free options as well as vegan. I liked this place so much I came back the next day.
Eclectic menu, chill vibe, excellent service! The coconut turmeric latte is definitely a must (I was hesitant but am thrilled I took the risk!)
Last time I came the service was downright RUDE. I always mind my Ps and Qs and tip 20% or more. What gives? Used to be friendly. Food quality has gone way down too. Over this place.

Absolutely amazing! Food was great and never disappointed!!! Was in Las Vegas May 11-15 and ate there everyday. The chicken tinga omelette, hibiscus iced tea was delicious, fruit parfait was to die for!!

Only disappointment was on Mother's Day when they were busy, my husband and I waited almost an hour to eat. People that came after us were waited on first, we were bypassed over and over, waiter barely interacted with us.

We only had coffee but it was a nice change of pace from our usual Saturday coffee shop! We tried the Mexican latte, honey vanilla latte and the salted caramel latte. All three had delicious flavors and were served at the right temperature. The price was right in line with other coffee shops.

My boyfriend and I spent a long weekend in Vegas last month. We mostly ate off the strip and ended up finding all of the best restaurants, including this place for brunch.

This place has a hipster feel (apparently, my thing), unique latte selections like a lavender infused latte, and a killer menu complete with arepas and lots of gluten-free options. Everything was outstanding. The entire experience was a reprieve from the flashy Vegas experience. This is definitely staying on my Vegas restaurant list. Next time I'll take some pictures and hang out longer!
Lovely food and coffee. Hash and tinga chicken both have amazing flavors. Definitely coming back!

Cute coffee shop in the art district of Las Vegas. Very laid back, indoor and patio seating. Arepa benny was delicious. Also had a lavender infused latte, perfect touch of lavender that does not at all overpower the latte.

I had the arepa benny with a iced lavender infused latte and my boyfriend had the garlic lime chicken breast. The food was pretty tasty & it was probably one of the best eggs benedict I've had in a while! The bf was satisfied with his order as well! 

Only 4 stars because we were both disappointed in the size of the portions, especially for the price we were paying for each dish....
Had James as a server.  Excellent across the board.  Perfect coffee drinks with ultimate food pairings

I stopped in after the gym for a breakfast sandwich and coffee and wasn't disappointed! The atmosphere is pretty cool, not what I expected in a good way. I got the breakfast sandwich and it was really good, just enough egg to bacon ratio on a delicious flaky croissant. I got a Mexican spice latte and was blown away! Hands down the best coffee drink I've ever tasted, I drank it slow as to savor the goodness! Lol I will definitely come back to try their other drinks and eats!!!

This place advertises gluten free and vegan and I would bet a million bucks that it is no where close to meeting those requirements. We ordered the empanadas because they said GF. We even clarified with our waiter about the doughs ingredients. He went back to the kitchen twice to double check and said they were made out of corn. They came out and they were fluffy, flakey, buttery and delicious tasting, thus NOT at all GF. If you can eat anything without repercussion, this place will be fine for you. If you are targeting this place because of the Vegan or GF options, I would not trust there dedication to these dietary needs. BEWARE!

I really love the vibe of this coffee shop/restaurant. It has a pretty spacious covered patio with a good amount of seating and a to go window in the corner. The inside is a good size as well with a coffee bar or table seating if you prefer. They have happy hour which is from 4 to 6. We've only gone for late lunches (between 2pm - 5pm) and each time was quiet with only a handful of people, there was no wait to be seated or to place our orders. Not much items to choose from for happy hour but we were able to try what we wanted in the one visit, so that cancels out if we will order again. 

I would come back here more for the coffee than the food. I'm not saying I would never eat here again or the food is terrible, I just wasn't blown away by the food like I thought I would be. I would definitely be open to trying new dishes the next time I go though, so there is still hope the food could wow me!
I'll say this though, if you're a person that wants the fancy shmancy crazy flavored/blended coffees, this is not the place for you. 
For drinks I ordered the cortado, which I thought was a nice blend of espresso and milk, not overly strong. My boyfriend ordered a speciality coffee cocktail, the espresso martini. He really liked it, I found it a bit strong (liquor wise) for my liking but I'm a lightweight and don't like to taste it in my coffee. 
 
For food we ordered the 2 house empanadas (shredded beef & shrimp), the Latin poutine, and the sofrito burger. I found the empanada crust to be more pastry-like, very flaky and a bit messy which I am not used to. Also, the shredded beef was a little hard to eat. One bite and all the beef came out. I basically had to bite through the wad of beef in my mouth and cut up the rest to place back inside the rest of my empanada. 
The Latin poutine was so so. I'm Canadian and I'm used to the scolding hot gravy that burns your entire mouth off and cheese, lots of cheese! The gravy was luke warm with barely any queso or cotija cheese as it claimed. It was basically fries, gravy, an egg, with bits of bacon. I didn't have high hopes for the poutine anyways. I find it difficult to get a decent poutine here in Vegas, but curiosity always gets me when I see the option on a menu.
As for the sofrito burger, nothing bad to say. It was a good burger made with Angus beef, very flavorful and juicy. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed it.

All in all, I do enjoy the atmosphere and the drink selections and will be back to try some more.

I just discovered they are opening up a location in downtown summerlin (when exactly I am not sure), but this will be much more convienant then driving to the arts district and looking for parking!

The guys were super busy but seemed nice enough. They invited me to sit on the patio, which seemed great.  I waited for about twenty minutes until an other customer sat out there as well, and he got served right away.  I gave the waiter a look and he realized he'd forgotten me, and was super apologetic. He promised to "step on it" and grab me a $3.79 cup of coffee to go, and was nice enough to bring the bill and take my cash off the table about five minutes before the actual paper cup of coffee ever materialized. A spoon or something to stir the honey would have been cool but the coffee itself was good enough I didn't end up needing honey, so at least there's that.  Whatever. Shit happens. I think what's going on here is that the brunch vibe is killing the coffee shop vibe, the model isn't really clear, and the service for people who think this is a coffee bar like it says on the sign is suffering.  I wouldn't come here again as if the place is a coffee bar, but know where to go if I need hipster brunch and a $4 cup of joe off the strip. Nice design. Chill location.

2 stars for the good coffee and food. Bonbon was delicious. 

Service was what everyone else was saying. Non existent at best. We waited maybe 30-40 minutes for eggs and a burger and the place was maybe half full. 

The table next to us got their food and pretty much finished before they brought our coffee out! Server didn't even come around asking how the food was or how coffee was tasting. 

Food was delicious and flavorful but I couldn't taste the smoked salmon under their that chipotle hollandaise sauce. What a bummer! 

Hipster place 
Good for your Instagram photos
Good for your taste buds
Bad for your time. Walked in at around 11 and left around 1. That's not how long it should take to eat a quick brunch!

Visiting from Washington on a weekend trip to Zion, we decided to try Makers & Finders based on their reviews. My boyfriend and I prefer low key, so we wanted to venture off the strip. I had the Cortado, which was velvety and delicious. We had the Garlic Lime Chicken Breast, the Latin Hash and a side of garlic fries - all extremely good! I wish I could try more off their menu. We will be back!

Firstly, any coffee shop that offers almond milk gets extra points from me. Second, a place that can introduce me to something as novel as a Lavender-infused latte with said almond milk gets 5 stars. Well done!

look this place has some pretty good coffee, and I'm really excited to see good things happening downtown Las Vegas. But their coffee is severely overpriced. Coming from Seattle I would never pay five bucks for an Americano. And honestly the Americano would be better. But again I'm glad to see good things happening downtown Las Vegas

Had lunch at this, omg, who knew  place. Had breakfast bagel, so good. 
Coffee was really different. Trendy downtown art district place. Yup, I'd go back.

We stumbled on this coffee shop by chance while looking for a nice breakfast outside of the Vegas strip chaos. This place was perfect. They have a very inventive menu of coffee and tea drinks - I had a coconut turmeric latte. The food was spectacular as well. This seems to be a local favorite. We will be back!

Do you like to party? If you answered yes, no, or maybe so...then this is the place for you! Wake up and mosey on in dawning your pajamas if you want, cause this place brings the chill factor through the roof. Great food. Great coffee!
Food was great, lavender earl grey tea was excellent, staff were friendly and on it. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town.

Sad to have finally paid this place a visit to have had the worst experience with a guest from out of town.  Being a local downtown homeowner for 20 years, I was excited to finally have had the chance to experience this place.
Needless to say that experience was so bad that I'll never give a second chance.  From the moment of checking in for a table which took 15 mins for a party of 2 to not being addressed at the bar for a good 10 mins, to not being able to order waffles since they didn't have their waffle machine to not being about to order a coffee with whipped cream since they gave up their whipped cream machine to their other new location.
The only pleasant thing was the foodserver who was apologetic.  Obviously the 2 at the host stand knew we were leaving without ordering and should have addressed us as we left but all we got was have a nice day.
If plans to succeed are in order, then this place needs to pull it together.

Found this place on our road trip to Utah! Awesome find! I had the chipotle chicken sandwich and my husband had the turkey avocado sandwich. The French bread is perfectly grilled and both sandwiches were delicious. The chicken is perfectly shredded with the perfect amount of spice and lettuce. The sandwiches are a perfect size. And the coffee is delicious. This place is a must stop.

I really want to love Makers, but I don't.

PROS
-Close to work
-Great patio space
-Not a chain store
-some tasty sauces!

CONS
-The coffee just isn't good enough to warrant the price.  There are muchhhh better coffee places within walking distance...
-The food, too, feels overdone.  Everything I've had here has been very salty, and their empanadas are more like giant wontons (which, while nice and fried, isn't what I'm going for when I order empanadas).
-Slowwww.  Whether sitting down or ordering coffees to go, it's not that quick.

Overall, it's fine and I'm glad it exists where it does, but leaves me a bit disappointed each time I go.

I just found this place and loved it.  Met with a work friend for early morning breakfast.  Definitely a relaxed vibe but it was just 7:30a.  Server was cool, nice and super helpful.  Explained the menu and very friendly without being overly attentive, if you know what I mean.  We both had the Latin Hash with pulled beef and fried egg.  So good!  Oh and good coffee, lots of refills.  Will be back for sure.  perfect place to eat solo or meet up.

I got the La Paisa arepa, lavender infused latte, and espresso flan for brunch today. I love strong, complex, and unusual flavor combinations and this place is very special and original for being able to pull that off. Everything tasted amazing and was reasonably priced. I've been craving hipster brunch cafes for a while now. Being new to Vegas, this was a very pleasant discovery which reminded of the hipster yuppie businesses in Boston that I love so dearly. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Another reason to explore and fall in love with Downtown Las Vegas. 
Verdict: muy muy excelente y delicioso!

Hmmmm.. Great service, nice decor, felt very tranquil while enjoying my coffee.  The coffee, flavorful, though to watery for my taste. I like to hear my heart beat when savoring a cuban cortaditos! Best empanada I've tasted in vegas. Mixing chilled cook shrimp with mojo isn't ceviche! Mango basil tomato balsamic is brilliant #Chef_whooo??? #jbo

This is hands-down my favorite downtown spot! Killer food. Awesome service. Great vibe. Its also a great atmosphere for me to work when I want to get out of the office. Forgot to mention...GREAT coffee!! HIGHLY recommended to anyone living or visiting Las Vegas.

This little cafe is nestled in the art district of LV and is definitely not somewhere I would normally find myself, but due to the recommendation of our uber driver my fiance & I decided to check it out......best decision.  This place had amazing food!  I ordered the croissant sandwich & he had the chilaquiles, which we still talk about.  We didn't order any of the specialty coffees or teas, just the basic pressed brew but it was still delicious......This was hands down one of our favorite places of our week long trip to LV.

I'm super torn to rate and give a review of this place.  It is so cute and yummy that I want to say good things about it but don't because I don't want this place to get over crowded and lose it's charm.  Selfish, I know!  The outdoor patio in front of the shop is a perfect place to enjoy good company on a beautiful day.  It reminds me of someplace you would find in California somewhere.   Do yourself a favor and get the lavender latte!!  I usually order a cappuccino and don't put sugar or any sweeteners in it so I was afraid the lavender syrup would be too sweet.  But it's not, it's deliciously amazing!  I've tried it with almond milk but it slightly over powers the lavender flavor.   I've also had the shrimp and brussel sprouts which was good.  I just wish it was on the southwest side of town vs downtown so I could go more often!

Went there for a brunch with some friends ! The place is really nice. I would love to have many places like this and in Vegas ! 
The food was good too. I had the one with the scrambled eggs and it was really good. I also tried the lavender latte which was good. I will come back.

We love good coffee so we searched around the Vegas area for a good coffee shop. Luckily we had a car this time and were able to drive here. It wasnt too far from the strip and would probe worth the cab fare. I was intrigued by the lavender latte and decided to give it a try. I wasn't sure it would work but wow was I wrong. It was so delicious I had the hubby drive me there the next day before our flight home. It was so good even he got one the second time around. The menu seemed interesting and we would have ordered if it hadn't been for the free buffet we were offered with our hotel deal. Next time we stop into Vegas we are definitely gonna come back for a nice breakfast and a lavender latte.
Great food, great service!  Cool place, don't hesitate to eat here. Simply awesome and interesting food.
The place it's self is nice and atmosphere is great but the food is not flavorful at all. We ordered 3 things and it just wasn't enjoyable to my friend and I.
Incredible coffee, food and service. They carry a great selection of different coffees and have a menu that accommodates different dietary needs. I highly recommend this place!

Friendly service, tasty coffee and decent standard prices. Some unique menus items worth checking out. Clean large eating area and fast service despite a full house. A nice little spot if your in the area. Parking can be a headache but worth the walk.
Chill vibe, awesome food and coffee. Must do if you are in the area... If you are a Latte lover this is the place for you (great selection).  Latin twist to every meal for a great price.

Great quality food...so flavorful and well portioned! Tried breakfast: chicken tinga+ avocado AND chicken chilaquiles. Staff is very friendly and attentive, our waiter Chris was very nice. Also they're lavender latte is amazing! Would absolutely visit this place again when I come to Las Vegas.

This cozy spot was amazing. 
We ordered the arepas, hash, lavender latte and tummeric latte. 
It was full or flavor and the staff was very friendly.
Ordered a large cold brew for $4.50 and half of it was ice. It is a blend of three coffees not single origin and although it wasn't bitter, didn't meet my expectations.

The coffee is good although some of the lattes are too sweet. The croissant breakfast sandwich is great! The service is fast although I wish they were friendlier. One of the servers doesn't smile at all which isn't very welcoming.

Only had espresso drinks this visit. Omg! We're from LA & have our favorite coffee stop in Venice, Menotti's which we LOVE. So we can be disappointed often elsewhere. M&F exceeded our needs, wishes, desires & expectations. YYEEEEESSSSS! Thank you M&F! I got the flat white with two sprays of vanilla & a splash of the Mayan spice chocolate syrup!! Thank god. The espresso not burnt at all; sooooo yum. I also sampled the iced coffee. Very balanced. You'll love it here. Xo

This place was highly recommended on Yelp, so we decided to try it out. When we walked in, no one greeted us or told us that we seat ourselves or someone would seat us. We grabbed two menus and sat at a table. A few moments later a guy from behind the counter came and brought us water and took our drink order, which was a latte and a coffee. To make a long story short, we sat and watched other people come in and sit at the counter and receive their drink orders while no one came with our drinks or said ANYTHING at all. It was AT LEAST 10 minutes. I get really tired, real fast of this hipster, barista, cliquey-ass, bourgeois attitude and air at a lot of these places. We walked out. And here I am aggravated and writing this review. I watched "United Shades of America" with Kamau Bell on CNN and he was in Portland, which is full of hipsters, yet no one admits to being one. Own the douchery. And, do yourself a favor, think twice about going to Makers and Minders unless you are an obvious card-carrying asshat hipster. Then, maybe you'll get treated like they want your business. Oh, and the chairs are cheap. And they suck.

This place is amazing!! The lavender infused latte is incredible, my favorite! I have also tried the Mexican spice latte, delicious too!!  The sofrito sliders are Yummy and the tuna albacore sandwich my favorite, amazing!

Stopped by for a bite for breakfast and some coffee. Wasn't expecting to be blown away, but was. The coffee quality is terrific. The latte is equally impressive. The arepa is solid. So far everything I've had here is good. Great find and recommended!

I have been in the service Industry over 20 years and making any customer wait 45 minutes for a cup of coffee is rude, inconsiderate,  and shows a total lack of respect for its customers.    Don't waste your time coming here!

I was excited to try another independent coffee house. I was disappointed. When I arrived, my friend and I were deciding if we wanted to sit at the bar or outside, well the hostess decided for us by saying she would find us a table. No one came over for at least 10 minutes. The hostess came back and stated, "I'm doing my sidework because I'm leaving but I'll get you your drinks". After another 10 minutes or so, she came back with our drinks and told us she was leaving and this guy would be in charge. He didn't introduce himself to us or check back with us even after 30 minutes. We were on a time crunch after all the delays. So we both got out our wallets. That got him coming over. 
My Lavender iced latte was good, but not good enough to put up with that service.

Excellent atmosphere. Great great food, we had the Arepa Benny, La Paisa, Kale Chorizo Omelet & coffee. It was really great. Very friendly and prompt service staff. Doesnt hurt that the barista is really cute.

So happy to finally have a place like this in Vegas! I don't think it's possible to be disappointed here. Even if you had to wait, good things are worth waiting for ; ) Great coffee, great design, great service and...they have a big patio (with little direct sunlight which is a plus for Vegas) so it's a winner all around.
Just a great breakfast and staff. Very unique blend of the traditional with special twist. An excellent spot near the mall.

Excellent food in an up and coming neighborhood. I had the Latin Hash and the sautéed Brussel sprouts. Both were very tasty. My gf had the Veggie Benny. It was awesome as well. She said the Chai Latte was the best she ever had. Our server Erin was very nice and helpful in our efforts to order. Overall a great experience.
I love everything about this place the food the drinks and the service is amazing! Must try for all locals and tourist :)

Came here a few weeks ago with a friend from out of town. The set up is very unique, and cozy. The coffee was a 10-10! But the food wasn't so hot. I had the caprice bagel. I didn't like how the flavor matched up. I felt like there was just too much going on fore such a basic order. And my friend had a turkey sandwich, which seemed to be a little dry. The staff was a little stiff also. Took our bar server sometime to even greet us. Then ignored us majority of the time we were sitting. Overall. I may have not liked the food or the service, but the coffee will defiantly make me crawl back. Willing to give them another try.

Saw photos on yelp and decided it was worth heading to downtown. It wasn't the "downtown" I had in mind when I read the reviews (closer to the outlets than to Fremont St), but the place was cute and clean. 

As a coffee house, I'd probably give a higher rating, but was disappointed in the good service - especially since we came in to eat. While my arepa Benny was quite good, my husband's croissant sandwich was lackluster. There were only 2-3 other tables of people while we were there, but it took more than 10min to get my Mexican Spice latte (which was delicious) and felt like another 25 min. To get our meal. 

The coffee was great and different. I'd probably come back to hang out with a friend over coffee (and order at the counter)... if I happened to be in the area

Too many beyond excellent reviews! I don't get it. Maybe these people haven't been to fancy cafes in other places around the world. Coffee was all right, croissants old, dry and terrible and empanadas ok (wasn't exactly what it said). Plus is ambience and polite welcoming server! So not bad, not great but nothing that I'll drive out of my way to be at.

I tried the bandeja paisa and it was good, the service excellent and the place perfect for an awesome breakfast with friends on a Sunday, be early since the place gets crowded fast ( We got there at 9am and by 9:30 half of the place was full).
The coffee was really good but the cooking can improved in taste...please see this is from a personal point of view. I like bandejas with arepas, yuca and chorizo, but I also understand that every restaurant has different versions of the bandeja.

First time i visited this spot my first reaction to the area was Cali vibes. They have couches outside where youre able to relax, walking inside its very comfy and relaxed. The waiter was somewhat awkward, i ordered a croissant sandwhich and all it literally had inside was egg and cheese. I wish i would've ordered something else, since the sandwhich was so dull. I also orted the Lavender Fog Tea, i love it! Seriously recomended, reminds me of London.

Awesome gem off the strip, if you are looking for good organic and fresh food. Hipster vibe, love it because it reminds me if Brooklyn. GUESS WHAT. ..THE owner is originally from Brooklyn!  Ha. Love it. I will be going there every time I visit LV area.

this place is awesome, man! the atmosphere and how the cafe is set up! and I'm talking about the decoration, sofa, chairs, the plates, the dang Mason Jars they even use to serve water. it's all pretty beautiful if you ask me. the dirty chai tea latte was one of the best I've had in awhile too. it's hard to find a cafe that serves good coffee AND GOOD FOOD. I'm not a coffee connoisseur, but this beats a lot of local coffee shops in Vegas (not that there were very many good ones to begin with). I would definitely make this one of my go-to spots

Like the place , would go again soon but because I like it I believe I need to be critical . I feel that the portions should be grander for the price . I felt like my coffee was watered down . Over all everything is kinda bland tasting. I want to see the meat , I want to see the ingredients better . The sauce is good and it would be nice if it was the sea around the island of super pile ! 
If I want comfort food in a social locals setting this can be the place . I didn't know if my waitress was giving me space to eat , or didn't care to check on me . I wanted more out of my experience and left feeling a little disappointed. I hope the owner will read this and step up his game which I know he can . Thanks til next time
So many great food items....I love the veggie scrammie...I can't get enough of the arepas, and the lavender mimosa is yummy!!
Great service & very friendly staff. Get the Arepa Benny with a Cortado to wash it down .

Makers & Finders: Urban Coffee Bar


I was in the mood for something trendy and have wanted to try this place for a while, so here I find myself... downtown, hair still yet to be brushed unless you count my pillow as a brush, and in plaid pants and a shirt that reads "WILL RUN FOR WINE." I guarantee you I will do just about anything for wine. 


The outdoor area is spacious for a small location and more importantly, not overcrowded with tables AND clean. Upon walking in I am pleasantly greeted and find a nice small seat. The décor is unassuming, clean, and welcoming. Again, spacious. There is plenty of room to move, unlike so many other restaurants that try to cram in as many tables as they can. The waiter is warm and soft spoken with a light accent.


I was pleasantly surprised to find a Hispanic theme to the menu (see how I do my research first...blindly) but needed some form of caffeine running thru my veins before I could comprehend words I feel like I should know but couldn't process while still foggy from laziness. My eyes immediately gravitated toward the Lavender Infused Latte. Done. Two shot of espresso on the side as well, please. And I logged on to the ever encompassing internet after not having it for a week, I am hoping my inbox hasn't self-destructed in my neglect. The waiter came back to ask if I really wanted 2 espresso shots on the side...I knew there was one in the latte right? He was still all smiles and sweet, he really was just trying to make sure I didn't make my heart explode, or perhaps accepted full responsibility for it. I assured him my ticker could handle the caffeine he was going to deliver. 


The latte wasn't sweet. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. It is served with a little heart in the foam, I wonder if I am the only one that finds that humorous? The latte is magnificent. It is creamy and clean. No after taste and the lavender is gentle, it isn't like swallowing Bath and Body Works Lavender Bath Bomb. There is no pull of artificial flavoring and the lavender opens more as the latte cools to room temperature. The espresso...I don't even remember it. But I do know this...I don't remember it because it was smooth, it was properly brewed, and left no after taste. I remember it because I can start to feel its wonderful buzzing in my skull without the need to wash a bitter flavor away.


Ok. Caffeinated. Can digest menu now. Hah. Pun. 


Ripened Mango Arepa. For those of you that don't know what an Arepa is, I have graciously googled it for you. It's a corn pocket thingy that is crunchy on the outside and still creamy inside. In other words, it's fucking delicious. The menu description is as simple as this: Ripened Mango, avocado, queso fresco, basil and thyme aioli. The flavors were surprising and dynamic, though I wish the mango was a bit more pronounced and the side of sauce they served with it was a bit heavy handed. The only real comment I have on this is to please serve with a sharper knife. The arepa is so beautifully done but it has to all get squished to be cut and the flavors are all lost. It's like a treasure hunt to appropriately self-balance the flavors on one's own fork, I assure you it was well worth the task, BUT...a sharper knife would have been perfect to slice thru that buccal artistry.


In conclusion. Get better parking. I like it here. 

**disclaimer:No idea if they sell Lavender Bath Bombs but one would assume...I am not girly enough for that.**
Loved this place. Super cute, good service. Different food to choose from and great drinks and coffee. Highly recommend

This urban coffee shop totally knocked my sock off. 
For staters. It is nestled in Las Vegas arts district, in a random spot with poor parking. But, this place is an absolute gem!! From their decorations, to the environment, the coffee they craft and serve, to their carne desmechada!!! (Not sure what this was, but order it, you won't regret it).

It's a coffee house that care about the quality of their coffee and tea, they offer multiple brewing methods that add to the experience of a coffee junkie! Their cold brew coffee is simply on point, no sugar or cream needed. Natasha (wife) ordered an iced lavender latte; a little out of the box for me, but this drink was seriously delicious! 
The environment is chill and very welcoming. 

But wait, they serve Mexican comfort dishes!! Shrimp ceviche, little empanadas with perfectly marinated shredded beef in them, even smoked salmon bagels ( a must try). 
 
This place is unique and ran by people that care for the quality of their work.

This is honestly my favorite place to eat. I come here at least once a week, seriously! I love the breakfast! Dinner is good, wish they would add more items for dinner though. Coffee is amazing!! Kind of pricey, but it's worth it so I don't mind. Employees are helpful and nice. I don't think I would change anything about it, I just love it here! 

Also, they just opened new location in Summerlin...so check them out if you're in that area.

This place was a gem! If you want good food in Vegas this is the place for you! We were only in Vegas for 3 days and we managed to eat here twice. I will recommend it to everyone who tells me they're going to Vegas. They are that good! There was four of us and we managed to make a dent in their menu. We tried and ate many things and loved everything we ordered.

As usual we found this gem on Yelp. Wanted to have nice brunch away from "the strip". We looked thru the photos and saw the beautiful presentation of the menu items and various lattes they have. We are so happy we tried Makers & Finders Coffee. They did not disappoint. First off easy street parking right in front. Can't say that about the strip.  We were seated right away and our waitress Jen came immediately with menus and water. We tried the La Paisa Arepa carne and Arepa Benny. Both so good and flavorful. Eggs were perfect and runny the way we like. The beef tender and moist. Wife had the Lavender infused Latte and I had regular pressed coffee. She loved the latte. Hints of Lavender and not over powering. The coffee smooth and strong. Not bitter. Just what we needed for morning after the casino. Oh yeah. Had cravings for French fries last night so we tried their crispy fries. Nicely seasoned and crispy. Great with the aioli sauce. Prices very reasonable for the quality of the food. Portions are very satisfying. Finally the service from Jen and her associates was exceptional. They came by several times during our stay to check on us and always with a smile. Very happy now. Will tell our friends and visit again.

Really enjoyed our breakfast here. I tried the lavender latte, which was amazing. It was an explosion of lavender flavor in my mouth without tasting artificial or too sweet! My friend and I split the Arepa Benny and the empanadas platter. I thought the Arepa Benny was very unique. The empanadas were a little different -- deep-fried and almost like a pastry. Overall everything tasted very fresh and flavorful. Would definitely return!

Limited menu during Sunday Brunch and we were disappointed that Sautéed Brussels was not on the menu. 

When I unfolded my napkin, I noticed that there was a piece of chewed up gum stuck between the folds. It was quite revolting. The server promptly replaced it with a stack of new napkins. I highly doubt that a patron would reach over to another table and placed the gum in the napkin. More than likely, the patron probably placed the gum in one of the extra napkins that was given to him/her and the server thought the napkins were unused and redistributed them. Not a hygienic practice.  

We ordered the Breakfast Bagel, Arepa Benny, and an Iced Chai Latte. The Breakfast Bagel did not look like the ones I've seen in the pictures; thin slice of egg, a smudge of avocado spread, few specks of bacon, and invisible cheese on a badly burnt bagel. It was flat in both appearance and taste.  The inside of the bagel halves was so burnt, I couldn't eat it. My companion and I were going to share the dishes. She was too polite to return the food so she ate the burnt bagel. The egg on the Benny was perfectly cooked but the arepa was so dry it tasted like cardboard. The $4.50 12oz Chai Latte with 1/3 ice tasted like a diluted horchata. I tasted way better horchata at Sweet Tomato. 

Maybe it was just a bad day. I am willing to give it another try but definitely not on a Sunday.

I ordered the Mexican Late, and my expectations were definitely exceeded.  I accompanied it with the Arepa Benny, and everything was delicious! 

I will definitely come back to try the rest of the menu!

So glad we found this place!! Great food and coffee! I had the el paisa arepa the sweet plantain was so good we also tried the sliders and they were really good also. Definitely going back! Coffee stop!

Great place for breakfast! Frequented by locals and very popular. The Smoked Salmon Lox and Café con Leche were Excellent! A bit of an Industrial atmosphere but still friendly. Highly recommend. 

This is a Second Amendment Friendly establishment.
Love the Steak Ceviche paired with the lavender mimosa. :D

So sooo good!!! I love this spot. Great coffee selection (I love the honey vanilla latte- and they offer a lot of milk alternatives for us non dairy people). The breakfast croissant was great and I enjoyed the empanadas. The vibe is very urban and trendy- perfect for downtown.  Price is affordable as well. I can't wait to go back and try more on the menu!

For my money, this is the way new Vegas food  spots needs to be moving. If there is a micro trend downtown (or in smaller neighborhoods) please let this be it.

My hopes for this new trend that are embodied by Makers and Finders:

1. Great tasting food  prepared well. 

2. Food with a cultural touch point that provides a flavorful influence on the dishes.

3. Helpful and attentive waitstaff that know the menu and seem pleased you are there.

4. Responsive management who checks on you when they learn there is possible issue with an order.

5. Delicious beverages.

6. Creative and welcoming decor.

I really like this place. I've found my regular dishes and have only had one "off" experience with them. Lots of places serve chilaquiles in town, but this is one of the few spots that ensures the chips are crisp and the salsa is flavorful. I think the salsa (when it's on point) makes the dish for me. There's some dimension to the dish and it's more of a modern interpretation---but the bits that make chilaquiles so comforting are there. 

Makers and Finders is lovely. It doesn't feel like an attempt at an LA or San Fran style coffee shop. It feels like downtown Vegas with its eclectic art and complicated coffee all set to a Latin beat. I love eating there and I can't wait to get back.

EDITED TO ADD: I'm noticing less consistent preparation if one of my favorite dishes--the chilaquiles.  Each time I visit they are prepared differently. I love the new menu, but I'm less enthusiastic about this place than I once was. Right now they are a solid 3.5.
Ambience was great, my waiter was great, and the lavender latte was delicious. Comfy little couches to relax with a book on the patio.

Visited this location on 6.3.18 at around 1:30 pm. We had just been to the downtown Summerlin location the day before and we liked this one better. They have a nice completely covered patio, great coffee, good service and good food. This fine I ordered the salted Carmel latte and downed it! It was so delicious!
I had the Kale and Mushroom Omelet which was really good.  My Salted Carmel Latte was delicious. Our sever was excellent. We will be back. I want to try  the dinner menu.
Great friendly place with a chill vibe. Highly recommend if you want to get away from the strip.

Best culinary experience I've had in Las vegas! Coffee is perfecto and the atmosphere is just plain happy!  Find it! Live it! And be happy!  Oh, and wait, they just  turned it up a notch...espresso flan! Ya, you need to find this!

I typically don't give 5 out of 5 but this place is amazingly good and a hidden treasure! We have decided to ALWAYS stop by when we visit Vegas going forward. Ask for Jen she is awesome host and very courteous and helpful for newbies who want to get recommendations! MUST VISIT and try any of the coffees (our favs were Flat white, Mexican Spice Latin or Caramel Salted Late)

Oh man fantastic the coffe hands down is WOW wow wow !!! tumeric coconut vanilla infused with Maca and expresso its my new go to super antioxidants rich and the bkfst hash wow gluten free soy free non/gmo and all organic I had the chiliquitia  this morning my go to  and favorite bkfst when I travel the world .. I can't say enough this is a great great little stop . The entire staff is fantastic very very knowledgeable to a T AND getting greeted when you walk in is a bonus 
Thank you HairDoc Tk
Well worth the trip away from the strip. Great food and vibes. Lavender infused latte is bomb and the omelettes are delish

Makers is truly the best! The food is outstanding and the coffee is creative and and authentic. The staff is gracious and efficient and cares about the customers. You gotta try the Arepa Benny for breakfast. Great for brunch, meetings, work, or an afternoon caffeine stop.

Didn't get to try much this visit because I snuck in around closing, but can't wait to go back. They showed me around a little and I left with a delicious iced coffee. I've read people saying how they pick up on flavor characteristics in coffee(like people do with wine) and that is something I never have done until today. The cold brew coffee was delicious.

Honestly the best breakfast I've ever had. I'm in love with their ambiance AND their patio! It's definitely cool inside and cozy outside. What a great place for a meeting or breakfast with a friend. I had the beef and avocado hash. It came served in a cast iron skillet and was absolutely delicious. Is it weird that I think it was awesome to have a normal human portion rather than something I could never finish? Got the honey vanilla latte as well and it was awesome. My friend enjoyed their breakfast as well! Great idea to serve them in clear mugs. It really complements the wooden decor.

Well, this place just lost a great following.  I understand service animals should display tags especially when entering a place serving food. It is, however not ethical or required that I give explanation for my service animal. If someone brings in a child which stinks of the poopy diaper its got; will you ask that parent to remive their crappy baby for sanitation purposes?

Great customer service! Extremely friendly staff, and always helpful. 
Their café con leche is my favorite!

This place specializes in coffee brewing methods.  Pour overs, aero press, monks pot, siphon, iced drip, Cuban, etc.  Several beans offered.  All organic fair trade.  Also several Tea offerings.  Food menu is equally impressive for breakfast and lunch. Service was great!  Above average.  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because they don't roast there own coffee here at this location.  What a gem!
Best Mexican coffee and delicious food. Wish they were open longer so I could enjoy an evening coffee. Workers always friendly and make good recommendations.

This place is legit.
They definitely know their coffee.
Got a black Columbia pour over. So smooth.
Wife got lavender fog iced. Not on menu but the guy just invented on the spot and it was awesome. I even hate lavender and I thought it was good. Not too sweet and perfect level of flavor.

chill spot!!!"... i had a kale and chorizzo omelet.... meeeeeeeeaan!!!!!!"...... great atmosphere and feel of downtown lv"......
#familiabc #bluenosegang

Super cutie ambiance.. Delightful customer service. The waitress' worked as a team it seemed.. Serving all the tables.. One took our order another one brought us condiments, then the first one brought our drinks.. As soon as we were seated we immediately were poured water by Josh. I had both my children and though the place is extra trendy they accommodated my kids very well. 
Food was above average. I had the kale mushroom chorizo omelette.. Chorizo was a little to salty for my taste. But the kale was cooked very well! Bf had the carnitas skillet.. Again above average taste. portion wise though he could have had more, but not a big deal. My son had the croissant sandwich w/maple bacon; egg was fluffy and he ate a whole half.. which for a 7y/o was more than enough. The issue was w/my daughters chicken tinga omelette. :\ she got about halfway through it and then she discovered egg shells. Seemed very strange but we let the waitress know she offered another plate, but it would have been a waste. So she just took it off our bill. Not sure what that was about, but overall enjoyed the white chocolate iced latte and hope to be back with the bf for a cute breakfast date.

My new favorite brunch spot.!!!! The coffee is literally to die for.!  I had the Caramel latte (A MUST TRY)  and my friend had the matcha green tea and another recommended coffee. Only thing I didn't like was how long it took to get our coffee, though I was busy talking away, it did take about 20 minutes just for our coffee, but it was worth it hahaha. Anyways I would probably never want to have coffee anywhere else. Haha It's the prefect spot to meet up with a friend and have brunch any time of the week.! I didn't have the food this time around but it looked just as delicious.! They have a location in Downtown Summerlin as well.!!!!

Great place for coffee and a nosh. 

My fave (so far) is the Mexican Spice Latte -iced, because it hit 112 today.

(Oh, Vegas in the Summer. You're like a bad relationship with great sex. We know that you're gonna bitch-slap us come July, but we just can't quit you)

...but I digress

Service here tends to move at a fairly contemplative pace. But it's a fair trade. They don't rush you as you gently nurse your cappuccino, so give them a few extra minutes to make your lovingly and beautifully prepared meal. 

The location is in the up-and-coming (i.e. Gentrifying) Antique Row. Very near great shops like Retro Vegas and Desert Buddha -and of course that perennial favorite, Buffalo Exchange (It's not a store, it's a lifestyle) 

My only request: please add a few more vegetarian options to the food menu. Right now, I'm driving up from Henderson just for the coffee and the hang. I'd show up more frequently, (and spend more money) if there were a few more veggie choices. 

Great Place!
Such a great experience at Makers and Finders! Great service, such a cute atmosphere, and great vibes throughout the entire restaurant. Their salted Carmel latte is honestly the best thing in life.

I was in Vegas for the weekend and got tired of the strip and all the food options there so I looked up this gem on yelp. They had great reviews so I headed there for Sunday brunch. They have an patio but it was too hot to seat out so I made my way inside. Service was prompt and I already knew what I wanted to eat. I ordered the Hibiscus mimosa, chicken Tonga omelette with bacon and avocado and the Coconut Tres Leches.
The mimosa was just okay my think it would've tasted better with some syrup. The Omelette was the star of the show. The waffle was underwhelming but I guess I had really high expectations. It's still the best bfast I've had in Vegas so far so I'll definitely recommend. 
Pros . Excellent 
Service and omelette . I'll try other cocktails next time
The food is really good and the coffee is crafted well. I love the area in downtown Las Vegas too. Plus Norman Reedus recently stopped by.

Unique and delicious. Try the lattes; eat some food. Just do it.

Makers & Finders seem to specialize in some pretty cool lattes. I mean, where else can you try coconut and turmeric with your coffee? Yes we tried it, and yes it was delicious.
I also tried the lavender coffee which had some dried lavender bits on top. Strong, house-made syrup - not too sweet. It was very aesthetically appealing, BUT I really didn't want to know how those little dried bits tasted tasted. 

Tres Leches Waffle.
Chorizo Omelette. 

Yup - both delicious. The whipped cream had tiny little coconut shreds in it! My only (very mild) complaint was that the omelette was somewhat oily, BUT that's to be expected if you're gonna eat chorizo. The omelette even comes with plantain chips! Mmm.

Soooooo good.  The street it's on along with many of the side streets are under construction so beware, however, so worth it!!!  The food is amazing and delicious!  The drinks are heaven.  The Mexican spicy latte was my favorite more so than the honey caramel latte, but both are good!
Brunch is where it's at! Coffee, good! Service, good! Food, good! Friendly people here. Great comfortable atmosphere.

Lol. I was a little skeptical with the price but I have to admit I am impressed.

I just came for the lavender infused latte.  I like trying new, different and original flavors especially when it comes to coffee.  I've had a lavender latte before but it's hard to find at coffee shops. 

Their lavender infused latte is actually really good! 5 stars for that. My husband was skeptical but interested in their lemon bar latte. I made him try it. He loved it. I liked it too.

Their coffee is not too sweet or overly strong. It has a nice subtle hint of flavor.  They use crushed ice like Coffee Bean and tea leaf. Their iced lattes are perfect for this hot Vegas weather.

Interior is clean. Service was nice and pleasant.

I'm from Seattle, so I have a pretty large amount of experience visiting coffee shops and cafes. This place was so much fun. It's located in the art district of Vegas, so it has a fun hipster vibe to it. The interior design was really cute and very photogenic. Our server was super nice and did a really good job on checking in with us and getting our food and drinks quick. I had the vanilla honey latte, and I'm so glad I did. It was absolutely delicious, might have been my favorite latte thus far. 

We also tried the lavender latte and that was a great contender for coffee drinks. Definitely get off the beaten path of Vegas brunch and come check out this place, it's a quick Uber ride off the strip.

If you come to Vegas and you want a great breakfast and cup of joe this is the place! We had the egg and bacon on a sesame seed bagel with avacado cream sauce. It was delicious. They have excellent coffee and my said she had the best chai tea latte ever!

Where coffee is an art form. Try the coconut, turmeric latte either hot or iced, it is perfectly spiced.  I also had the salted caramel late, the perfect balance of sweet and salty.  

The eggs Benedict are served on an arepa which is Gluten-free,  yay!  I had the Salmon Benny.  The egg was perfectly cooked and the Salmon lox quality was great. It came with plantain chips.

Went on a Saturday around 11am, food was very delicious.  No wait.  Good coffee.  Unique breakfast dishes.  We ordered empanada sampler, salmon benny, poutine fries, and shrimp ceviche.  All the dishes were good.  I think I would have added more plantain chips to the ceviche though.  Everything was very fresh.  I think the poutine fries were probably my favorite even though the dish was the most simple.

This is a great blend of coffee and food. It's pretty hard to find a place that serves food and also knows the legit coffee scene. This is definitely that place. 

That being said, their coffee didn't wow me, but it was very solid. To get a pour-over with an omelette is pretty cool.

I found this place waiting for my yoga class. There's a ton of construction so parking can be tricky especially during busier times. I went in just to get a togo coffee and first of all the playlist for this place was amazing..think Camp Lo, A Tribe Called Quest, Nas etcétera, so because of that I really wanted to stay and enjoy the ambience and try the food. All the dishes I saw looked really good. They have a Latin themed cuisine which includes staples like Arepas, Empanadas and a some other Latin comforts. I had the Chorizo Omelette with spinach, mushrooms and Parmesan and it came with some plantains on the side that I crunched up on top of the Omelette. Such a win since I was just expecting a coffee shop! Love this place and I'll be back for drinks before I leave Vegas.

Such high expectations for this place, but left kind of disappointed. We ordered the arepa benny and Latin hash, from all the recommendations. Presentation wise, the food looked great but I thought it lacked flavor. 

The arepa benny was just okay, the hollandaise sauce could have been better. The Latin hash was on the smaller side flavor wise didn't really stand out. My favorite items were the plantain chips...

Being first to a market has it's advantages. Maintaining quality and growing a business takes consistency, and a systematic approach to all layers of service. 

When "Makers" first opened in the Arts District of Las Vegas in October of 2014, we were thirsty for a neighborhood coffee spot, and they delivered. Plus, they brought an amazing menu with incredible food options.

How lovely it was to be part of the first group of regulars. Daily hugs and smiles. 

Always a great place to get coffee with a laptop, or meet a contact for a lunch meeting. 

As an original customer, I'm a bit biased, but in all honesty, I'm constantly amazed with the plethora of new faces that come and patronize my favorite spot. Endless networking opportunity. 

When the team decided to extend the hours, to include dinner time, they extended the menu. The new menu kept all the classics, like my favorite Arepa Benny, but it also added a handful of more affordable and filling options. They also added great Happy Hour options, and alcoholic beverages. 

Rumor has them opening a new location in Summerlin this fall, that'll be great to meet my peeps who don't often frequent into the downtown districts. 

Keep it up Ya'll

This place is bomb! Had brunch this morning and it was a perfect way to start the day. I had the arepa benny with a honey vanilla latte and my Auntie had the ceviche with the lavender infused latte.  It all tasted amazing. The coffee was some of the best coffee I've had in a long time. The atmosphere is super cute and trendy, and I love that they have outdoor seating. Saw a few dogs outside while their owners enjoyed their brunch. Can't wait to come back again and try something new!

My husband and I are very disappointed with our experience here. We were so excited to go because my husband is a huge coffee fan and loves trying new places in town - PLUS all of the great reviews that there were. However, our server Josie was in such a rush and saw us only to seat us and take our order. She even passed us multiple times after we received our meals and still never asked how we were or if we needed anything. I was pointing to what I wanted to eat when ordering and she still suggested something else which gave me the impression that the meal I originally wanted wouldn't be good enough. My husband said that his sandwich that he ordered tasted so bland and plain and wasn't satisfying at all. The only two good things that came out of this was our coffee and the gentleman that was helping us throughout our meal since our server wasn't helping. If I had cash on me I would have tipped him rather than our server. We both are in the restaurant/hospitality industry so we understand the importance of customer service - just wish our server understood that as well. We unfortunately won't be going back to makers & finders...
The cortado, lavender infused latte, coconut and turmeric latte and honey vanilla latte were so good. Priced fairly and the ambiance is so relaxing and non pretentious. Looking forward to visit again

This was such a great find. We were in Vegas for the weekend and went twice for brunch. The empanadas were delicious and the lavender coffee was amazing! This will definitely be a regular for us when in Vegas.

Ok. I am a fan of good coffee. Walking into the place, very impressive. I love all the different styles of coffee that you can have made for the customers' enjoyment. I ask for a specific type of coffee, being a coffee place silly me figured they would be able to assist as I like coffee but I am not an expert. I asked for moka, the coffee that is made in the special top part pot, I am not sure if he or I pronounce it right. He ask what origin, which in turn I ask what's the best one.  He offered no assistance and seem like he had better things to do. He even turned me off of wanting by saying coffee grounds would be in my coffee, with no explanation to why. Just did not feel as if the worker was up to par as this place looks amazing for coffee. Now I will probably ever know because of the customer service experience or should I say lack of.

I came here today for the first time as we were looking for a place nearby for breakfast and I fell in love with it. I want to try at least 1/2 the menu right off the back. The servers are very knowledgeable of the menu and attentive. They have an indoor and outdoor sitting area and cool with dogs outside as there were people there with a very friendly pit bull. Lots of Latin influences including Cuban coffee. They have a brunch menu and soon will be opening for dinner I learned from the waiter. The only downside was the shared bathroom with other stores but it fits right in with the overall atmosphere of the place. Also they give a military discount. Can't wait to come back here again!

I came for the coffee. They don't make their lattes with condensed milk on ice bc the condensed milk doesn't dissolve. So that was a bust on the semi hot day. I did decide to get a different latte, as did my friend. Both seemed too milky, the ratio of espresso to milk was off. They served the lattes in mason jars but if they aren't going to add an extra shot then they should get smaller mason jars bc I'm not a cow man. 

The food was yummy. Sliders and fries for the kiddo, I can't recall my dishes name but it had mango. I wanted the plantain chips and it was served with only 2. What's that all about? I need a crunch with my meals homie! 

My friends dish was good too, sorry I can't place the names of anything. 

It felt like we were in LA. The patio was wonderful and perfect to accommodate lunch with my 4 yo and a friend. I loved this hipster coffee shop.

Best tomato bisque in town. It's a quaint, modern-aesthetic cafe downtown with a cool vibe. Their Mexican-infused coffee is pretty good, and just about any other thing they serve as well. Three stars because their customer service is subpar. I understand they're trying to create a more casual environment however that does hinder them at times since I did have to basically attack a waiter to bring me the check after I attempted to get their attention multiple times. They never once bothered to ask if I needed anything.
Cute cute cute, but staff not friendly. Ordered a tea and my friend ordered coffee. Both good.

I don't know about this place. I was really pumped to come here and try the coffee, but I think my definition of a cappuccino differs from theirs. Mine is a thin layer of foam and theirs is about 60% foam. Serious! So I felt like I was drinking a badly poorer beer for the most part and then that just threw me off everything.

The food we had was pretty good. Croissant and a Latin American dish. And I'd definitely go back for that. But the coffee was a travesty.

Can only comment on the delicious iced latte I got from here, but definitely the neighborhood spot for a quality hand-pour coffee or espresso, and they have a food menu as well, I look forward to trying next time. So much better than going to a Starbucks and getting a mediocre-at-best drink -- support this and other Vegas local businesses, will definitely visit here again next time I'm in town!

Best. Coffee.  Period.  Some of the best coffee I've had and such a great atmosphere in downtown to hang out.  I'm from Portland, the mecca of coffee shops, and this place lives up to all of those and hands down out of their league.  The lavender latter is my favorite.  Customer service is on point and I haven't had anything I didn't like to eat off their menu.  Congrats to M&F, keep on, keeping on!
Honey Spice latte was good. I was definitely a fan of their latin hash. It was definitely tasty. Service was great too.
Great coffee that is very very unique. The salted Carmel latte is delicious if you like sweet stuff. def go there if you are a coffee lover like I am.

B-b-b-benny and the jets! Holy mother of Benedict! Makers & Finders really churn out some primo breakfast. Their arepa benny is my absolute fave. Those tasty little hunks of heaven were devoured with enthusiasm on my recent trip to the Hop Nuts neighbor. I knew they made amazing drinks but that was my first time brunching there. My companion ordered their smoked salmon benny and was pleased as well. They stole the spotlight from their delicious lavender latte and quite possibly the best damn chai latte I've ever had. Kudos to you Makers & Finders! The patio is pet friendly and makes for a great spot to take in the arts district. Free street parking and usually plenty of it even with the current construction going on. I'll be back.

Discovered this local downtown LV gem via Yelp search & came here for a late breakfast with my hubby since it was only a mile from our hotel. The main draw was their unique trendy menu with healthy/vegan options & most importantly the Lavender Infused Latte. Wow! Not only did the Lavender Latte surpass my expectations, but everything else we ordered did as well (Veggie Benny, Soyrizo Brussels Sprouts, Mexican Spice Latte). I've had about 4-5 other Lavender Lattes in my U.S. travels & this place makes coffee with absolutely NO hint of bitterness or bad aftertaste. Also, their customer service is top notch. It's totally worth visiting for any- both traveler or local.

We came across this place while searching for gluten free brunch options.

The service here was super friendly, patient and attentive. It was really nice to have time to discuss menu options with our server and have it feel like more of a conversation than a brief data collection. Really great service!

The place is very relaxed and has a nice balanced atmosphere that's alive, but managed well by keeping tables spaced out enough to avoid it feel like crowded. As a result we really felt welcome and enjoyed our food and just being in the space. The sound levels are a little above average, which meant leaning in a little to make sure we could clearly hear each other at our table, but it wasn't loud enough for this to be a problem. 

Coffee, tea, water... were all amazingly good here.

The food was delicious and just the right portion size. Portion sizes here are about average for the US, which I find good. More is not necessarily better. 

It was tempting to go back here two days in a row but we decided to try somewhere else. Mistake! We should just have come back again! 

Parking around here is plentiful. No problems there. The area has a few other cafes and bars too, but otherwise appears kinda run down. Don't let that put you off, just like M&F proves, there are some gems in this area.

I highly recommend! A little off the strip, but do not let the surrounding area fool you. A very cool ambiance & loved the interior decor. Very hipsterish. We went for breakfast/brunch and were very happy with the overall experience.The staff was friendly and provided excellent service. The food was amazing.

Stopped by this cute little Latin themed spot in the Arts District. Attentive staff, nicely seasoned and prepared food. Had the Latin Hash. Great breakfast dish. Pulled beef, potatoes, jicama, peppers and a fried egg. Highly recommended

After a couple days eating expensive, unmemorable food on the Vegas strip, we stopped here along the way to downtown LV for some good lunch/brunch food. I was drawn to their breakfast, brunch and Latin food when I looked them up. The ambiance is casual but a bit hipster. Hipster or not, the customer service was good, they make you feel welcome and at home. We ordered the Latin Hash breakfast and the Bandeja Paisa Lunch. The Latin Hash had such an amazing flavor; the meat was tender and juicy. Potatoes and peppers were tasty with a little heat but it was manageable. The Bandeja Paisa was satisfying as well; it's a good dish to order if you're really hungry.
Finally, I wanted to mention the cold brew coffee. The fact that I didn't veer off and order one of their many other coffee drinks is amazing, because I was VERY tempted. But their cold brew was smooth and flavorful, not bitter, nor an acidic taste. Because of this, I didn't use as much half & half as I usually would do elsewhere. The prices here are reasonable. A really good experience overall.
The atmosphere is so so. Feels a bit like a parlor shop. I came to check out their coffee and I wasn't a huge fan. Their coffee was a bit bitter, kind of like Starbucks which I'm not a fan of.
