Super delicious! The service is great. The tinga arepas are delicious. Especially the coffee is so delightful. Good place to have a good lunch.

One thing off the start is that he had a notepad and did NOT write our order down  not cool ! But over all the food was great . Most items in the menu average under 10$ . I got the mushroom empanadas (I should of order 2 extra they are good ! ) but s little over price for what it is . My girl orders a veggie bagel for $9! Lol she enjoyed her lavender latte for $6 . I had the chai tea with almond milk :) everything was good the service was good and the location was fun. They have an outside patio and free wifi. Will come back when I have to meet with friends or having a meeting. Not as a personal place that've look forward going to .

The Veggie Benny arepas were a stellar recommendation and much appreciated. I am very satisfied with breakfast and look forward to my next.  

The dancing is great too. (Friendly attentive staff.)

Love this spot to work on weekends. Their food is very good and the place has a great vibe. They have a very nice patio where you can sit and enjoy the good weather while having a drink or getting work done.

The Arepa Benny is my favorite but don't miss out on the Espresso Flan. All of the coffees are delicious and the atmosphere is definitely super hipster. Fell short of 5-stars because the service is consistently slow but it is a hang out place so I'm guessing they're not expecting you to be in a rush.

This is a must go for us every time we're in Las Vegas. Coming from Los Angeles there are tons of indie coffee shops but this is probably my favorite one. I always get the arepas benedict and my fiancé gets the vegan hash and a turmeric latte. They had the turmeric lattes before it was trendy everywhere else. I got the honey vanilla latte this time and it was excellent. Fast and friendly service. Until next time!

The service is great and the drinks are definitely awesome. The arepa Benny was good and the kale chorizo omelette could have used more chorizo today it was just a lot of egg (sad face) 
I would try it again for sure but getting the empanadas sampler or the arepa Benny

For a first time visitor, the service was amazing; everyone was very nice. When I first walked in the door, I was greeted by the barista who asked me if I was expecting anyone else (I walked in alone). He gave me a menu and told me to take a seat and my waiter would help me out. The waiter was very friendly as well, asking me if I was expecting anyone and whether or not it was my first time there, helping me with suggestions on what's popular and what he liked.

I got an iced Nutella Latte and Arepa Benny. Both were delicious! The latte wasn't too sweet and was almost like a chocolate milk with some crushed ice. The Arepa Benny was delicious and I'd definitely have it again. The biscuit(?) it came on was a bit crunchy. The the beef was very well seasoned and flavored. The egg yolk was runny and delicious as well; perfect for being scooped up with the plantain chips.

Price is decent: around $5 for my latte and $10 for my eggs benedict.

Overall, good service, good food, and decent price. Good atmosphere for studying as well! Definitely recommended!
Fantastic Latin fusion! The best eggs Benny with arepas. The entire meal was great. Easy to recommend. A++++++++

Located in the Art District, this spot is an example of how awesome this area is.  Surrounded by businesses like Vegas-style second-hand shops and art collectives, it is a great place to stop in for a cup of coffee, chai, breakfast or brunch.  
The service was excellent.  We sat outside, as it was a perfect fall day, and were well attended to.  My husband is a coffee drinker and said that it was delicious.  I enjoy chai, since they offer the option of lavender in some of the other drinks, I asked for it in my drink.  It was delicious!  They will make your drinks to-go, if you ask.  
The food was great.  It was a fun mix of American and Latin flavors.  All of the food is fresh.  I had chilaquiles.  They had a lot of sauce on them, but the flavors were right on.  
Definitely stop in if you are in the area and enjoy being just far enough off the strip to relax a little bit.

Really like this cute, hipster cafe.

Concept is kinda odd, though - an espresso joint with Latin American cuisine and service at the table. That means it's not the kind of cafe often seen in urban cities that you sit down with a laptop and get some work done while sipping a nice cup of coffee and munching some pastries.

On the bright side, Makers and Finders serves better food options than a typical coffee shops. The Chicken Tinga was really good - crispy, thin crust with just the right amount of fillings - second to none in itself.

However, Ceviche de Camarones was a bit of let down - it's uninspiring and just too sour. I like sour Ceviche, but I failed to taste anything other than a bunch of lemon juice - my expectation was a delicate balance between sour, salty, and fatty.

La Paisa was good, but not as spectacular as Chicken Tinga.

The cappuccino was well crafted, not too milky and the powerful shot of espresso was present - comparable to Sunrise Coffee or Sambalatte. That alone makes M&F a great addition to the local coffee scene.

I'll come back and try more.

Outstanding breve flat white. My favorite drink!!
What more is there to say?
Why does Yelp expect a longer review?!

Their chai tea latte is really good. Their Benny was okay. We've had better, we've had worst. I enjoyed my Latin Bag way more. Don't forget to add some Chelula. They are on point with keeping your water filled, even when busy. One thing they didn't do such a good job at is getting our food out in a timely manor. It's a small place so not sure what the hold up was but they had to apologize three different times for how long it took for our food to come out. 

They have outside seating which is a plus. The service is good and they are overall friendly. Their hours are limited so check before making the trek downtown if you don't live there but at least if you miss them you can go next door to Hop Nuts brewing and grab a flight or a pint of some quality craft beer!

This is best breakfast place downtown. Great coffee and tea selection. Not too busy. The food is wonderful been here a couple times and want to come try everything on the menu. Prices were. Server Cynthia is awesome and was very helpful! Yay.

Hidden gem in The Vegas Arts District. When we drive in from L.A., we have to stop for their Lavender infused latte, honey vanilla latte and yummy empanadas. This hip and happening place is amazing and will not disappoint.
This place is only been here two years and it closes at 4 everyday so I recommend coming in as soon as possible because once the words out without great this place is going to be so hard to get into

My friend and I were so excited to have found this place on our recent trip to Vegas. The staff were extremely friendly and attentive. The decor is sleek and welcoming. I fell in love with the lavender latte. I had a light lunch with "grilled cheese" and tomato soup, but everything was cooked great and was delicious. Overall a great breakfast and coffee spot. Wish we had one in Tampa!

Loved the coconut latte! The staff is very friendly and since it was our first time here he was nice enough to suggest the most popular items on the menu. Not to mention they have some Latin beats in the background. I will definitely be back to this place.

I went here for the first time yesterday and really enjoyed my time.

I loved:

a) The staff - one waiter even brought over a table for me to easily reach my drink

b) The ambiance - the outdoor seating area is so cozy, lots of seats were available, and the customers all seemed high-vibe

c) The menu - lots of fun things here to try (most coffeeshops have the same boring things - I love the options here!)

d)  They use mason jars and glasses wherever possible

e) Fast wifi

I tried the honey-vanilla latte which was great and the coconut chai overnight pudding which was a little too strong on the honey for me. 

I'll definitely be back - maybe even today. :)

Coffee drinks were amazing.  Hot Mexican spice latte out of this world, iced honey vanilla latte fantastic.   Don't hesitate, just try it.  Great atmosphere, coffee and food.  Chicken tinga bene was a really good choice.

Came here for a yelp meeting. & this place is amazing! I tried their iced lavender infused latte which was soo good, not strong in flavor at all! As well as their empanadas, it was so flakey and bigger in size than i expected. I don't usually come downtown so meeting here i got kind of nervous especially because parking can be a pain. But there is 2 hr parking on the side on the street & in front (thank goodness) fairly small place but a great one at that.. definitely plan on coming back to try other items i didn't get the chance to my first time.

The coffee and food were delicious. I ended up getting the tumeric, cinnamon latte with the Latin hash. 

The latte naturally comes with two espresso shots, I asked for 1 and received a cup of java with cinnamon on top. After I mixed it in and drank it, it was so creamy you couldn't even taste the tumeric. 

The Latin hash came out on a skillet. Good portion and tasted like someone put care into their cooking.

Would definitely recommend as a must try brunch place in Vegas.

Chill and kind workers + great vibes and food. Loved how unique this place felt. If you're a foodie or coffee lover who's into trying things a bit out of the ordinary, I'd recommend swinging by for sure. 

Needed a meal before leaving Vegas and I'm so happy we ended up coming here. Before coming, I saw another reviewer note the reasonable prices here, which definitely turned out to be true. Considering how good everything we ate was, the price point was really the icing on the cake. 

EMPANADA SAMPLER: Immediately shocked by how fresh and crispy these suckas tasted as soon as I took my first bite. Tasty af. My family and I loved these.  

AREPA BENNY: Good and flavorful. You'd probably like it, especially if you're into the idea of arepas with a twist or eggs benny with a twist. 

Light tangent: I've come to despise egg benedicts at brunch because of how overpriced they often feel (I'm talkin bout those $15 conventional egg bennys you find at "brunchy" AF places if you know what I'm sayin) but decided to give this a try since our server recommended it and it sounded novel. This was probably the eggs benny with the best value to  price ratio I've ever had (and I used to eat a lot of them).

YUCA MASH: Good stuff, not pricey and def something a little novel. I really liked the texture (I would describe it but just try it yourself if you're reading this and intrigued!)

CUBAN ESPRESSO: I'd say go for it if you like coffee and haven't tried one before. We really liked this. Simultaneously sweet (without tasting artificial) and strong 

LAVENDER LATTE: I don't usually drink lattes because of how overly-sweet they are but our server assuaged me that their lattes are well-balanced. So I trusted the dude and took a leap a faith and man was he right. So good!! Subtle and smooth flavors and texture. Worth it, in my opinion.

(This review is based on the coffee and service only.) 
I ordered a lavender latter with almond milk and I didn't know what to expect. After the first sip I was hooked. It's so different from any other latte I've tasted. Service was awesome. Me and my friend were helped by Val and she's the bomb. The interior was super cool, perfect for downtown. I'll be back to try the food soon because the menu sounded mouth watering.

Although this place was a little off the beaten path my wife and I took a chance and were very happy with the results!  I ordered a lavender latte and my wife ordered a Mexican spice latte - both were the best lattes we've ever had.  For food we ordered chilaquiles and some other dish I can't recall the name of.  Everything was very delicious. The portion size was probably just perfect but I was left wanting more of that salsa verde.  The place was quite busy with both patrons dining in and ordering takeout.  This place is like a diamond in the rough.

Dope spot! Friendly service! I had the lox bagel which nearly knocked my socks off! Yummy! 

Glad to DTLV has places to chill like this. I would def frequent if I lived in Vegas.
Amazing food and the service is fast and courteous. Definitely will be coming here again.
Great music, food, drinks, and service! This is such a cute little spot. The coffee is bold and delicious. I had a coconut turmeric drink that was tasty.
Fun place to hang out in the Arts District. Food and coffee were great. Parking can be a pain but we lucked out.

What has happened to Makers&Finders? 

Two years ago when I moved to Las Vegas, M&F was one of the first coffee houses and restaurants I visited. We had a Yelp Elite event hosted here, featuring all things coffee. It was spectacular.  Since then, I've been back a few times, including for my birthday breakfast a year ago, and things were still swell. I liked introducing visiting tourist friends and family to this local hub. A solid 4-star experience between ambiance, uniqueness and quality of food offerings for the area, friendly and attentive service, and fine coffee and alcohol offerings. 

Fast forward to today, I wanted to introduce a friend of mine to coffee spots in the downtown area. M&F was at the top of my list. But it had been months since I last visited, so fingers crossed things would still be top notch.

Not so.  In short:
- the barista, who apparently is new'ish, was a bundle of nerves, rapid-fire chatter. I don't care how toked up you are on your own product, but calm the delivery, because you're making these two customers feel rushed and a burden.
- mad confusion over the use of the Yelp check-in discount. I was asked, "what's the name on the ticket?" What ticket? I don't work here. Just apply the discount. Or don't! I don't care. This exchange added some 5-minutes to delivery as they had to find someone else to untangle the register. And when I placed my card on the bill just after it was put in front of me? Ignored. Not busy...just wiping down some serving trays and idle chit-chat with one another while I stood there. Looking. Waiting. But when I said, "yo, can you run this?" one of the three now present sprung into action. Thanks!
- confusion as to where sugar and other coffee add-ins were located for my friend to self-doctor her iced coffee.
- said iced coffee was not of the quality I remember from back in the day. And $4 for a letdown?  Nah. 
- my latte glass mug had a chip in it. Some idiot could cut themselves. Check that, maybe, before serving? 
- it took some 10-15 minutes to make these two drinks happen, and to conclude the $ transaction. Good lord. It's just coffee. And less than $10. 

All that is to explain why my first year's experience with M&F was an easy 4-star, but today's disappointment dropped them to perfectly average. I've always loved the food in the past and the atmosphere. But customer service was super lacking today and not impressive at all to the New one. I know she won't be back. I will be, but not without concern for consistency of delivery.
Second time here and the service is horrible. The lattes are good. Food is ok, a bit of over priced. I wish service was better I would come more often. :(

Sorry, don't really understand the high reviews. I do like the location, easier to park than other downtown spots. I also like the decor inside, very modern hip. Well I did not come for the location or decor though. 

I ordered the Honey Vanilla Latte and I did like it but it is very milky tasting. 

I ordered the Empanadas (it said it came with 2) so I asked for one of the chicken tinge and one of the carne desmechada. They said yes not a problem then charged me 50 cents extra. It is just 50 cents, but I think they should tell customers if they plan to charge more. The sauce on top of the empanada is overkill, not in a good way. It is very strong and took over the flavor of the meat inside of the empanada, or was there barely any meat? Oh, that too. There was maybe 1.5 tablespoons of meat inside the empanada, and I did not like either one. I thought the price was really high 6.50 for 2 tiny empanadas. The meat inside was flavorless and the empanada pastry shell for lack of a better word was flaky and not tasty, I ended up eating the meat out of the inside and didn't eat the outside because it was drenched in sauce. 

On a side note it was 110 outside and I swear it must have been 85-90 in there. I am not sure if their air was broken or they are just trying to save money on cooling, but it was uncomfortable. I took the food to go because of it. 

I hope their other food is better with these high reviews. 

I would probably only be back for coffee and I am interested in the Lavender Latte.

I came here for brunch on our last day of Vegas before heading to the airport. It was convenient because it was on the way, but I felt like it was in a bad neighborhood. The cafe, however, was clean and hipstery.

I got a recommendation by the waiter with beautiful hazel eyes to get the lavender latte, so I did. It was the best decision I made that morning because it was delicious. I got the Latin hash which was ok.. not good but not bad.
They have the BEST chai latte here, it's so much better then Starbucks I can tell you that!! Amazing!!! ;)

First time today. The ceviche was amazing!! I will def. will come back for more!! The empanadas were good but super tiny! Everybody was super friendly! The only thing is i found it a tad overpriced comparing the size of the meal. 
But will come back!!
Cute place and delicious food, cafe con leche was amazing! Staff was great and friendly :)

This place was a recommendation from a good friend, and now I know why. There service was beyond great, we told them we were in hurry and they were about to accommodate us in no time. I can not wait to return to this place when I have more time to relax in this urban but chic environment.

The service is terrible every single time. The waiters have no personality and are so slow!!!!! I am now standing here waiting to my chai tea latte and it has been 20 minutes now......Maybe I leave? The only reason I returned is because I think the coffee is good. This will be my last visit here. Sad that they can't hire another person to make coffee. One person making coffee at a coffee shop doesn't make sense...

Always an amazing spot.  The coffee is better than public us and the vibe is just as hip.  They have the most amazing coconut turmeric latte that will be the best first step in your hangover cure.

Great for breakfast,  brunch,  lunch and dinner.  I also noticed they added a happy hour menu!!

Great outside patio and located adjacent to the best brewery in town so you can fill your growler after you caffeinate!

Drop the "Coffee" part in the name and this probably would be a great experience. This review is based on a singular drink to go visit. Milk with a splash of matcha, and milk with a splash of lavender infused coffee. $10 with a yelp discount. Honestly the lavender latte isn't too bad, but the matcha... Wtf, I'd go to Starbucks for their matcha before this place ever again. Plus this place seems soley designed as a sit down restaurant vs a grab and go coffee shop. Both drinks also had a chalky texture, not sure what that's about...

I'll take a Nutella white mocha latte please. On ice in the summer heat...

Love the coffee here! The honey vanilla and coconut turmeric lattes are also fabulous and this vibrant coffee house brews up all sorts of fun drinks and they also offer Latin bites. Favorites for breakfast are the Latin hash and arepa benny and for lunch I enjoy the empanada sampler which comes with 5 different empanadas! 

It's a cool downtown spot with fun art and details and lots of comfy seating inside or outside.

Amazing! The ambiance was fabulous and I love the outdoor patio. I had the lavender latte which was so tasty. It was really busy, so the service was a little slow, but the food and coffee definitely made up for it! I can't wait to go again!

My go to place - breakfast, lunch or dinner - when I am visiting Vegas. The food is mostly good, coffee is great and staff is nice. One time when the meat in our dish was overcooked, they replaced the dish and gave us a free dessert.

If you're anything like me you need coffee to function. I can't express how amazing their coffee and food is! There's such variety and food tastes authentic with an environment that makes you feel comfortable and relaxed. If you find yourself searching to try something new this is the place. You won't regret it.

I am giving makers & finders 3 stars because of their nice staff, cute interior  and live music on weekends. 
I'm a huge coffee lover and I have been here 4 times and I have liked only one of their lattes. Their coffee has a burn aftertaste which is hard to mask even with cream and sugar. 
Their food is about average. We had a group of friends trying their food and no one was blown away.
Great food and friendly service! A great place to start your visit in the new Las Vegas arts district!

Two words... FUC*KING AWESOME!!!! 

Food, drinks, coffee & service!!! All impeccable! 
I adore this joint!
Amazing breakfast. Had Bacon and Brussels Chirp Breakfast Gluten Free and really loved it.
Great coffee! I dropped in before yoga class, and I had the lavender infused latte and it was so smooth and delicious.  Highly recommend it! Cute spot to just hang out with friends or yourself.
Fantastic find in the art district of Las Vegas ! Good quality , well priced and excellent service .
My boyfriend and I came for Sunday brunch.. I ordered the Kale Chorizo Omelet and it was absolutely delicious!!  Amazing food, great service, awesome atmosphere. We will return!!!

This coffee shop has a really cute vibe and modern decor. My initial impression is a good one and I'm really excited to try the food and drinks. My friend asked our server, Kevin, what's popular and he tells her it depends on her taste. Which just seemed like a weird answer. I told him it was it was our first time and wanted to try the popular items. Our server just seemed dry and uninterested in helping us. I asked him about the chicken omelette special and he was so vague. I was like fine I'll just try it. I asked Kevin twice if they has pastries and he just ignored me. Our lattes come out. I got the Mexican spice latte with almond milk and I wasn't impressed. It was luke warm and lacked flavor. It was just bland. My omelette was good. It was accompanied with plantain chips which were a also good. My friend got the tomato bisque which was also luke warm but pretty good. 
Our server left and we never had anyone come by our table after. Since I wasn't a fan of the latte I wanted to get an ice coffee. I had to get up and ordered from the manager. She came to our table and cleared everything off which we has already pushed aside. My friend got a chai latte to go and she said it was horrible. She ended up throwing it out. 
I love the vibe in here and the good was good but the lattes suck, luke warm and bland.

Since my first visit, I've popped in a few more times to grab a quick drink while in the downtown area but it wasn't until Restaurant Week that I gave their food another try. M&F had a $20 three course breakfast, including a latte, which was a great deal.

ICED LAVENDER LATTE: The way to my heart, served in a Ball jar. My server said this drink was best cold, and I have to agree with her. It was light and refreshing to prepare for the day's crazy heat.
AVOCADO TOAST: Lightly toasted golden bread with avocado, tomato, and queso fresco. Avocado toast is a favorite quick breakfast of mine and I enjoyed this version.
AREPA BENNY: Enjoyed this combination of flavors again, egg was perfectly poached, the arepa makes a great, solid base for this dish. Surprised I haven't seen more versions crop up around town.
BIONICO SHOOTER: Essentially a mini-parfait, with Greek yogurt, fresh fruit, and granola, this was a nice bit of sweetness to end the morning meal. 

I really like the trendy-cool but still cozy-local vibe this place rocks. Covered patio seating is available if you get there early enough that it's not too hot. There's bar seating with outlets if you need to multitask and get some work done. Bathrooms are in the back, shared with Hopnuts next door.
I went with latin hash and italian coffee  and to be honest the food is delicious and the coffee is really strong which i was looking for ... But its really expensive dont miss it out
Stop reading and just go order M&Fs delicious coffee and food.  I come here about ever other week and can't get enough.  M&F thank you for delivering a great café!  See ya next weekend.

Stopped by from out of town. The only coffee in our hotel was Starbucks, which neither my husband or I like. I had the light roast pour over and my husband had the medium roast.  They were both outstanding! We are kind of coffee snobs and we loved this place. Ed helped us and he was so friendly. The food menu looked amazing, we wished we could have stayed to eat. We will be back next time we are in the area !

Hands down the BEST coffee I've ever had. There's such a great selection to choose from, but my favorite is the salted caramel latté. The place has New York coffee house vibe, and that combined with the amazing service (and even better food) makes this my new favorite breakfast/brunch spot. Try the Arepa Benny, it's to die for!

Service is friendly and responsive and that's the good.  The coffee isn't bad it just isn't much. I've given this place several tries and just can't justify wasting the time, money, or calories when so many good coffee shops are in town.

The restaurant is serving fresh food and it is very tasty. They have a variery of food, for vegetarian and vegans. The service is excellent with lovely and friendly staff specially Paige. A variety of coffee beans are exist here as well. I really love the food and coffee here.
This place rocks!!!!! We enjoyed the coffee and food. Don't go here if you are in a hurry though. They have a huge line and take forever to make your food but it's so worth it.
Best coffee in Southern Nevada!  By the way the wait staff is RAD and efficient.

We walked in and wanted to sit at a table near the bar. The bartender told us to sit against the wall. We said we wanted this table. He wasn't happy about it, but let us sit there. Our server was really nice. 

We ordered Yuca Croquettes, Strawberry & Mango Salad, Spicy Mushroom Empanada, Shrimp Ajillo Empanada for food. We drank Thou Shall Matcha and Mexican Spice Latte. The food was flavorless. I thought it would be tasty since it's Latin food. The Matcha drink was so mild. The Mexican Spice Latte tasted like a Chai.

The decor inside is really cool and artsy.

My friends and I stopped here to break up a long road trip. The venue was the highlight. It was spacious and well-decorated. The food was good too but not so memorable that I would make an effort to go back if I was a local. The food was s little dry. Their vegan options were also limited, leaving one of our group members hungry after a small strawberry salad. Finding parking was pretty easy too. Overall, would recommend as a cute brunch spot if you have an hour or so to spare in Vegas.
I absolutely love their lavender coffee, the food is very decent, And the service can be slow at times but is worth the wait, specially for my fav coffee

Amazing quality food and coffee! I used to work at Starbucks and although not much of a coffee drinker I love their salted caramel! In terms of food the Brussels sprouts are to die for and you can never go wrong with a smoked lox bagel

Opened in late 2014 @makersandfinders has left it's mark on the developing Las Vegas Main Street. Less than a 15 min uber from the middle of the strip this little Latin comfort food restaurant and coffee bar gives locals and visitors a haven from the bustle of the strip. In the morning patrons can enjoy unique coffee infusions and amazing brunch specialties. Makers & finders is a pioneer in this up-and-coming area.

Went on a Monday afternoon for lunch - the place was really busy but our server was very attentive. Had the rajas arepas, didn't love it. Lacked a lot of flavor and I actually found a piece of plastic in my dish. Yikes! My daughter had the coconut tres leches waffle and didn't really eat it -- I felt like it had a funny taste to it too, and I love this kind of food. Latte and Matcha are really good! Wouldn't go back for the food.
Fantastic cafe in Vegas... away from the crowds, with great coffee and food. Staff are all very friendly... with an adjoining brewery, you can't go wrong!
This place is fabulous, our attendant Faith was extremely helpful, the food and coffee was exceptional, plus the vibes in this place is amazing. Strongly recommended.

Enjoying my Day with my Gran, decided to ride our bikes today. Feeling Hangry, and in need of coffee. I love this spot for meetings and brunch. Happily, the warm smiles from the staff made me relieved that a 5 year old with a bike is welcomed. I love sea salt Carmel latte.My grandson loves tea Chamomile is his favorite made with a twist we both were impressed. We both love the hash and the croissant sandwich . A must the fried plantain chips gave us the carbs to complete our adventure.

Makers & Finders Coffee is the place that offers you the heaven coffee taste. It has the vibrant atmosphere with the upbeat environment of coffee crafting. Visiting this place once in a lifetime is a must thing to do. It has the flood of inspired Latin food services. 

The setting of the hotel is worth unique and brightly lit with. Positive affirmations throughout are giving out the lively atmosphere that attracts a large fan base. 

In its main menu, you can order daily specials, coffee plus tea, breakfast, lunch, dinner, and beer or wine and cocktails.

Tried this place out because my wife and I love breakfast. We arrived early so it wasn't crowded. Server was nice but it took 15 min for my wife to get her coffee and from that point we wait at least 20 minutes from that point to get her Benedict and my crossaint sammich. 

My wife was very pleased with been Benedicts. 3.5/5 
Loved her coffee. 4/5

I was not impressed with my sammich. Plain, not creative, and small pieces of bacon. 3/5
OJ- small glass, decent  3.5/5

Place was clean. Hippster style. Menu was tiny. Near the ghetto. Wasn't impressed all in all, especially for $28 tab. 

Not going back.

Update:Omar has contacted me, offered some compensation for my experience. I will update my stars after I return.

Came here to meet a friend, wanted to try this place for some time. Worst service I've had. Worst service I've seen given to others. I was ignored upon entry, 2 parties were taken to tables before me, even after I held up 2 fingers and said "party of 2", the waitress walked past me, didn't even acknowledge me, and then took the people who came in 5 minutes after me. Then waited outside for water (it's 100 degrees plus out) and got nothing, people who had been sitting out here longer didn't even have their order taken when I got mine taken (still no water). I'm only giving 2 stars because the food was OK and the place was rather busy. Need a stationed hostess or manager to make sure people are served in order, or at least seated in order.
Amazing coffee and super tasty brunch eats! This place is a gem in a city full of greasy spoon diners.

Love love love this place. Came here multiple times during our vacation because the food, coffee and service were exceptional. 

The chilaquiles on the breakfast menu are amazing and the espresso flan is perfect (not too sweet).

The manager, Ed, chatted us up and didn't hesitate when we asked for recommendations for other places in the area to eat.

HAHAHA THIS PLACE SUCKS! what a joke
DO NOT ORDER THE LOMO SALTADO IT SUCKS; NO SAUCE ( THEY CHARGE EXTRA FOR SAUCE) 
what kind of lomosaltado don't have any type of flavor and no sauce.
my girlfriend order this breakfast thing that was okay.
the only thing that was good was the coffee that's it!!!

DO NOT ORDER FOOD HERE! NOT GOOD! and apparently UNETHICAL!!!

**My girlfriend got her credit card statement back they this place added a few extra dollars for their tips!**

Amazing. You have to try at least once, and I promise you'll be back again.  My husband and I had breakfast here today.  Shared a French press, and had the chicken omelette and the bacon and Brussel sprouts egg dish.  Both were delicious and so different than what you can find at other breakfast spots.  Our server Cody was awesome too. Top notch!

Short review: I love what they are trying to do here and the quality of their product is great. They seem to just have the typical hiccups of a newer place and that's ok. I think they're a great spot and I will be coming back.

Drinks: They have a great balance of variety versus over-abundance of choice. They have all of the standards that you would expect to find at a coffee shop, as well as choices that play more to their style (ex. the Mexican Latte). And while they do offer a good variety in drinks and brewing methods, they do not overextend themselves with choice and instead seem to focus on making a quality selection of drink. And, their sizes were great for the price. We ordered the Lavender Latte and Honey Vanilla Latte...both were delicious and the table-side drink spritz given as part of the Honey Vanilla Latte was fun. 

Food: They have a good selection of food. Unfortunately, we were full and only ordered the Elvis Press sandwich, but it was awesome. I definitely get the sense that many of the menu items  were family recipes passed down and truly are comfort food.

Service: Make no mistake about it, when the staff was attending to us, they were super-friendly and helpful. But, it seemed like it took them a while to get to us. I understand how crazy things can get but it seemed like there were a couple of staff members doing some kind of work on computers off to the side of the coffee bar rather than helping guests. This was an early Saturday afternoon and still pretty busy, so I would expect an all-hands-on-deck approach rather than leaving several staff members to juggle the whole restaurant by themselves. I don't get too worked up over this because I am in the industry and I understand, I am writing this mainly for them.

Our server was fantastic (I am so sorry I do not remember his name...but I know what he looks like). He was willing to help us out, gave us suggestions and seemed to have fun with things. The busser checked with us several times and re-filled waters. And even the co-owner (if memory serves from the article I read) even stopped by and was very welcoming. Even the hostess chipped in at clearing our table and got us our check...though I felt bad for asking her for it.

Facilities: The place is well-organized, clean and vibrant. I dig the industrial, open-ceiling look that's popular right now and they do it well. They have a good amount of seating, both indoors and outdoors, and can accommodate big parties. I wasn't really a fan of the plastic seats they use, they weren't uncomfortable, just sort of gave an odd sitting position. but that's whatever lol. 

Overall, this is a cool spot, I fully expect them to iron out their service and I will definitely be back again. I need to try me some comfort food while I hammer down another massive mason jar latte.

Cute spot with a delicious lavender latte that they're known for. Stumbled upon this place when I was looking for a cafe that had outdoor seating that was pet friendly. I ended up coming back the next day

This is a cute little spot in the downtown area. Don't let the "coffee" part of the name fool you. It's a casual spot, but there is table service (as well as counter service if you just want something to go) and a menu of tasty items. Breakfast is served all day. The lattes are fab. The breakfast items are my fav, but the arepas and empanadas are great too. The patio out front is a great place to sip coffee, eat lunch, and people watch. Feel free to bring your pup if you choose the patio. If laid back and tasty is what you're aiming for, this is spot is a good choice.
Ordered the areba benne and loved it. Accompanied with a cold drip coffee, chill ambiance, and low prices. Check it out!

Wanted a quality brunch, not too far off the 15 (headed to Zion national park). This place surpassed my expectations! Great tasting food, high quality coffee, in a really cool neighborhood with a lot to offer for vintage lovers.

Great food and coffee. Arepa Benedict all day. 

Great staff and customer service. We had a big party of 8 during Life is Beautiful and I called in to make a reservation. They told us they couldn't make a reservation but would try  to save us a table. They were able to seat us within 25 minutes when we got here. Thank you Ed!

Came here for the second  time last week with my lady and out of town friends . It's located off of Main Street (Arts District) by the antique stores and Buffalo Exchange...the cafe itself is a hidden gem, all the furniture and accents looks like stuff you see on Pinterest... It's definitely a Hipster cafe, minus the know-it-all attitude .. 

Upon arrival we were greeted immediately and asked if we wanted to dine inside or on the patio, we chose the patio, within 5 minutes we were served fresh ice water in cute mason jars and offered the menu, the cuisine is modern Colombian and very tasty .  We're coffee aficionados and I was so happy to see cafe' con leche on the menu, if there's Cubans in Vegas you know how hard it is to come by an authentic con leche. I chose the Lavender Latte and I'm so happy I did...Wow ! It's the perfect balance floral and not to sweet .. It's not too subtle but all your senses explode !


Once you're done at the cafe, make your way around the Arts District and check out the Arts Factory and all the antique stores off Main St.

Makers & Finders is my new go-to when I'm in Las Vegas. If I lived here, it would be a daily staple.  The coffee & espresso are top notch and the food is well above average. (Current favorite: Chilaquiles) The folks working there are warm, friendly and knowledgeable. The atmosphere is pleasant.  What more are you looking for, exactly?Looking forward to my next visit.

The food is good but the service was very disappointing. I sat for nearly a half hour watching the servers check in on everyone around me but had yet to even offer me a glass of water let alone take any portion of my order.

UPDATE
I've been 3 more times.  It's still absolutely amazing.
Great little place the service  too .. I highly recommend it! The coffe was awesome .. the food was delicious  .  The Makers & Finders Coffe is my new little spot  to go to worth the drive

We stopped in for breakfast and coffee on a Monday morning. As many other reviewers state, the lavender latte is delicious. We also enjoyed the nutella. They came out at the perfect temperature and strength. We had a breakfast egg sandwich on a bagel, and it was really good. They had this avocado cream cheese spread that added some flavor to the typical bacon egg and cheese. The guy next to us had a hash, and it looked amazing. The barista was really nice, and we will definitely return for lattes on our next trip. I can't wait to try more of their creative flavors.

When I first met the founders of Makers & Finders, Josh Molina and Valeria Varela I knew that both of our companies have something in common. Passion and Knowledge for our industry. I was impressed by the understanding they had on the wonderful coffee world . Since that day I knew I wanted to be part of the Makers & Finders family.  As one of the owners of Sin City Coffee & Beverage I am always proud to say that they are one of our best partners. They perfectly portrait the same philosophy our company was founded on.  The environment, efforts and dedication M&F team members put every day is what makes this place to be considered one of the best Coffee/ Restaurant in town. Thank you for letting us be part of this amazing family!!

I spent most of my time in LA studying at different cafes. 

I've been missing LA a lot lately. I knew that if I could find the right cafe, I wouldn't miss it as much. 

Welp, I think I finally found just the place! Love the layout and size. It was small, but everything was well spaced throughout the restaurant. There's a good amount of outdoor seating on the patio. Inside, there's a counter, seating area, and a couch tucked away in the corner. Different settings for different purposes! 

My sister got the lavender latte, and I got the honey vanilla latte. The espresso was roasted perfectly and the flavors came through really well in the latte! The honey vanilla basically tasted like horchata with coffee. Service was also pretty friendly. 

If you're into cafe hopping or just a solid cup of coffee, Makers & Finders is worth checking out. Definitely plan to revisit to brunch soon!

Love this place! 

It was easy to find since it wasn't too far from the busy cross streets of Main St. and Charleston. We were lucky to find a parking close to the location which was right outside of the restaurant. They don't have an actual parking lot in front of the location like you normally see here in Vegas. It was more of a location that was on the street and you would have to find "meter parking" if that makes any sense. They might have a parking lot behind or in a different location, you might just have to walk a little. 

The restaurant was very clean and down to earth. Very simplistic and not beyond crazy with decorations. We were greeted the moment we walked in and we pretty much sat ourselves to the closest table available. 

I tried the La Paisa dish and it was delicious! As soon as I read the description of what the dish consisted of, I was sold. The plantains chips that it came with was amazing! I mean the whole thing was just amazing!

I also tried the Lavender Tea Latte.. No words can express how wonderful this cup of tea was. I read the reviews before checking this place out and quite a few people recommended it so I just had to try it. I'm glad I got it because now whenever I come back again, that will be my go-to tea I'll be getting there forever and ever. Okay, maybe not forever but for awhile.

This was my first visit to this place and overall I think it has the potential to be better. We were not greeted as soon as we walked in, it might have been like 10 minutes before they asked how many in our party. The menu option is good. The cleanliness is something I would look into and make sure it's done correctly because the women's bathroom was completely nasty. There's only 2 stalls available, and the one that was available for my daughter the toilet was clogged. I had to unclog it and clean the seat for her. And the huge barrel trashcan next to the sink is NASTY. There were visible, bloody, sanitary products visible. That is the last thing someone wants to see before they eat.
It took about 20 minutes for us to get our food. It was good for the most part. The fries were a little too oily, but good. 
For my first time here I gotta say I had an ok experience.  Glad to say my husband and daughter enjoyed their time more then I did.

THE. LATTES. OMG.

I found this place from Yelp. Yay Yelp recommendations! From our hotel, it was a good half mile walk. With the Las Vegas heat being dry vs. humidity in Texas, the walk wasn't bad at all.

The lavender latte is my all-time favorite. I convinced my lovey to go back a second day and also loved the Coconut Tumeric latte while we were there for breakfast. 

Latin comfort food is definitely a plus in our book. Although, it is on the lighter side, not saying that in a bad way. We were starving by lunch time at the airport, so it makes for a good meal if you don't want to be weighed down.

The lavender infused latte (iced) should not be missed. I also had the chance to enjoy an iced honey vanilla latte that was amazing. Our party shared the ceviche de camarones which was infused with citrus flavor, light, and made rich paired with dried plantains. For lunch I had the brussel sprouts with chorizo. I am only taking away a star because our server, although well informed and nice, was not very attentive. Also, the food was delicious but not filling, so maybe 1-2 hours later everyone was ready to eat again and had to buy a second lunch.

Love love the coffee! I got lavender infused latte, their lattes price run from 4-7 bucks, Their brunch prices are from 7-15 bucks so it's not too bad.Their capirotada is good it's a bread pudding with Cinnamon infused honey and strawberries, it's a must if you go here. So the bad part. First time here I came on a Sunday eating alone it shouldn't be too hard to service me. First off I was the one who had to always always grab their attention to get me water, box to go, and my check. It took them awhile. So I had to ask another server by the way I'll put him on blast his names Johnny you suck very much I don't know what the girls name was but she was very nice a helpful thank you.

Came here for a quick iced coffee to go in the afternoon. There was plenty of street parking (2 hours) in front of the store. The place is pretty large with a lot of seating seeming to be available. They do serve food here, but I was only in for a drink to go. The staff was very busy, but still were able to explain their drinks. There seemed to be a large selection for beverages, but I like my iced coffee black, and it was delicious. Definitely will return for quality coffee!
This place has amazing coffee and food! Everything was so flavorful and different. The service was excellent. Whenever I'm in town I will definitely come back!
The lavender latte and food was great! It is a cute trendy place to eat on a Sunday afternoon. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the Hostess could have been a little bit friendlier.

I've been living in the downtown vicinity for almost 15 years now so have seen the ups and downs of the area through the years so really appreciate the emergence of this part of Main street.

The folks here really care about what they're doing but unfortunately still miss out on some of the basics: e.g., seating people, refilling waters, taking orders, fulfilling orders, etc.

I'll definitely be trying them again in the near future and hopefully they will have had all of the kinks worked out.

Am I really in Vegas?  This hip, cheery coffee bar/eatery is another win for Las Vegas's downtown Arts district.  Made to order coffee and made in house entrees is always a recipe for success.  Service is casual and matches the relaxed ambiance.  I'll definitely be back!
Kale chorizo omelet (I added a side of avocado) was phenomenal. Hip and Cute place. Would definitely go back.

The breakfast at Makers & Finders was fantastic. The Red Arepa and the coconut and turmeric latte was a great combo. Service was great, atmosphere was chill and prices were reasonable.  We will definitely return.

great place for coffee off the strip with a hipster, bohemian twist!

Vegas surprisingly has healthy places that Seattle doesn't even offer and this is one of them. Basically it's a new american/cuban restaurant with yuca, tumeric chai lattes, lavendar lattes..and even sides of brussel sprouts or asparagus :)

The prices are a bit on the higher end but worth it if you try something unique off their menu.

Our go to brunch/coffee spot in Downtown Las Vegas. Great coffee and amazing Latin food. And now they even have dinner....and their burger is to die for. Highly recommend even if you don't want coffee/food.....just say hi to the friendly staff.

WAHOOOOOOOO!!!!!!  So grateful to find somewhere that has replaced my darling, inventive, hometown, thoughtful breakfast spot!!!!!  Can't wait to bring my hubby back next week.

My friend and I went for Sunday morning brunch and a catch-up sesh.  Service was indeed slow, but I feel that it was purposefully paced for the experience.  Had it been a weekday, I would have been out of my mind with the tortoise speed of service.

I had the Mexican Spice Latte (sweet, with a deliciously gentle spice) and the Chicken Tinga Benny (spicy, but not painful, PERFECT eggs, plantain chips, magic!).   My friend had the Cortadito and Arepa Benny and loved all of it.

Can't wait to keep coming back.... and can we discuss how adorable that block has become?  I love this city and all the gems like Makers & Finders that keep popping up!

Latin hash has me wanting to go back.  Such a nice chill spot. Didn't get a coffee, cause I already had one at home but the quality of the service was excellent. The food was so fresh and warm. Comfort food for sure. I put the avocados on mine. Eating this dish was a reminder of sitting with my grandmother in Puerto Rico and was perfectly sized.  Amazing meal and experience.  Help local business. Great place in downtown Las Vegas.

Here is what I love about this place. I've only eaten there once and the menu options are limited, but the one item I choose was one of the most delicious breakfasts I've had, the Arepa Benny: golden poached eggs, coffee rubbed beef, grilled tomatoes, salsa verde hollandaise
DEEE-LISH-US

I ventured to try the Lavender Latte, which isn't my style to get flowery coffee. I am now obsessed over this coffee. I ordered this flavor at another popular place in Summerlin and it was an epic fail. ONLY Makers & Finders makes a kick butt lavender latte. Oh yah.. the staff is super friendly and yes, lot of so called "cool people" hang out there. 

So sad I don't live near you guys anymore, but I will still come visit whenever near

My friends and I walked into Makers for my birthday brunch. We've never been before but assumed they would be able to handle a 10 top. As we walk in a server says she has to go inform the manager that such a large Party has come in.

Things were good till Faith the server approached us. She asks if we are aware of the complications they have been experiencing today not being afraid to show her frustrations. We unaware of anything let her know that we've just arrived, and another server was helping us with our ten top. She then Proceeded to say in a fashion that implied 'I do not want you here' that the internet was down and they now have to hand write their orders. She then told us that it would take an hour to seat us and even longer to receive our food.

Being very frustrated with the way this woman spoke to us I stepped outside to speak with my friends and inform them of the situation. My wife then followed me outside and told us that faith had said "Today is the kind of day we wouldn't be afraid to turn away a ten top."

This is now why I'm writing this review, after serving for 10 years I have never seen such a poorly communicated situation to customers. If we had been kindly informed that the wait time was long and systems were down. I would have said thanks for letting us know and left thanking them for not wasting our time.

We will never return here and I hope you all work on your systems and processes.

Makers and finders is such a cute place. So glad they offer food too. Never knew it had Latin influences. Trendy coffee shop and food spot. Most people had their laptops out so they prolly go good wifi too. We ordered a lavender infused latte which was super good. U can actually taste the lavender. Also ordered the salmon lox which was pretty good. Nothing special though. Wish they put salmon on both bagels. The cream cheese was good. It had chives in it I think. My boyfriend ordered one of the arepas with an egg and shredded pork or beef and avocado with Spanish rice. He said it was delicious. Prices are decent. like $8-10 range a plate. Noise level is medium. Evenly spaced out tables and a couch in the corner. They even have a cute outside front porch and bar for seating. Service was good. Everyone was nice.

Tucked away in the Arts District of Downtown Las Vegas is this wonderful gem.

Parking is scarce due to endless construction but if you get here early, you'll be able to park directly across the street.  

I brunched here with my wife, brother and sister in law during the weekend and was impressed with the restaurant. They serve Latin Style Hash, Empenadas and of course coffee/lattes. 

We were seated immediately and placed our order within 10 minutes.

Drinks came out quickly and food came out maybe 10 minutes after.

The ambiance is perfect for one on one conversations or large groups.  The decor is simple and eclectic. With patio seating, lounge seating and formal dining seating, this place has enough room for everyone. 

Our coffee/lattes were perfect in size and flavor. 

The service is prompt and friendly.  Drinks are refreshed, plates cleared and follow ups were frequent.

I'm glad my wife chose this place, as we were able to enjoy a delicious meal, lengthy conversation and a great place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of the Las Vegas Strip.

I'll be back for sure when we visit paradise again.

Kudos to Makers and Finders Coffee for providing a chill place to enjoy a chilled drink or two or three... Did I mention they also serve liquor!?

LOVE LOVE LOVE the folks at Makers & Finders, the downtown location (their first location) is our usual hangout spot when we need to step away from the office and refresh our eyes. 

Everything on their menu from Empanadas, Latin Hash, Coconut Chia and of course coffee is simply amazing which complements the always amazing service they provide as well.

Thanks guys, we'll keep coming back for those Latin Hash ;P

This place was amazing!  The Mexican & lavender lattes were fantastic starters.  Faith took excellent care of us and then there was the food!  We had a chicken tinga omelet and a bagel sandwich, however I opted for croissant.  Both excellent.  My husband literally licked his omelet plate clean!
The garlic lime chicken with mashed yuca is an excellent reason to eat lunch there. I knew it would be good. I didn't expect the dish to become my number 1 favorite dish immediately.

kept going into this place cause its close my my office by im done.  I just realized this hipster flaming dushbag establishment is selling MONSANTO GARBAGE GMO PRODUCTS dispensed out of a fountain drink dispenser.  yes lipton ice tee.  really go see for yourself.  
and for 3.25 for a small to go cup.  SCUM

The waitstaff seemed stressed out that I was a solo diner that would be taking up a table instead of sitting at the bar.  This is super annoying because I dine out by myself pretty regularly due to business travel and I tend to spend quite a bit of money to make up for the fact that it is just me.  But to get that sense of frustration is ultimately annoying.  I was very interested in their lavender latte.  I don't generally like the smell in bath or home products but I've found I really enjoy it in food.  While the latte had a nice lavender flavor, the milk was a bit overpowering and i ended up feeling like i was sipping milk that was gently flavored with coffee and lavender.  In that sense, I would say it was "okay".  The food, however was very very good.  Not listed on the menu, but you can ask after pastries.  I had a chocolate croissant that was soft and delicious.  They did not warm it up and didn't offer to so I ate it cold but it would have been nice warm.  (to be fair i could have asked for them to warm it up).  I had a second drink just to try another menu offering and it was the same overpowering milk flavor.  I'm not sure if it's the coffee beans they use or that they need to add another shot or what.  I would still return and encourage others to try it out - it just wasn't a "wow" experience.

Great Coffee, Inconsistent Service.

The Coffee and Food are of the highest quality, and sometimes the service staff is amazing, sometimes they are rude. I would recommend it to anyone for the coffee, but don't expect to spend a long time relaxing there around your coffee every time. 

Great atmosphere, and about 1/3 of the staff is really friendly.

I had heard of this place by my friends and it did not disappoint.
I went in and had a salted caramel latte made by a female barista, I believe her name was Maria, and it was amazing it woke me up and it hit the spot. I also had an arepa Benny and the flavors were delicious the service was really great I had gone in on the weekend and you can tell it was busy but she kept checking up on us and coming up to us to see if we were ok. Our server who had blue hair was very friendly and made us feel welcome. I recommend this place to everyone who I talk to.
This place is absolutely delicious.  Highly recommend it.  Will be back when on vacation again.  Service and price was perfect as well.
I love this place. Super cute and chill. Usually play good music. Coffees... bomb. Food.....bomb. The barista dude that's always there is super cool. So happy this place exists lol
Nice place, cool laid back atmosphere but if you have a appetite, don't expect to fill up here.

Amazing lavender latte!! This place is so cute and the people are really nice. I love coffee places that aren't Starbucks and actually feel like they have a coffee culture! I would love to come back and try food!
Best coffee ever!!! Service is great and very trendy. Staff is super nice and polite. Great place

I don't know what I was expecting here, but this is more of a sit down brunch restaurant than it is a coffee shop.  The overall vibe of the restaurant felt too dark and wannabe hipster to me.  It didn't feel very inviting and the staff didn't seem particularly thrilled that a bunch of us had come just for coffee, but after driving out of my way to get here, I didn't want to just leave either.  The coffee itself was good.  Pricey, but a unique drink.  I got the one with the coconut and the turmeric.  Worked quite well as a flavor combo together.  Service was really slow and it took forever to flag down staff.  They did seem particularly understaffed to be fair, but that's not really my fault.  I think one of the guys was apologetic about our wait and gave us a discount on our bill which was very sweet of him, but I definitely wouldn't be back.
We fell into this place after shopping in the vintage stores in the neighborhood.  It was yummy and low-key!  Not only did they have a good food menu, but the iced drinks were good as well.
I like it! The lavender cappuccino was great and the pb, nutella, banana, bacon croissant was very satisying! Fresh coffee, fresh food, fresh atmosphere!

Quite possibly the best lattes I have ever had. The lavender infused latte is unbelievable. They sprinkle fresh lavender on top, so you get the aroma with every sip.  Honey vanilla latte is fantastic as well. Never sweet and extremely creamy and well balanced. 

Food prices are a bit high in my opinion, but it is delicious. Worth grabbing a small bite with your drink. The Arepa Roja was very yummy. 
Fantastic staff. Best coffee spot in Vegas.
Awesome customer service here and the coffee is excellent.  Make sure to try the Cortado, it's a drink that you will crave. Make sure you keep ice in it.

This little cafe is a nice little secret spot to pick up some comfort food that is made with really high-quality ingredients and served relatively quickly. I was actually at Hop nuts right next door having a beer when I got hungry and I ordered off the makers and finders menu that was at the bar. Try the ceviche, chiloques, empanadas, & flan. Awesome
Really nice breakfast spot in Vegas with reasonable prices. Our waiter was very pleasant and the food was ready in few minutes. Great coffee and very nice place to go before starting your day!

Awesome spot !!!! The coffee is amazing and has a delicious bold flavor .. and the food is amazing as well .. ive been there a few times and it always awesome .. i get the iced salted caramel its DELICIOUS !!! i definitely recommend this place to all my fellow coffee lovers! !!!
Such a cozy atmosphere and great food  selection. I had a Mexican spiced coffee that as wonderful I got 2 of them. Brunch is good there. They make fresh teas as well.

Every time I come here the service, food and drinks are always excellent. I can't help but bring friends and family here because it's such a hidden gym and yesterday was no different. Everyone enjoyed everything! We had arepas, cerviche, a Cajun chicken sandwich and empanadas. We also had two mimosas and a tai tea. Everything was delish. The only issue I had was that I had to physically get up and go to pay because despite waiting and waiting, then asking the hostess to get our server for the check and leaving my card on the table no check was ever brought over. It was at near closing time and the place was clearing out so I'm giving a pass but it was definitely an error for a place that usually does everything perfect. Until next time M&F but please, take my money when it's time to go! PLEASE! :)

This place has a very trendy vibe to it. I went in for an espresso but I'll have to come back for some food . I noticed a bar with charger outlets and also some couches in the back. The place had a cool interior design. They also had a patio. Fresh little spot.

Came upon this little gem while we were antique shopping in Vegas. Wonderful food and service. Try the red arepa if you like spice and the lavender infused latte in general. Definitely recommend if you are in this part of Vegas. I would even say come off the strip or downtown and visit. Worth a trip off and your time.

I only came in for coffee but I'll be sure to return again to try the full experience. 
For a Monday mid day it was fairly busy - was greeted instantly! 
I ordered two iced coffees and one of them I asked the barista if he could make me his favorite drink and he did, and BOY IT WAS SO GOOD! All I know is it was a cinnamon bun flavor & it was delicious. Very sweet but that's how I like it! Will be back!
With local spots like this why do people still go to Starbucks? Stopped by for a quick coffee this afternoon, will be back to try the breakfast/lunch menu.

This place is bomb.com!  The chai tea latte is my favorite.  This place is a small cafe and they offer unique food options that are absolutely delicious. You cannot go wrong with the tomato bisque soup for a light lunch.

Great food Great bang for your buck!This is what Vegas is missing. GREAT SERVICE...... if you have a long hard day and want to come and relax with great staff and food items that are not to heavy on your stomach and very tasty with a new twist on your coffee or teas come check them out!
Stopped in several times over the holidays.  Lovely service and especially enjoyed the Lavender Latte.

This place is sometimes packed sometimes empty. The service is great when it is empty but when it is crowded it you are definitely waiting for a long time for service and for food. The menu is great. The drinks are exceptional and the ambience is what we come for. The empanadas change depending on who is the chef that day sometimes they are doughy with a lot of crust and sometimes they are just filled to the brim and delicious. Nevertheless we keep going back because there are so little places in Las Vegas with this chill vibe.

This was one of my favorite Vegas stops. The service was fantastic for a group of 13 and the food pretty damn amazing. I loved their system of taking orders by numbering each guest. It made splitting the bill so much simpler!

From the photos on Yelp, I was expecting heavy, basic Latin American twists on traditional American brunch items. It was far from heavy and basic, the food was just enough to get us full, clean-tasting and incredibly fresh. I only took off one star because we ordered a lot of the eggs Benedict dishes and the eggs were all fully cooked. We we're disappointed when it wasn't at all runny.  

And for me, the flavors of the La Paisa lunch item fell flat after a few bites. The server kindly suggested his favorite Salsa Verde which definitely saved the dish for me. I did not take off any stars for this because it is personal preference.

I will never come to this establishment ever again. My friends have mentioned that they have great coffee, but horrible service. Today they made me a believer! The place wasn't even busy and the busser tried to take our order and he was the only one who checked on us twice. Other than that the server was M.I.A. Oh!!! But he dropped the check.. Then disappeared! I over tipped because I didn't have change and I needed to go. Imagine if I needed to use my card, would've sat there for an eternity. I never write reviews, but they deserved one!

Very calm small location, very friendly staff and refreshing drinks. Highly recommend to make your husband chug a cortado on a Sunday morning to get all your activities done with no complaints. :) worked for me! Lol

Delicious ,delectable, superb is the best way to sum up this place . 
Came here for my birthday, & had a great relaxing time.
Cool atmosphere, located in the art district of downtown.. from the numerous reviews saying there's trouble finding parking, wasn't exactly true, found parking right around the building. Cute patio outside to sit out , when the weather is duable. Was greeted by a gorgeous worker, who was super friendly, always making sure we were pleased. I would recommend going early, like ( right when they open ) you can sit on the counter, which seems to be the most popular place to sit. Ordered the long awaited Lavender infused latte, with Arepa Benny.. Let me tell you something, it was amazing .. No, I don't even know if that's how you could describe it... how about .. made with love. The cilantro with the hollandaise just transported me to another dimension. Its a must try. Also a little note: the gentlemen waiters here are as yummy as the food. 
Also my mom ordered the salted caramel iced latte, and that is A LIFE CHANGER ! As for the atmosphere, I do wish it had a little more funky, neat art inside.. but that's just my request.
I am 110 % sure I will be coming back, they also have comfy couches, plenty of seating. Plus , a couple more outlets please.
Thank you Makers & Finders for adding another well awaited dimension to my life.

Wow do not miss this little gem of the desert restaurant in downtown Vegas area be left off of your things to do in Vegas. The staff are very nice, the Ambiance is as Vegas should be with its industrial look interior. This is how Vegas should strive to be especially for the locals. We will be making this a definite stop as frequently as possible.
Food is great! Atmosphere is chill, and the overall feel is inviting. We tried the empanada platter today. I've always loved their coffee. Try the salted caramel latte!

EDIT:  Changed from a 5 star to 2 stars.  I don't like to write long negative reviews. After eating here many times, I gave up on this place.  They are stubborn to do things a certain way l, even if it's wrong.  I repeatedly ordered bacon well done and it then comes out undercooked, sometimes so raw it's not edible.  It almost seemed like Groundhog Day when it continued to happen every time I returned.  No one likes undercooked bacon...it's disgusting...no matter what you tell the server, that's what you're getting.

i found this cool coffee place by accident and it was surprisingly very cool inside. i was scared at first when i drove by the area and once i get in it was a cool place like you find in downtown San Francisco those very unique coffee places.  my latte was top of the line and the guys there are very nice and professional.

I LOVE IT HERE. Hands down my favorite coffee shop in Vegas. Super cute aesthetically, first of all, and the servers are so darn friendly. I've had a great experience each time. I love bringing my laptop and books here. My favorite drink is the salted caramel latte, iced, with an extra shot. Without the extra shot, it's too milky tasting for me. As for food, my favorites are the croissant sandwich, the grilled chicken arepa, and the lomo saltado. I love all these things so much I'd get them delivered to my work (through postmates) which thankfully isn't too far off. My only other wish for this place is that it was open later :( They close at 4 on the weekdays and at 3 on Sundays.

So, I will not be coming back here again.  I stopped coming here about a year ago because of the extremely slow service I was getting plus the flavor of your latte's weren't consistent.  I decided to give them another try since I'll be taking training in the area for the next 3 months and they are very close.  I stopped by last week during first friday and the service was on point.  Very happy with the beverage I got as well, the Lavender Fog was yummy.  Today I came in so everything was great last week and I was very disappointed.  Bad service!!!  It took my server about 5 minutes to come to my table, I gave him my latte order and told him I was still deciding what I wanted to eat.  Well, the host that seated me brought my latte to my table and asked if he could take the beverage menu.  I told him yes and that I knew what I wanted to eat.  He looked up at my waiter to see what he was doing and then he took the order himself.  The waiter never came back to my table!!!  Someone else brought my food out and the original waiter never came to ask me how my food was or if I needed anything else.  I had to ask another host for my check. She went and told the waiter and he just laid it down on my table without saying a word.  I had to tell him to take the check as well when I put the card in their for payment..  I don't understand what his problem was.  They were busy, but he still had time to assist the two tables next to me, bring them their food and check on them.  My table he ignored!!  I will never come back here again...

This is my absolute favorite brunch spot in Vegas. I live in LA but my fiancé works out here a lot so when I get the chance to come with him, we always go here for breakfast/lunch. It is the BEST!! The food is insanely delicious and the coffee, especially the iced lavender latte, is to die for. As far as the food, La Paisa Arepa is my go-to but the Arepa Benny and the Latin Hash are also amazing. Because this place is my favorite, when I decided to have my bachelorette party in Vegas, it was a no-brainer that we would come here. All my girlfriends raved about their food and coffee. We even had some lavender mimosas. Gah. Seriously, I almost hate them for making everything so perfect. Um if you guys decide to expand, please set up shop in East LA! 

I also just want to give them a shout-out for being so kind to me and my friends. I get that bachelorette parties can be annoying to have in your restaurant, and some businesses treated us that way, which was upsetting for me as they were also places I put a lot of thought into picking when showing my girlfriends a good time. Makers & Finders though, you guys were awesome! You were attentive, funny, and friendly. Thank you for being a highlight of my bachelorette. And I mean it about it opening in Los Angeles! Think about it :).

After yelping for a brunch spot near downtown Las Vegas, I was stoked to try Finders & Makers. Good coffee + latin fusion brunch food? SOLD.

First of all, this restaurant is such a cute space. From the neon blue M + F behind the coffee bar to the colorful goat mural on the back wall, the aesthetic of this place is obviously well-curated and on point.

I came here on a Sunday morning and it was crowded enough that we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table. There was also a bit of a mishap where a couple skipped a few places in line and was seated ahead of a few parties. I tried explaining the situation to the hostess, but she was pretty clueless and not super helpful. Also, the drinks we ordered came out at the same time as our entrees (bummer!). All in all, I had to subtract a star for their shaky service. 

BUT, I still had a delightful brunch and the food and coffee were fun and unique! I quite enjoyed my arepa topped with shredded beef, black beans, sweet plantains, and a fried egg. My dining companion ordered the arepa eggs benedict which was also delicious. The menu contains a nice variety of traditional brunch dishes as well as Colombian dishes. They also have a stellar coffee menu. I enjoyed my lavender latte and was intrigued by the turmeric coconut milk latte (next time!). My dining companion ordered a matcha cocktail which was quite unique and refreshing. 

Such a groovy spot! Can't wait to return next time I'm in Las Vegas.

Amazing little place- what a great find.  The Chilaquiles were delightful and the coffee braised beef was great in the omelette.   Oh and the main star was the delicious coffee.   Cody our server was great and steering us towards a great start to our day!
Great menu,  like how they categorize by healthy and vegan, etc... Had Latin flare.  Amazing coffee and tea.

Took my mom here for breakfast today first off- LOVED the ambiance!! Its something you'd see on Pinterest. We ordered the Salted Caramel Latte, Mocha Latte, and Latin Hash. Food was mediocre, coffee was delicious and came with cute coffee art. 

Unfortunately as we were waiting for the check both mine and my mothers stomachs started to cramp and started feeling uneasy. I'm pretty sure this has to be from the food or maybe the milk in the coffee... we both ended up spending a little extra time in the restroom. 

Not sure if I would come back... maybe just for a coffee date. Service wasn't the greatest- waitress talked fast, hard to understand and wasn't consistent.
I haven't even received my food yet, but with the awesome staff, atmosphere and menu I know I will be back!

Makers and Finders is located in downtown Las Vegas. The venue itself is very modern/Low key, some would even say that is located in the shady part of town; however, the food here it is quite amazing. Parking is quite hard to find in this part of town however once you do find a space and come into the restaurant you will be blown away. This is absolutely a good place to go brunching with your family or after a night at the tables or club. The staff was very friendly, however they weren't as attentive as we wish there were.  We had the pull pork egg Benedict was perfection, which also came with a side of plantain.  I also had the pull pork sandwich which was delicious as well. This place definitely has a South America influence on their food and if you like this type of food, you will love this place.

Over hypered, over priced, and underwhelming

I had food delivered from this location so I cannot speak for ambiance. 

However first off, took near two hours to get my food. Second the portions in relationship to the servings are terrible, they apparently think way to highly of themselves. 

Now the food. I have never had such an underwhelming pile of disappointment placed before me. Took 2 bites and threw it away. I ordered an omelette with diced tomatoes, roasted peppers and cheddar cheese. I did not know you could roast peppers and remove all traces of flavor from it. I felt like I was chewing solid air. There is no flavor, variety, or even care put into this dish. Heaven forbid they be bothered to put even salt or pepper on their food. Next time I want a watery pile of mush, I will go to the store buy some canned vegetables drop in on cardboard and let it sit for a couple day. 
I should of gone better food by going to the dumpster behind Dennys. 
 
Too much money for overpriced garbage. I do not understand the good reviews. The location must look nice because they have no talent hacks cooking.

I want to love this place soo badly. It has vegan options, is in a great location, they deliver to Hop Nuts (more below), they focus on good coffee & Latin food, so we're all onboard for that. I read about the owner in the Weekly & his whole agenda is AWESOME. So much respect.

The problem is that in practice, everything is just so disappointing. All of the exciting coffee drinks generally aren't vegan friendly. I wanted a legit vegan cortadito, but basically ended up with just espresso with blah almond milk or something. I have that at home everyday, so nothing special there. Can't you buy some coconut condensed milk/evaporated milk, etc? I guess I could've tried a hippie lavender flavor, but I wanted something, yanno, Cuban.

The vegan empanadas were a giant letdown, because to put it simply, eggroll-ish wrappers are not fr*cking empanada dough. Most peeps won't know the difference, but we did. The fillings were very alright. Sigh. How can you mess up empanadas? The vegan chorizo tasted like just bell peppers. No me gusta.

Ordering was a semi-disaster. I ordered online, where it stated they closed at a different time than their online ordering. We were having a drink at the time at Hops Nuts, so I saw they were still open & kinda busy...so we ordered. I got a call from someone in a remote location saying they were closed, lol, okay...We went inside where they said we had to order through Hops Nuts. Ok. No big deal, I guess (we wasted 20min), but fix your Yelp page & online ordering hours because there's a discrepancy in those. Had to call & get a refund because I already paid online. Annoying. 
Fast forward to after we ordered through Hops Nuts: we get presented a receipt, ummm...my card is with the bartender, as we have a tab going. Waitress looks put out having to get that. She proceeds to try & flirt with my man not knowing I'm the one paying (and I'm a cocktail waitress, lol!) so yeah, enjoy your pity $2. My advice when waiting on couples, be equally as friendly to the girl.

Wow! Smoked lox beagle was delicious. Was perfect amount of lox flavors were balanced perfectly. We also shared a Bionico was very fresh. It was sweet but not too sweet. We had a Arepa Benny. A different spin on Eggs Benedict with shredded beef and arepa bread. OMG! That was the Bomb. The coffee was crazy good too. The iced vanilla honey latte was A1. This was a Yelp gem find.

I forgot my lunch at home on a school day, so my boyfriend was sweet enough to order me lunch from Makers and Finders. He had come to this cafe once prior and recommended that I try it myself since it was located in close proximity to my school. He ordered me a beef melt sandwich and Nutella latte. The beef melt came with shredded beef, caramelized onions, and peppers on top of a toasted baguette topped with mozzarella cheese and plantain chips on the side. The melt was loaded with flavor and so delicious to eat. I only wish there was more of it. For $9.50, the portion was pretty small. The Nutella latte was very bland. I wish there was more of the Nutella flavor. It tasted more like chocolate milk than anything. My boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed his latte when he dined in, so Im going to blame it on the to-go order. I definitely want to come back and dine here one day!
If I could eat here everyday I would, unfortunately I don't live in Vegas. I'll dream of my next Cafe con Leche with an arepa paisa and plantain chips until my next trip to the city. Delicious food.

Amazing breakfast.  Three of us went and all three meals were outstanding, imaginative, and flavorful.  Even the visual presentation was great.  Lattes were delicious and I wish had could of had 5 of them.  Another great Yelp find.
