What a gem! Loved going off strip to the arts district for this oh so perfect weekend brunch. The coffee concoctions are heavenly. So much that we had one each during our meal, then ordered another to go for our drive home. They are sweet and more like dessert, but a must-have. I personally loved the coconut turmeric latte, it was flavorful and inventive. The food is Latin- inspired dishes. We especially enjoyed the chilaquiles and empanadas.

Sooo good! We had the Mexican spiced lattes, empanadas & yucca. Everything was tasty & fresh and the Mexican lattes were phenomenal! Food came out fast, service was friendly.

Only complaint was the bathroom was dirty - but that has nothing to do with the food so I will not deduct a star for it. Just something to improve on if the manager reads this.

I'm all about these small quaint places with good quality food! Leave the Applebees in the 90s where it belongs!

THANK YOU YELPERS!!! This was a great pick from Yelpers reviews. Was looking for something different away from the strip and a place with good food and coffee.  Well this is the place. Great food and great service.... Can't ask for anything more.   I had the Arepa Benny dish which was recommended by the waitress and it was perfect.  Thank you Yelpers!

GREAT PLACE TO COME WITH FRIENDS!!! 
I came here with my friend with only $11 dollars to spend. I ended up getting the rajas empanada, which was pretty good ( not the best empanada I've ever had but tasty nonetheless). The real star of the show is the fries, I find myself constantly thinking about these fries and contemplating the next time I will eat them lol. The good thing about this place is the vibe. 8/10 would recommend

Man, this is some bomb ass food.
Dishes have various latin influences.   From Colombian to Mexican to Venezuelan amongst others. 

This might be my favorite brunch place in town now, and I been to many great brunch places here.

I love little brunch/coffee joints like this! I've had this bookmarked for over a year and I was excited to finally come try it one fine Sunday morning. You get this casual, trendy, hipster kind of vibe. 

Coffee drinks were delicious! I ordered one of the most talked about drinks; the lavender infused latte. Not too sweet and you can definitely taste the caffeine. Got a delicious hint of lavender. Yum! I've got my eye on the honey vanilla latte or the coconut turmeric latte. Next time, for sure! My iced latte came in a mason jar....so cute!

I ordered the kale chorizo omelet, hold the mushrooms. Comes with plantain chips. Typing this is making my mouth water. Portions were just right. Boyfriend ordered the croissant sandwich. We both loved what we ordered and it would definitely be a repeat if we're not up to trying anything new but I want to try the empanadas next time.  

Street parking only. We were here around 11 ish and we managed to find the last spot close to the restaurant. I can imagine it may be a bit difficult to find parking during peak lunch hours. Indoor and outdoor seating. The patio area is dog friendly.

Less of a coffee shop in the Starbucks or Peet's sense than a full sit-down restaurant that happens to have a coffee bar, Makers & Finders offers inexpensive Latin-inspired fare and is a solid downtown venue for brunch and light bites.

The arepa benny, for example, is a nice twist on the usual eggs benedict by incorporating arepas as the foundation for the poached eggs, all while adding rubbed beef and spiking the hollandaise with salsa verde. There is also a variety of coffee drinks served or prepared in different ways, whether pourover, French press, siphon, or espresso. 

While the venue might look like a humble storefront like many others along this particular street from the outside, there's lots of space inside, whether at tables with folding chairs, or a living-room-like area towards the rear. Overall, a good attempt at creating a cozy, community-oriented gathering spot.
I always stop here while in Vegas! Great spot for good food and better coffee than Starbucks

My favorite coffee shop in the city. Haven't found another place that compares. Every single beverage I have tried is delicious. My favorite thus far is the coconut turmeric latte my sisters favorite is the dirty chai latte. The food menu is amazing also. They offer plenty of vegan options! Must try the vegan mushroom empanadas. The service is a little slow but the employees tend to be very friendly and nice.

Worst service ever, the host was extremely rude we sat and the table was dirty he said he was going to clean it and didn't. He came back and decided it was ok to put clean napkins and silverware on the dusty dirty table. Even the silver ware was dirty. Steer away! the service is as bad as the food.

We decided to go off the strip for breakfast and coffee and I am so glad what we did! This place is absolutely fantastic! I'm sad that there is not one in San Diego. I got the lavender latte (yummy!) and my boyfriend got the cortado (strong so be careful). For breakfast we had the Arepa Benny and Latin Hash. Both were superb. If I lived in the area I would be here at least once a week.
Delicious breakfast of veggie arepas Benedict and empanadas!  I love rajas and will order just about anything with them. Fast and friendly service. Highly recommended!

I come here every time when I'm in the downtown area. We were first recommended to try this place by Crafthaus Brewery, and the cold brew coffee here is fantastic. I also enjoy having the albacore tuna sandwich when I'm in dire need of food. The wait for food and drinks may take a while, but it's definitely worth the wait. I love this place!!

I love M & F however, I was there the first time in a while with a friend who has a gluten allergy. The waiter had to keep telling us that things that were listed on the menu as gluten free were not actually gluten free? So it took us much too long to find us something she could actually eat. My only complaint on this place is they need to update their menu of these errors. If you are celiac or have a very serious gluten allergy, please be careful eating here!
This coffee shop is our favorite:)! Everyone is super nice that works here. The lavender latte is the best latte I've ever had.

Finally, opened on a Sunday. We happened to pass by and saw they were opened for Breakfast/ Brunch this past Sunday (first time). 
We had heard great things about their food and their reputation is correct. 
The food is quite excellent. And the coffee, spectacular. 
The only reason I am not giving it a 5-star review is that the wait staff is not informed of the menu. 
I am not saying they should know how to cook but when I asked how many eggs to an omelet and was told six, I knew not to trust that answer. 
I also asked what "sofrito" meant and one of the wait staff gave me a completely different answer than, I believe, the manager/ owner response (after I ate it). 
So, management, please teach your staff how to answer questions and if they don't know, to go ask and not make up stuff.

I ordered the Omelet Pericos and it was excellent. The house sauce was sooo good, I wish I could have dipped the crunchy plaintain chips into more sauce...!
Next time, additional sauce on the side, please.
 
My boyfriend had the Chicken Omelet Tinga. He is a picky eater and he said it was very good.

Lastly, the coffee, the best cortado I have had in this country, so far.

So, if you can overlook the misinformed wait staff, try M&F.
Very good.

I've been dying to try this place out .... decided to give it a chance but the service wasn't all that. The food wasn't that appetizing either , the tomato soup was the only thing I enjoyed. If the service was better I would have probably enjoyed myself.

I cam across this place while on IG and decided to come check it out! Cute little place in Downtown Las Vegas. Felt really cozy where you can catch up with friends and or have a nice Sunday brunch. I had ordered the lavender infused latte, very delicious and different. I had chose to use coco milk instead of regular milk.  Will come back next time to try out their food and other coffees as well. 

Other than coffee there is an alcohol menu as well for those who dont drink coffee.
So nice to have a Non Corporate coffee house ..Located off Main Street ..It has inside and outside seating ..I enjoy the vibe they have created ..Nice addition to the Area ...Enjoy

This place is really awesome. I'm not typically someone that gives out 5 stars but this is an exceptional breakfast joint.

The service was prompt and impeccable. The waiter was able to offer solid recommendations and checked on us frequently but not so often that it became intrusive. 

The Cortado was a  perfect drink. It was one of best I've had. The food was really good. It's a fusion of breakfast foods with a Latin flare. I had the benny that was unique and filling. I liked the plantain chips on the side. 

The ambiance and neighborhood is really cool to. It's off the main strip, so there aren't any long lines, loud people or exceptionally high prices. Over all I'd like to make this a routine breakfast stop every time I visit.

I love this place! Especially since I can have brunch on a Monday at lunchtime. It's golden in my book!

You have to try their lattes! I had the lavender latte the first time, and I always get it now. 

My favorite brunch item? The arepa benny! It is so worth the calories. Portion size is perfect. You will be full for the rest of the day.

The only negative is the service. It hasn't improved after several times being there. That is the reason why I haven't given 5 stars.

My wife and I moved to Vegas in July and I've yet to find a nice, quiet trendy spot to grab some coffee and get some work done. 

My wife stumbled on this place a few weeks ago and kept it secret but now that Cat is out of the bag and I'm stoked. Great atmosphere, amazing food(Get the Latin Hash) and really good coffee.

You won't be let down.
Awesome food and coffee. The staff is really helpful. It's a great spot for breakfast or coffee. If you're in the area it is definitely worth checking out.

Great staff, good food, Mexican mocha  on point, not very far from the strip, clean and friendly environment 
I would come back on my next Vegas vacation

I love that downtown is coming with new places it's great  I finally decided to give this place a try 

I got the caramel sea salt latte super yummy give it a few min to cool down I was in a rush kinda burned my tongue oh well my fault lol 

I got the omelette super yummy  (next time I'll ask for more sour cream) lol I love sour cream 

And the best part it's not super expensive it's not over priced which is wonderful a lot of morning people on phones and computers getting there day started so don't expect super silence 

The workers are very friendly make sure you have everything you need water is never empty I will totally go back

Coffee was fabulous!! Had a very smooth iced latte which was one of the best I have had. 

Food was hot, made with fresh ingredients, but not my style. I like a more traditional breakfast. 

Will indefinitely come back for another cup of coffee.

This is a cool little place on Main St in the hipster "Arts District ".  The food is latin influenced and quirky but tasty. I can't speak to the coffee part but the food and vibe are decent and the beer is cold. The area is growing and in a sort of redevelopment phase. Good people watching spot outside.

Stopped into Makers & Finders before my flight, and parking was convenient in front. The atmosphere was quiet and relaxed with a nice hip vibe.I had a cup of Cold Brew and a croissant sandwich. The coffee was good and very refreshing and the sandwich was pleasant with a flaky croissant and fresh eggs. Flavors were on point with the peppered bacon, and the texture of the sandwich was nice. Coffee was good but slightly watery (this totally could have been my fault for not drinking it quickly enough though). Next time I'm in town I'll be sure to try more of the specialty lattes which appeared to be delicious though!

This coffee shop was recommended to me by one of my friends a couple days ago.. It wasn't what I was expecting. But it wasn't bad. 

Parking was on the side of the street, and had a two hour limit from 8am-6pm.

I showed up at the shop with my friend around their opening time at 7AM. There was a cute patio area at the front of the shop that I would have loved to sit at but it was a bit chilly today. We walk in & I noticed they had a hostess stand.. But no one working at the stand. It was different because I've never seen that at a coffee shop before. The space was bigger than other shops I've been, which is pretty nice because by the time we left at around 9AM, it was getting pretty busy. 

I ordered a Mexican Spice Latte and an Omelet Pericos to go with it. I was completely satisfied with what I got. It was delicious. Except I paid $5.50 for my latte which was served to me in a normal sized mason jar and thought, wow that's all I get for what it costs?! 

But besides that, my experience here was great. Service from our server Josh was good too! He was helpful and made suggestions and explained things they had on their menu. This is a place I would come back to and visit.

Creative, friendly and knowledgeable. One of those places you want to spend time in, not just grabbing a cup of coffee and running out. Sit at the bar or grab a table, kick back and enjoy some of the best coffee in town! And the food is fantastic, too. Try the ceviche, the chorizo Brussel sprouts, or any of the arepas. You can't go wrong.
Delicious! We had the coconut turmeric latte, the salted caramel latte, the lavender infused latte, and the Mexican spiced latte. Then we had empanadas galore. We will definitely be back.

This is my neighborhood coffee shop and I absolutely love coming here.  Sometimes I even consider leaving work early just so I can go grab my favorite Honey Vanilla Latte before they close.  Actually, I'm considering doing that right now which is why I'm posting this review, because bae was on my mind.

Anyway.  Their bagels are amazing, I've had the lox and sprouts bagel, both are incredible choices and you can't go wrong.  The prices are great, the staff is friendly and there's an outdoor patio for you and your dog to sit (my dog usually gets all tangled up in the tables so I usually don't bring him often).

I recommend this place to anyone in the downtown area.
Super!!! ya son dos las oportunidades en que lo visito

how have i not written a review of this awesome place?!?  

my 1st visit was back in june 2015 when i was looking for places to celebrate my daughter's half (6th month) birthday with a few family and friends.  

from the moment i visited to inquire about hosting at this property, i was treated with utmost kindness and care.  ultimately, i decided to celebrate here and i tell you, we were all SUPER HAPPY with this property's cuteness and cleanliness, the food, the drinks and the opportunity to gather and celebrate my daughter.

there was about 10 of us, and we all agreed how amazing this place was, including their food and drink offerings!

i've been back to visit almost every single time that i'm in town (i'm from LA), and i have never disappointed. in fact, I've gotten a few friends (also from LA) hooked on this place so much that they also come almost every single time that they're in town.  :)

makers & finders, thanks for a WONDERFUL first experience with you, and for all the subsequent and future visits.  please stay a long, long while, OK?  i like you guys a lot!

XO

So this place is within a couple of blocks of where I live so I tend to frequent it very often.

I read the reviews and I have to say that as far as the coffee goes this is a spot on place! I am a huge fan of the lavender latte. I have also grown addicted to their Mexican chocolate latte! The idea and the concept of the place is perfect for the location. I'm from Los Angeles so I'm used to places like Silverlake and Melrose. This place would stand among the best in those two areas.

The coffee, anything from the lattes to their special drips, are always flavorful and fresh and robust. The staff has always been extremely helpful and friendly. If there's ever been the slightest issue or mistake with my order, they have always been very quick to fix any kind of issue.

I've only eaten here once but the locks Benedict that I had was extremely tasty. I can understand some of the other reviews when it comes to price versus value. Everything seems to be made fresh and to order so I can understand the price point. You also have to look at the hip and trendy arts District that this coffee place I s in and understand some of the price is based on location.

I highly recommend any of their lattes and it makes for a great to go cup to walk around and do a little window or antique shopping in the area.

Caramel Salted Latte was soooo delicious I drank it slow as if it were hard liquor lol. I didn't really care for the vegetable skillet hash. It tasted like a stir fry with way too much oil. This place has a urban decor reminding me of a coffee house back home in Baltimore. My date said it felt like Seattle in there. Music was dope and the staff, very friendly. Love the ambiance and will be back with a new date lol. It's definitely a spot to vibe out or meet and greet. 
Main Street has construction going on. They tearing up these Vegas streets, but still and all outside is so adorable you can easily ignore the grind of loud machines and a dusty dug out street scenery.

I'm obsessed w the beef hash with avocado and bacon. Literally best coffee I've had in thr country its flower coffee, the most aromatic coffee I've ever smelled then tasted, its lavender aka heaven & back, I'm going to have my friend go again to get more, perfection. And on top of it this was carryout and I was inside once before and they have a really beautiful hip chic spot w good chill vibes

The employees seem friendly but not as friendly as Publicus.  The food is pretty good and the coffee and other drinks are spot on as well.  The atmosphere is okay, I think it has potential for being a really really good place to hang out.  The parking in front is first come first serve.  I don't know if they have extra parking behind the building.  The shop is right off of busy Main Street not the best area either.  I like the vibe better at PublicUs but the food is better here.  I'm not into the sterile white tables and chairs.  It needs more character seems bland and ambiance is almost everything.  They are young so let's see what they grow up to be.

Came here for brunch with few friends on a Sunday. Wait was a little too long for me but this place isn't really a big place and when people come for coffee they usually like to sit and talk for a while. 

The caffeine was awesome. Nice selection. I decided on a Nutella latte which was pretty delicious. I really wanted to try the lavender latte but I thought that might be a little too daring for me. 

As for food, I decided on the Arepa Benny. It's like Benedict. It was good but it really wasn't mind blowing. My friend did order one of their specials for the day.. I think it was called Mashed Yucca but don't quote me on it. That was probably one of the best things ever. My other friend got the empanada sampler which was alright nothing too special. 

Both my friends got a Cordadito which was VERY strong. That may be a little too much caffeine for me and I took just 1 sip. 

Overall, the vibe is very hipster. The location is in the art district which to me is very hipster as well. The staff are nice. I probably won't be returning just because there wasn't really anything special on the menu that I would want to come back for. None the less, I didn't have a bad meal.

This is my first coffee house in downtown Las Vegas and definitely did not disappoint! The lavender latte was amazing, as well as the ambulance was great! Went here for the drinks but next time coming back to try the food!

This is the place you must eat in Vegas.. omg!! I can't believe I waited till my last day in Vegas to be here. This place makes me want to stay in Vegas and eat here every day. I had the grilled chicken arepa and my husband had the paisa arepa. Mind blowing dishes. I will come here again when I come back. The infused lavender latte has been the best coffee I have ever had! I posted the pics when I had already picked from it. Couldn't help myself!
Good from start to finish and well worth the drive from our hotel. Love love loved the honey latte, Egg white w tinga. And the Bloody Mary was perfect! YUM!!

I went there today, and was looking forward to having the arepa benny, and chicken tinga empanadas. There weren't any 2-tops available so I sat at a 4-top. They do have a bar, but I hate high top chairs. Their sofas were full, and the chairs at their community table aren't the most comfortable. Sometimes I sit outside, but usually it takes longer to be served. 

My server came to the table and asked "How many are with you?" I wasn't properly greeted, and then I was told I needed to move. I tried to explain why I chose the table, but he said "Yeah, but I need these 2 open. Can't really have a party of 1 here." I'm a local freelance writer. I enjoy coming here to write, and have even conducted interviews on their patio. I discovered M&F over a year ago, and have frequented the restaurant 2-3 times a month ever since. After this experience I will not be returning. I used to see it as a gem in downtown, but I feel everyone should know, the food is good, but the service level is not only lacking, but also incredibly inconsistent. Spend your money elsewhere.

I was really excited by the pictures, and the that they had siphon coffee meant they had some immediate cred. For our drinks, my girlfriend got an iced honey cinnamon latte and I got the Lavender Fog. Both were perfect temps, respectfully, and my tea was exquisite. For food, which was hard to choose from a thoughtful and varied menu, we chose what seems to be a house specialty, the arepa benny. It is a really cool take on a traditional egg Benedict, subbing out the English muffin for the arepa, a fluffy corn cloud. The proportions were perfect and it wasn't over sauced like many "bennys" can be. We also had the smoked lox. Perfect. Again, the proportions are what gets me, wonderful spread on the bagel, the capers and onions in good order, and great salmon. I also really enjoyed our empanadas; chicken tinga for us today. They were a crispy texture, almost like they were made of wonton wraps. Everything was awesome, including the service. Very, very happy I came here.

Love this place!! Not because it's located downtown and I live here but you can bring a man's best friend with you as well. I love cafes where they take the time to make a great cup of java especially if there using the V60 slow drip process.. That's the only way to go when you want a coffee fix. 

I ordered the the arepa Benny which is like eggs and Benedict. The hollandaise sauce was unique and the beef was made to perfection. Instead of an English muffin they use arepa which is a flat bread made with maize (corn). It was all perfectly matched..

Our server Christian was very good at knowing the inns and outs of the menu and answered all my coffee snob questions lol.. Thanks Christian..

The food is great. Today the silverware and glasses were filthy. We had to ask the waiter on multiple occasions to clean our forks, knives, and glasses. After he brought back a glass that was fresh out the dishwasher, we noticed it was the same glass splashed in water and not dried. Still dirty!

Very hipster. It's downtown so you get that vibe for sure. It's very modern but really comfy. 
Great coffee. I had the Honey Vanilla Latte. 
A lot of great Latin comfort food. I had the Sofrito Burger. It was very testy, it made a great brunch burger. 
Would definitely come back.

Is it a coffee or a food place? It's both! And does them extremely well. When I first moved to Vegas from Europe, I quit drinking lattes because I couldn't find a proper one. Well first time in Makers they nailed it and have every time since. I'm back on the bean, baby! And is there such a thing as an arepaholic? Because I might be one. Also if you don't eat much meat, there's a great off-menu item called the Veggie Benny. Your mom won't have to threaten you to eat these veggies. So if you want to escape the omnipresent glitz and glam and rediscover your center with great food and coffee, head over to the Arts District and hang with the locals.
Oh my Gosh! Best Coffee, best food, the atmosphere is amazing, the Manager is around attentive and friendly, He made it feel hommy, when your in Las Vegas is a must go!

Makers & Finders is the best latte in town! I have tried the Oney vanilla latte, the turmeric coconut latte, and the Mexican spice latte. Each were perfectly made. I only wish I could come by everyday

Lavender infused lattes and their veggie empanadas are amazing!!!!  That is all you need to know.  Oh wait, their arepas are also good.  

Great selections for vegetarians beyond the usual salad or microwave heated veggie patty slapped on a bun. 

Nice place and it is easy to find parking.

3/26 i got the kale salad again and they burnt my chicken it's the second time and having burnt chicken sucks taste horrible. 

I order the kale Caesar salad for lunch and added chicken for my protein. It normally doesn't come with chicken but you can add it and it was bomb. The salad was so good and the dressing was the best part because I was eating healthy but didn't taste it. I love this place also had the empanadas and they were good. I will for sure be going back and trying something new.

Well since my beloved Beat Cafe is going the way of the Dodo bird, I've had to stake out other places for my caffeinated culture fix. Inspire Cafe is good, but the hours are too irregular and the cafe seems like more of an afterthought compared to that shady club upstairs. Publicus   has that comfortable level of grittiness in its location, but the place is WAY too pricey for what is basically Starbucks fare and the look of the place is too institutional to be really comfortable.Advantage? Makers and Finders! Granted, The Beat was on a main drag of a popular area good for people watching, and the neighborhood is what i refer to as "Hipster Row". Lots of laptop toting, Urban Outfitter loving, startup company tablet junkies. Still, its a mellow crowd overall.
I've always intended to have just have coffee and end up getting a small meal. The truffle fries are nothing short of divine. The coffee is always good, home-ground, and served by always chatty and personable waiters.
I've never tried any of the tea beforehand, but I'm sure its wonderful. 
I would easily recommend this place.

Makers and Finders Coffee, for me, is a place I would live at if I lived in Vegas. Everything about this place is hip and meticulously thought out. Everything about this place is not "Las Vegas." It is a great escape from the horror I perceive to be LV. This coming from someone who was raised there, and fortunately escaped when I was just shy of adulthood.

Their coffee is excellent. Their sandwiches made with the freshest ingredients and healthy delicious. Their desserts, equally delish, in a decadent way. They definitely take pride in everything they did. Makers and Finders is located in the LV's Arts District. This coffeehouse is a sweet little escape in a crazy town.

Omg this is the best place ever! Coming from Chicago this reminds me of Hot Chocolate with their amazing hand made coffees and other drinks! Their food is amazing , any of the Benny's along with their chia pudding

I am not a coffee fan (well, my stomach isn't) but I am a chai aficionado. This location has the best chai in Las Vegas in my opinion; it differs from everyone else in that it doesn't taste like artificial overly sweet vanilla. I also happen to enjoy hanging out in local coffee shops as opposed to the likes of Big Green.  From what I have been told, this is one of the go to spots if you happen to enjoy coffee and espresso as well; it sure smells good to me.

According to Yelp checkins I have been here twenty-four times. I can say that each one of those times the service has been good and the food quality is great. I typically get the breakfast bagel, Latin hash or one of the arepas; if they have a special omelette on the board I'll get that too. Portions are not overly large and that's fine because, let's face it, American's are fat...so, I sometimes have room for a second helping of the chai.
First time in! Coffee was yummy.. Atmosphere, inviting. I'll be back for some food! Menu looked really good

Cute place! Great lattes! Great food! And, amazing customer service!! 

Went for the first time for breakfast and ordered the  Tres Leches Waffle, a side of potatoes, and a side of Maple Woof Bacon (Yeah, I ate it all by myself.) Yum! The Salted Caramel latte was delicious and the atmosphere was perfect. It was a busy Sunday!

First time here for brunch, I had the empanadas sampler, it was good. It's not big portion, more like an appetizer but it's fulfilling. I really wanted the Cuban coffee but found out that it's not Cuban coffee beans.

Love LOve LOVE this place. The Salmon Benny is my go-to. Hands down, amazing if you enjoy eggs and salmon. I wish it were a little bigger but the size is definitely not too small. It's consistently delicious and that's what matters  Another thing I love is the Avocado and Tuna salad. If you like both those things then add in the capers it comes with and Bam! It's bomb and is my 2nd most favorite. I've never had a bad meal here and their coffee is solid too. That's all you need to know! Come here and check it out next time you're on main St. or heading downtown.

Strong coffee and a friendly staff. I'm in! 

I came here to kill some time after a lunch meeting. Being both a coffee fiend and snob, I like to see what the black gold brewing masses are creating out there. Makers and Finders are making some serious java, with what seems like five different styles of coffee brewing going here. It's easy to tell they treat it like a true craft. I ordered an iced coffee and it was delicious. No bitter or burst taste and a very smooth finish. This is a good way to wake up after that mid-afternoon crash. 

The venue has a very modern and clean look with a mix of both retro and contemporary wall designs. The dining area has plenty of space for eating and sipping coffee or if you just need to get some work done, belly up to the coffee bar or the large work table provided and feast on all that glorious free WiFi. 

The staff here is very nice and let me hang for a bit even after they were closing. I will be back for some food samplings and a chill session on their patio!

After moving to Brooklyn I'm super picky about coffee shop quality. I absolutely love this place, it's by far one of the best in the city and one of my all time favorites. Definitely try the the lavender infused selections and for non coffee the iced chai. So bomb we will forever be loyal

Located right next to Hop Nuts Brewing in Downtown LV and best place to park is probably behind Casa Don Juan. This place has a really cool concept with many coffee based drinks, a large amount of Latin food options all with full sit down service! I was totally surprised when we stepped in and couldn't see where to order the drinks and then we were approached and asked "table for 2?" Oh!!! Sit down, okay lol and given menus, water, and everything! Cool!

BREAKDOWN: 
Coffee- 2/5
Food- 3/5
Concept- 5/5

The coffees we tried were the iced lavender infused,  and iced Mexican spiced. Both were just okay. Wayyy too much milk, you can even see that in the picture I took. Coffee flavor was very weak and the additive  flavor was also super weak but I'm thinking that was only because the milk diluted everything. I could barely taste any lavender in mine however the mexican spice had slightly bit more distinguished flavor. Kind of disappointing.

For the food, my boyfriend had the Rajas Arepa and I had the Arepa Benny. The Benny was served with plantain chips and was the perfect portion. The eggs were cooked perfectly, and sauce was nice and creamy however the meat was a little dry and both meat and sauce didn't have as much flavor as I expected. I didn't try the Rajas Arepa since it was a bit small and I don't like bell peppers but my boyfriend said it was alright, however he said the bread was really bland and dry. We were expecting the plantain chips to be a little sweeter but they were okay as well.

Interior and seating area outside was nicely remodeled and clean, nothing fancy. Looked like a cool place to catch up with friends. Our server Christian was really nice, knowledgeable about the menu and made sure to check up on us often.

Overall, I think this place is a little hyped up right now but with a few tweeks could be really good especially with the great concept they have! I still definitely want to come back to try other coffee options and menu items and hopefully I'll be able to update this review to 4-5 stars. But in the meantime, 3 stars, and hope to be back soon!

Love this place. Free wifi and a great work area for laptops. I had the Brussels and Bacon. It was delicious. I had black coffee and it was great. Staff if friendly. Space is clean, open and comfortable. I will be back for sure.

The first time I entered the doors of M&F's, the first thing that came to thought was... this place has CLASS.  

This stylish and vibrant coffee bar introduces both comfort and amenity that smoothly yells, "Hello" to those who pass around Las Vegas' still-developing Arts District.  Parking, however, may be quite a challenge. But if you ever do find that perfect spot, get yourself over there right away and treat yourself nicely for finding that parking spot. And hey, let I remind you again that this is a coffee bar. So, if you decide to come by during a Summer's day, and you want to get something iced? Well, you will not be disappointed. Serving with the right temperature and a little sweetness from their lattés, you're in for a smooth and comfortable delight. Trust me on this one because of the service there?... Oh, Ladies and Gents, THE SERVICE IS EXCELLENT. QUICK, HELPFUL, PROPER, IT MUST BE MENTIONED WITH PRAISE. 

Now, did I mention that they deserve Gluten-free breakfast and brunches here? 

Oh yes.

My order:
Arepa Benny Breakfast, Gluten Free
Golden poached eggs, coffee rubbed beef, grilled tomatoes, salsa verde Hollandaise. 
Verdict: AMAZING. 

(And there is one more dish I'd truly recommend. The "Grilled Chicken Arepas". Trust me. You are welcome.)

Onto dessert: The Espresso Flan.
You read me, folks. Flan poured with a shot of espresso, topped with whipped cream and strawberries. 
Verdict: If you have a company... PLEASE DO YOUR BEST TO SHARE. I know I didn't want to. I WANTED IT ALL FOR MYSELF BECAUSE IT'S. THAT. DAMN. Good. 

But of course, there are a plenty number of other delicious entrees and desserts worth exploring on their menu. Just don't forget that latté on the side because this restaurant has the spirit and heart to serve with great, excellent service (Also literally on your latté, too, if you ever decide on "hot"). It is a coffee bar after all. A fine, classy one.

So happy to find this place. You will be, too.

-AC

Some of the best coffee I've ever had. This is a great spot on the southern side of the Arts District in Vegas that has authentic Latin comfort food as well as coffee/espresso. The space is relaxed but stylish with both indoor and outdoor seating. I stopped by for breakfast and had a delicious breakfast croissant, but almost regretted ordering it when I saw someone with the Latin hash (it looked amazing!).

This place is bomb! The coffee, the food, the service. They have a big variety of teas and coffee that all looked delicious. They also play great music, instrumentals to popular songs so that you can actually talk to people while you eat haha. Ok now the food. I ordered the Latin hash and wow! A delicious skillet with a mix of potatoes, shredded beef, cheese, and peppers. I recommend adding the avocado and bacon because it just makes it that much more delicious. You guys I could eat this every day for breakfast it's so good I'm going to have dreams about. For dessert I got the tres leches waffles, let me tell you these were the most delicious waffles I've ever had! It's like Jesus came down from heaven and made them himself! I didn't find much flavor in the tres leches part of it but I'm not even mad they were so good! The coffee bar is so cool too I love the decor. Service is 5 stars, our server was sweet and on top of it, then someone came over to ask about our experience maybe the owner but that's a wonderful touch! I'll be back to try some more things! 
P.s. I love that they give your table a water jug so you can pour yourself water when you run out! Even the best restaurants forget to fill your water sometimes so this takes care of that no matter how busy they are.

This place is a rip off. I spent 40 bucks on a burger where the patty was half the size of the bun and burnt plus a three dollar up charge for some obviously frozen fries that they couldn't even put salt on apparently, and then my girlfriends hash that was okay at best. Then 3 bucks for some shitty lemonade that tasted like powder lemonade, and then the chai tea latte tasted like shit too. Starbucks tastes better. If you want some good actual Latin food, head down the street to casa Don Juan. And if you want good breakfast go to Vickie's diner also down the street. If I you I wouldn't waste my time on this place.

This is my second time at makers & finders but my first at the downtown/arts district location. This place is so cute with front porch seating, indoor bar and regular table seating. They offer beer, wine, coffee and cocktails. They even serve coffee cocktails! The service was attentive and friendly. 

I love that they serve their breakfast menu later in the day for those who rise late. They have egg dishes, meat dishes, vegetarian and vegan dishes as well (which are clearly marked on the menu--thank you!). 

I enjoyed the soyrizo brussel sprouts which came with plantain chips and I was happy with the large portion. It was delicious but I was wanting more vegetables instead of so much soyrizo. My friends were happy with the chicken tinga omelette and rajas arepa that they ordered. They also ordered the espresso martini which was too sweet for my liking but they loved it. I enjoyed the banana bread ale which was so delicious. 

The bathrooms are used by both this restaurant and the neighbor bar Hop Nuts. Great location if you'd like to continue your day at local shops or bars.
The food was so great! The service was so welcoming & super helpful if it's your first time here. The food came out pretty quick , but they definitely don't make you feel rushed. Cutest place to go!

We walked from Freestyle Crossfit back to the North end of the strip and stumbled on this little gem on our way.  Amazing cold brew coffee.  It was smooth and super delish.  Just a neat little coffee shop.  If you are passing by, it's worth a stop in for sure.

This is a 4.5 I'm rounding up to a 5. Really big a fan of this place. So much so that I came here for breakfast twice out of 3 days while in town and will definitely stop in on future trips. I was in town for work and found Makers & Finders to be a great start to my day. The atmosphere is clean, open and welcoming. Their food and coffee were on point too.

I had their Chicken Tinga Benny and Arepa Benny, both of which were great. Their salsa verde hollandaise was delicate and flavorful. The rest of their menu sounds great too. I'll have to try their Coconut Tres Leche Waffle next time and since they offer it with the option of adding bacon, that should be a great sweet and savory combo. Their espresso was nice and bold and service across the board was excellent.

Definitely a go to spot to good food, great coffee, and fantastic service.

P.S. Super easy street parking right in front doesn't hurt either.
The only reason I stopped was for the steak croissant. Since it is no longer sold, I did sausage. It was burnt and dry. I won't eat DD again. Good luck!!!!!!!°

I like this new coffee shop downtown! Rating  is a little low because they're still new and have a few things that could be better, but overall first experience was a pretty good one. Lavender latte is delicious and the honey vanilla is like a warm horchata. 
We got here at 10:00 but their kitchen doesn't open until 11, which is fine, just a little weird since we were planning on breakfast. It makes sense not to open it until later but it'd be smart to have the info up on yelp. 
Another thing was I wish they carried soy milk. They only carry regular and almond milk, but I don't think almond milk sits as well with espresso as soy. Hopefully they bring it in if more people request it. Some servers were nicer than others when I mentioned it, if you know what I mean...

First impressions speak volumes...Everyone's spot on with the lack of service and the uber hipsterness of this place. We were left waiting too long to even get a menu (while the staff all stood behind the counter chit-chattin') so I didn't even get to try the 'overpriced lackluster food' & 'lukewarm coffee' (as others have mentioned) - I didn't even make it that far.  Maybe if it can get over itself for just a minute the restaurant might be worth a try...it's really unfortunate that being cool is much more important than providing proper service.

Disappointing.  Review for Makers and Finders in Summerlin.

Avocado toast had overcooked poached egg, practically hard boiled, no runny yolk :( soggy bread, almost like the bread was plated on a wet plate. 

Coffee was mediocre.

Seemed like they were short staff in the front of house, Server was hosting, serving and bussing, took extremely long to get the check processed.

Demeanor of staff was indifferent, needs work on overall execution in front and back more of a sense of care for guests.

I came here with my friend to play catch up over coffee and lunch. It's right on Main Street downtown. Parking was not metered but did have a 2 hour limit. They do close fairly early, so this is not a night time study spot :(. The patio looked awesome but we opted to sit inside and get out of the summer heat. 

     We sat down at a little table, in chairs that were a lot more comfortable than they looked. We were greeted about five minutes later and asked if anyone had taken our order. Took a little while, but the server was so nice and knowledgable About the menu that it was difficult to care. We both opted for lavender lattes with almond milk. They didn't ask about sizes, so I'm assuming dine in all run the same ($5.50). We received our lattes promptly but the server disappeared before we could order our food. About five minutes later he reappeared and we were able to order. My friend ordered the veggie bagel and opted for the brussels sprouts prepared vegan with fresh garlic. 

     The lattes... I Highly recommend this beverage. It's probably one of my new favorite coffee drinks. The lavender isn't over powering or too fragrant, which was my biggest concern. There was a perfect balance with hints of lavender and espresso with a touch of sweetness. It was perfect, just not hot enough for me since I drink slow when I'm talking. The veggie bagel looked great! The veggies looked fresh and colorful. It even came with plantain chips. The brussels sprouts were cooked until tender. Lots of flavor from the citrus lime and the savory garlic. I will definitely be ordering these again. 

     The check after tax was 27.00. For a sit down coffee house, I didn't think it was too bad. I will definitely be returning in the near future.

So, I love Makers & Finders. It's some of the best coffee and lattes you can get downtown. The atmosphere is incredible. The food tastes amazing. The baristas and waiters are friendly. Great location, super walkable. 

The issue is, every time I go to M&F, I wait. I wait a long time. We ordered 4 drinks this morning and waiting nearly 35 minutes to receive our drinks. I ordered a cold brew. Coffee, and Ice. Cold brew. I left after 30 minutes of not receiving our drinks because I had to go to work. 15 minutes later, my friend was delivered to me at work by one of the 3 others that visited M&F with me. There were 3 other customers other than my group in the building, and all of them already had their meals/drinks. It's not that the barista or waiters were wasting their time goofing off. It was just insanely slow. 

Another incident occurred when taking a lunch break for coffee. I ordered a bagel and coffee and had to wait nearly 40 minutes for a coffee and a bagel (with no meat or cooked ingredients). 

I'm not a fan of yelp reviews, because, Makers & Finders deserves a 5 star in EVERY category, except for efficiency. The food is perfect. Coffee is incredible. I just can't spend an hour waiting for a coffee.
I tried this place for the first time today and it definitely won't be my last. The coffee and food was absolutely delicious!!! I felt like I was eating a yummy home cooked meal.

Cold brew was pretty good, definitely beats Starbucks any day (no burned taste) also had their Latin hash and was not disappointed at all! Whenever I'm on this side of town I will be stopping by for my cold brew coffee.

Excellent coffee the best I have had in a long while.
This is not a run in for a cup but more a come to savor delicious coffee in a shop with a great vibe. I chatted with the owners who went to Columbia to research coffee and it shows. I will definitely go back.

I was next door and saw this coffee shop. The guy behind the counter greeted me immediately, shook my hand and introduced himself. He handed me a menu and asked if I would like any suggestions. I told him what I liked and he made me a Mexican Spiced Iced Coffee. So good! He told me next time I need to try the Lavender latte. The coffee was great and the service was even better! So far from my side of town but whenever I'm down town, I'll definitely stop in!

The coffee is fantastic. They customer service is suspect. Sat at the bar for 10 minutes before I had to ask for service. The place is basically empty on a Monday morning so being busy is no excuse.  

Hope it was just a fluke because this place has great coffee.

Food was awesome! No complaints there service was very slow... would I come back yes, would have gave it 4 stars but my waiterss gave my check and my card to a different table and didn't notice until I told her!
Carta muy variada. Probé el bagel y estaba verdaderamente muy bueno. El café frío con leche de coco a parte que tom también fantástico. Gracias!!

Food: I had high hopes for this place. Maybe it was because we had previously seen their regular menu and had anticipated ordering from it. We came on a Sunday so we ended up trying out their brunch. The menu wasn't as extensive and for some reason I wasn't really feeling anything on the menu. My fiancé was pretty set on ordering the Arepa Benny and Lavender Latte, so I opted for the Latin Poutine. The Arepa Benny, which is pretty popular according to many of the reviews, was pretty good, but the meat lacked flavor and the highlight of the dish was the arepa. My poutine was good, simple, and flavorful, but not as filling as I thought it would be. My favorite item that we ordered was the Lavender Latte. It wasn't too sweet or too heavy, but a perfect blend of cream and just a hint of that floral lavender taste. 

Environment/Ambiance: Definitely a modern hipster joint. There's a good amount of seating inside as well as outdoor lounge seating. From the outside I would have guessed it was a regular coffee shop. I really like the concept which I would guess is a hipster/Latin/coffee shop feel. It's very clean and minimal, although I wouldn't recommend this place for a large group. 

Service: Service was prompt, but I must say it was forgettable. It got pretty busy when we arrived, so we rarely saw our server. 

Tips: I think I may wanna come back on a different day other than their Sunday Brunch. If I ever come back, I definitely want that Lavender Latte again.

Cool cozy little spot, perfect place to kick off the day and get your coffee fix and some Latin tunes! The Bionica (yogurt, honey, condensed milk, granola, and blueberries) and cortadito coffee were on point.

First time to try Latin Brunch. We ordered La Paisa Arepa with flavorful marinated shredded beef ('carne desmechada').The arepa is corn-based flour bread. 

Elvis Press is such a special taste. Bacon and Nutella plays magic. 

The biggest highlight is the spicy mushroom empanadas. The kale is a little bit strong and bitter for us. However, it is very fresh and a good match for the fried mushroom pie. 

Definitely recommend if you want to avoid overpriced buffet and have a try in exotic international cuisine. :)

I live downtown and wish I could support this place.  The coffee was good.  They charged me per each cup of regular drip coffee.  No coffee shop on the planet does that for standard drip, so that's just insulting.  The coffee was good, but nothing special.  The server recommended a berry pastry.  It tasted like it was bought from the grocery store.  It was cold, rubbery, and nothing special.  The service was okay.  We asked if we could sit outside and the barista said yes they'll send someone out to take the order.  It took about 15 min.  The furniture was cheap and not very comfy like a good coffee shop.  As far as I could tell, no WiFi either.  Missing all the elements of a good coffee shop.

Makers & Finders was definitely my favorite restaurant I ate at while in Vegas. Great food and totally a hipster joint. The quality of food was so fresh and they were right on point with presentation. You could tell they really paid attention to detail with the dishes they were serving. 
Also ordered a hot coffee to go. Wasn't as impressed with the coffee as I was with the food. But maybe the flavor latte I picked was a miss. 
Would love to go back next time I'm in Vegas. If you're looking for a good joint don't pass them up.

Absolutely a must!! Looks like it might not be but the food was delicious lots of flavor and great presentation. Definitely worth it. We tried the Avocado Salad, Garlic and Lime Chicken and a Soyrizo empanada.. very friendly service as well

I love a good empanada! Sometimes you just need that fried crispy goodness. While I would definitely NOT consider myself a vegetarian, I absolutely love these black bean empanadas. I ordered them as the platter with a side of Spanish rice, beans (you can never have enough beans in my opinion), and a side of corn salad. 

Also, the ambiance at Makers is just lovely. Even in the hot summer months, their outdoor patio is cool and comfortable with cushioned seating. Be sure to also check out their yummy hibiscus mimosa.
If this was on my way to work, I would get a Lavender Latte and Lox twice a day.

My boyfriend and I went here for brunch. The black tea was very good. I ordered a side of fruit, there was nothing amazing about it, just chopped up pieces of fruit. The crispy fries were good. Service was ok. It took a while for the server to check on us. The atmosphere is clean, open, not too loud music, very comfortable. I'll go back to try the coffee.

To whoever is in charge of the music in the morning, LOVE the Rock en Español. LOVE LOVE LOVE. Never change. 

Food wise. Delicious, great atmosphere and solid coffee. Favorite spot in Las Vegas when visiting.

I had no idea what to order and knew absolutely nothing about Latin food. I wasn't sure I'd like anything on the menu and when I ordered, I felt nervous that I was not going to like the food. I have left only 3 reviews before and I hope this review helps people make decisions. I ate the Paisa and it was so full of flavor! Absolutely delicious with a touch of sweet from the fruit and a touch of salt from the bacon! We also had the Arepa Benny or something like that. It as well had such a brilliant bold mix of flavors. Just fantastic! the staff was friendly and eager to have you enjoy your experience. Highly recommend you try it!

This place is so bomb, came with a group and tried a lot of stuff on the menu and not one item was bad.  Everything was so good.  Servers were super nice and friendly, just great vibes at this spot.  Very trendy and has a unique menu, def will be recommending this spot to friends!

Keeping with our desire to try the great restaurants off the strip, we headed to Makers and Finders for Saturday brunch. We got lucky and the wait was only a few minutes for three of us. We ordered two of the specialty lattes that they're known for. The Coconut Tumeric Latte was the favorite while the Lavender Latte was just slightly too sweet for me. We tried the empanada sampler and it was great but the real winner was the La Paisa Arepa. The meat was incredibly tender and the arepa itself was one of the best I've ever had. It was served with black beans and the most delicious and sweet plantains. Overall, the only disappointment is that we were only able to eat here once on our trip.

Drinks served in mason jars....
Black and white color scheme with lots of wood...
19 different ways to get a cup of coffee made...
Sounds like just another run-of-the-mill hipster joint, right?

WRONG! This place flips expectations on it's head by serving Latin breakfast eats! Super unique twists on your classic breakfast favs, and it's all plated beautifully. 

Highly recommended. Also, the prices are very reasonable.

While I have been to M&F multiple times and share similar positive reviews that have already been posted, I felt the need to comment after their first CAMA last night. It was a Japanese-inspired pop up dining experience at midnight that transported us to Tokyo. The mood in the space was set perfectly, the staff did their best to attend to the large crowd, and the offerings were so delicious. We tried everything on the small menu and the eel was our favorite....melted in your mouth with excellent flavor. The whiskey option on the drink menu was smooth, fragrant, and classic. Oh! Almost forgot the DJ...mixed music perfectly and kept the mood smooth and sexy. M&F is evolving as a power house when it comes to special events, mainly due to the team's desire to collaborate and bring great people skilled in certain areas together under the same roof. Love this place, and I hope you will as well!
Love going to this place. The breakfast bagel and iced vanilla latte is everything. A must go to cafe when you're in Las Vegas. 5/5 stars

Came in here on a Saturday morning looking to get our coffee buzz on and have a little brunch. After placing our order for our food we indulged in the Salted Caramel Latte and we ordered the vanilla honey latte. However they brought out the wrong latte for my wife, so instead of the honey latte she got the Mexican latte which was fine after all. We had to wait for about an hour to get the Empanada platter which was tasty however after drinking the coffees and eating the empanadas we canceled the rest of our order which had not yet been prepared. The manager came by and apologized at about the 30 minute mark and then the hour-mark because he said they were breaking in a new cook. This place would be on point if they just get their stuff together in the kitchen and pay a little more attention to detail with the orders. I'll probably give them another try in about a month. But if you're stopping in for a latte, I don't think you'll find a better place and this part of town.

I love this place . I've been to both of their locations, I like the one in the arts district better, but the one in downtown Summerlin is not too bad. Good customer service. The coffee is amazing and I love their menu. I'm Venezuelan and they serve my favorite arepas , they are more of a gourmet version of our arepas but they are so good . I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a good coffee at a nice and cozy place with some food latin soul food .
Good ice green tea latte with almond milk and friendly cafe a lot ppl bring laptop for work and chilling here.

Exceptional service in such a comfortable space that is aesthetically pleasing. The food is yummy and inexpensive it mostly ranges between $5-$15. The place is extremely clean. I  cannot wait to come back here again. I had the tomato bisque it was great and they give a large portion for only $5. I definitely recommend this place.

4.5 Stars 

My sister and I ordered the Arepa Benny and the Coconut Tres Leches Waffle to share. The Arepa Benny was the best twist on the classic Eggs Benedict that I've had in a while. I enjoyed the texture light polenta like biscuit, and the spiced up Hollandaise paired nicely with the Arepa meat. The plaintain chips that came on the side were also vert nice. My only complaint would be that the poached egg was slightly overcooked so it wasn't as runny as I would have liked. The waffle was also solid. I  Iiked the Tres Leches cream and blueberry compote, but in my opinion the chocolate bits kind of threw off the other flavors. I also sampled a bit of my grandma's Soyrizo Asparagus dish, and really liked it. The soyrizo's spiciness went very well with the slight bitterness of the asparagus. 

As for drinks, I ordered the Lavender infused latte. As a latte it was good, but I would have liked more lavender flavor. I could smell the lavender from the bits sprinkled on top, but when I drank it the strong cocoa flavor overwhelmed the lavender.

Food and drinks took a while, but it was too be expected for our party of 10. Our waiter was also very helpful, patient, and served us with a smile. The decor is trendy and pleasant, and the "I like big cups and I cannot lie" sign outside the door was cute.

Make sure to check in on Yelp if it is your first time to get 20% off one of their specialty lattes! Overall, Makers & Finders was a great Latin infused brunch, and I would definitely recommend it to my friends.
Arts District Gem! First time had honey vanilla latte & croissant. However looking around neighboring tables the breakfast looked delicious!

Came here early in the morning. Coffee was great, went for a flat white and Latin hash. It takes a bit of time for the food to be out but it's expected. Staff is attentive and friendly so that's always something to look forward to.

Came here today for the second time and loved it more than my first! Love love love the atmosphere. Overall cute place but many things are expensive but that's common in adorable coffee shops.

Things I've tried: 
Tomato soup: WOW. This is sooo good. I love a good tomato soup and this one is a winner 

Chipotle chicken sandwich-delicious delicious spicy chicken. Wish it was bigger or had more stuff within the sandwich 

Plantain chips-eh 

Maduros-sweet plantains. I asked for a side of these because of love them so much. Not on the menu but they were able to accommodate. YUM. Love love love 

Kale ceasar-pretty good, wish it was larger for the price 

Lavender latte & lavender vanilla lattes-both fantastic my favorite part of this place and reason I'll keep coming back. On the pricier side but worth it. 

Raja

Arepa Benny 

Both above were pretty similar. Love the sweet plantains with the raja. Wish it had more spice.

Las Vegas perfection! This place has some amazingly passionate baristas and really great food. The breakfast menu is kind of out there but trust it. They deliver in spades!! I will be back on my next trip for sure!!

Overall good. I would recommend this place for the coffee and come again when I am in the area to give it another shot. It has a variety of good options for those with dietary restrictions. There was no option for turkey bacon though for our kosher/halal friends. 

I ordered the coconut turmeric latte with coconut milk. Absolutely delicious. Not too sweet where you want to gag, and not too coffee-forward if you are feeling a little fancy. 

I had the salmon lox, it was very good. The cream cheese was very buttery tasting. It was beautifully drizzled with olive oil upon presentation. I would have liked to see a little more salmon on the bagel. Usually these bagels are loaded with salmon if ordered elsewhere.

Hubby also ordered the Omelet Pericos. This was an underwhelming dish for me, maybe because I hate green bell peppers. Hubby thought it was ok. He thought the the egg was over cooked and was expecting an actual sharp cheddar flavor. He says it tasted like American cheese. To him, it was an overpriced "meh" omelet.

The decor is great, but the service is slow. I think the hostess was in training. Waiter was great.

I was only here to pick up coffee with my partner to go but while I was waiting for my order I looked over their breakfast and brunch menu. Looked pretty good I will have to check it out another day.

I have to say though my favorite latte in all of vegas is at this place. I'm not big on coffee honestly my partner is but man am I glad I ordered this. 

Sea Salt Caramel Latte (4.5/5)
I added extra caramel and salt

I really enjoyed this drink. I can't wait to go order my new favorite coffee drink :)
Service was really friendly but a tad slow for how not busy it was. Those things can be worked on but not changing me coming back here because all the staff was attentive and seemed to be happy to be there!

Yelp check in reward (% off a Latte)

It's been probably two years since I had visited Makers & Finders. I desperately needed coffee and a quick bite before getting the day started. It was really busy- almost all of the tables were filled on a Wednesday afternoon around 2PM. I came with my book and laptop in hand, but found it was too loud to try and study. Normally I can block out the espresso grinder, dish wear clanking, and people talking but I realized this was due to the music being a little louder than what I find comfortable for a coffee shop. 

I had a lavander latte and the croissant sandwich. Both were pretty solid, but I wish they had more options to choose from. It's a cute spot for a quick lunch date or coffee to-go, but I don't think I can come back with the intent of staying here for a few hours to study.

We walked in little before 8pm, and noticed the visible annoyance of the barista. We were asked right away if our coffee was "to go". Then we were told that they were closing in 20 minutes,  but the door clearly said 9pm. Not sure if they just really needed to leave, but out of common courtesy a sign on the door might have helped. It would've given us the option to make a decision to not even walk in.  
That being said, we were told we would have enough time to drink our coffees in house. 
Hostess let us sit outside and brought us water. She was very pleasant and made recommendations for something we've not tried. The coffee came back shortly after,  which we drank quite quickly. When you know you're on a time constraint, you try to get out asap. Both were very pleasant,  but since we felt rushed, we really couldn't enjoy the flavor. 
All in all, we might go back,  but not anytime soon.

The friendly staff seemed overwhelmed but they calmed our impatience by jokingly attributing our lack of service with me wearing a brazilian soccer shirt (rival teams). Well done.

Usually, I am not a fan of fancy coffee and espresso drinks, except for the classics. I was however blown away by their signature drinks featuring an expert mix of spices, coffees and condensed milk. I also had a delicious Iced Matcha latte.

The food was also excellent. My wife and I shared a benny and a hash, both with succulent pulled beef.

Nice!
Another lovely find off the beaten path.   Comfortable good WiFi.   Lovely menu.   Plenty of parking on the street.

A must-visit for any Aussies in Vegas on holiday.

I recently got back to Vegas after spending a couple of years in Australia where I ended up becoming a coffee snob due to the huge coffee culture.  Now that I'm back I realize just how difficult it is to find a decent cup of coffee in the US.  Where most American coffee places fail (especially the chains), Makers shines. I'm so glad I have this little sanctuary that reminds me of Oz. Macchiatos and flat whites made in the right size and proportion!  I've also been able to try some of their single origin brews and they've all hit the spot.  Shout out to barista Sean for a consistently amazing cup of joe and the whole staff for taking good care of me.

Haven't had a chance to try much of the food yet but when I have ordered food they are more than happy to work around any dietary restrictions.

I also love the industrial decor, the neon sign and the patio seating.  Dogs are welcome on the patio.

For the past few months I've passed by here on the way ho.e from work. Finally made it over...and LOVED IT! Hubby and I shared a benedict and LOVED the Lavender Latte,  not to mention the atmosphere. Looking forward to trying the beverage iced. Barista Shawn was very helpful and friendly. Truly a great find!

What a great café/coffee shop! Super clean, nice menu, good food, GREAT COFFEE, polite and attentive staff. The baristas greeted us the second we walked in the door and it got better from there!  5 Stars. We're local and we will definitely be back. If you're local or from out of town, definitely hit this place up!

Makers & Finders is a very fine brunch/lunch place. Not my usual go to type of food in the Latin/Vegetarian variety for the most part, but still a nice change of pace for a brunch wth options besides eggs and hash. I had the lemon chicken plate and thought it was tasty but not quite a lunch you'd want on a weekend to detox from festivities the night before. It's a very good weekday lunch though, but a little much at $13. 

I do believe this is some of the best coffee in town, however. Makers really knows their beans. I would come back for an afternoon coffee and to chill on the patio area any day. But Unless you have a hankering for Arepas, I might try another spot in the area for an amazing brunch meal.

I was recently turned on to this new place by a co-worker when on a coffee run and under the impression we were going to our regular place. She says "we're going to Makers and Finders." We were promptly greeted and asked if we wanted just coffee or wanted food as well. We said we wanted drinks to go and were provided menus. We placed our order and had a seat in a cool little lounging area while waiting for our drinks.

The atmosphere was hip and had a good "hang out" vibe. They had a TV (turned off), and had latin music playing in the background. It seemed like it took it a while to get our drinks. The coffee was pretty good, though. I ordered a regular brewed coffee of Columbian origin. You have to select an "origin" when selecting your coffee. 

The staff was friendly, but it seemed like they were a little "disjointed" behind the counter and a little confused as to who was doing what. I am confident the longer they are open, the more in sync they will become and it will only get better from here.

In addition to coffee drinks, they offer a variety of food. One in our party got a bagel with  a cream cheese type of icing. I was lucky enough to sample it and was impressed. I look forward to checking this place out again and will update the review accordingly.

It's a great way to hangout with their amazing wifi connection, cool ambiance and your go-to neighborhood coffee shop. Definitely does not feel like you're in Vegas, which is a good thing for me. I moved from the midwest, and this area feels like Broad Ripple in Indianapolis or Bucktown from Chicago area where you and your local friends can hang out or just have a date with yourself. Servers are very accommodating and friendly, knowledgeable of their selections too. The food is good and well described, the menu is simple. I recommend everyone trying the lavender infused latte, this is their signature drink.

This was a nice small coffee shop downtown. We visited on a Sunday morning for their brunch. We were greeted right away by their staff and seated with their menus explained. We ordered the lavender latte and chai tea latte. Both were great choices and tastes great! We also ordered the Elvis Press and chicken omelet. The press was not as great as I thought it'd be seeing as it combined some of my favorites and the omelet was pretty runny inside. Overall the coffee was great but the food missed the mark for us. The atmosphere was a nice place relaxed feel and has a nice store front patio.

This place is absolutely fantastic!!!  I don't think I've ever loved everything at a restaurant before. The location, service, decor and THE FOOOOOD Try the sofrito burger  ...the fries, rice and beans, empanadas, salad, the coffee

It's weird walking into a place like this...I really feel they took a tiny scoop of a Portland coffee place and teleported it to downtown Vegas with a hipster twist. And actually....I'm ok with that. In fact, I kind of feel like my midlife-mom status goes up a couple "cool" points when I walk in the door. Like, 'good for you lace'...'go get your coffee face on'.

They are serious about the pour, flavor, and craft...it definitely ain't the norm. What I love is seeing all sorts of random folks in here: business suit types, yoga pants moms, and the college kids making us put ourselves in check...

What I've learned is to tell the staff what I like usually and then tell me what I should get based off their recommendations. They put a mean Latin twist on simple coffees, teas, and of course their bomb ass food!

So I let them "Make" me try something new...and I usually "Find" out it's awesome! Oh yeah, that's how it should be. Thanks for keeping me cool Maker's N Finders. You simply rock.

I've loved this place since they've opened. They recently expanded their menu and offer dinner as well as breakfast and lunch. Love the staff, they're very efficient. They never stop working! 

There was a small issue with my order, but the staff was quick to fix it. 

They offer a variety of different brew options for their coffee, as well as some creative latte options (Coconut Turmeric is a must try). 

Highly recommended!

I really wanted to like this place more because it's super cute and hipster. They were busy; but not packed; and our service was very slow. It took forever to get water. We ordered a French press coffee and it came at the same time as our food. I ordered the chilaquiles. They were average. Not outstanding. Definitely order meat with it because it's a small portion. I'd like to go back and try their arepas, I hear those are good. But, it was pricey and slow, so I'm not rushing back.

I can't wait to return for the grand opening. For a soft opening month things seem to be going very well, i found everyone to be personable and attentive.

It's great to see Sean running the coffee program there, he is a great barista with tons of enthusiasm and an equal amount of innovativeness (check out the coffee menu!). I also love how open for feed back they were on my visit, which if this is being reviewed by the owners can i beg for ORGANIC MILK?! No one else in Vegas is doing this, i would even be in for an up charge of 50 cents or so, optional or not.

I ordered the tomato bisque which was delightful, perfectly tomato-y and spot on with the black pepper. I really appreciated how understated it was, just simple clean flavors with no gimmicks. The croissant panini was a nice touch but could have been a bit warmer and i personally could have gone for a saltier cheese like a long aged cheddar or gruyere.

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience, especially the neighborhood vibe with the clean and lively interior. I know i will be returning several times before the grand opening. I can't wait to see this place evolve.

Great vibes happen here!  We started on the strip but wanted to get out of the craziness.  We were so happy we did some exploring and found this awesome coffee/breakfast spot.

Staff was super friendly and we loved the laid back atmosphere.  Great cup of Joe and healthy breakfast.

We took an Uber from the strip and walked around old town after.

I'm not sure why I never left a review after my first visit here. This place is amazing. The atmosphere is cute and upbeat. One word to describe it, hipster! This area is around hipster shops! 

Great service and great food! Calling all my vegetarian people out there to give this place a shot! It is a struggle looking for a place that has vegetarian food that is as tasty as this! You have to try the Arepa Benny Vegetarian style! I felt like i was eating real meat. LOL! Hopefully my body doesn't react bad to it! The Soyrizo Brussel Sprout was tasty as well! Seasoned with vinaigrette and so much more! My favorite drink is the Lavender Infused Latte! This drink is like crack.. Well for me at least. I used to come by before school and grab this drink to keep me going. 

I'm also not quite sure why this place is $$ when it's pretty cheap and it's the typical price as every other place!
Amazing breakfast food every time I come. I love the honey latte and the red arepa. Such delicious food. The Latin hash is also excellent. This is a great little place for lunch or breakfast!

I was invited by a blogger friend to go there to have a brunch today. It was my for the first time there and I loved it! Such a nice place, great area, delicious food. I had an iced matcha latte and a croissant. Yummy!
I like that we have 2 hour parking just in front of there!
I will come back for sure!
*instagram: @docsabrina

LOVE this fresh little coffee/breakfast spot. I've had the fries with garlic aioli sauce and also the arepa benny another time. The lavender latte is SO delicious as is the salted caramel. I can't wait to come back and try other items on their menu :) Service is great...the guys behind the bar and the owner (?) are very friendly and attentive.

Please don't come here if you are in a hurry. It took me and my group close to an hour to be seated after they said it was a 20 min wait. Then our food took nearly as long to come. It also took my friends nearly an hour just to get a cup of coffee.
I can say the service was quick and friendly, the coffee was great, the presentation was a little less but all  worth it just to have my dog accompany me. The Patio is dog friendly.

I had this place bookmarked for quite a while, and finally got to check it out when a friend from Chicago was visiting. There was a little bit of a wait for indoor dining, so we decided to sit out on the patio. It was cozy outside and the weather was good, though the table was a bit small for two.

Our server was very attentive and friendly, but I could tell that he was pretty new and inexperienced. 

The menu is fairly large, and there are a lot of interesting items on the menu. I ended up ordering an empanada sampler platter, and my friend one of the benedicts. The food was all very tasty, though portions moderate and I wasn't completely full at the end of my meal.

Overall, a very quaint breakfast/brunch place with unique offerings.

P.S. Street parking only.

DTLV is home to plenty of cute and thriving small businesses, but as a local, I'm always hesitant to make the drive up because thinking about street parking makes me tired. Paralleling is not my forte.  Luckily, we slid into a spot around the corner even at a high-traffic time like Sunday brunch day.

It was a 25 minute wait, but that was expected. The place was packed with peeps getting their brunch on. There's some lounge couches outside so at least you're comfy while waiting. And if you choose not to wait, there's a handful of other brunch spots within the vicinity. 

I chose the SMOKED SALMON BENNY. Who doesn't like some oozing egg yolk action? Savory and filling. The sautéed kale and tomatillo hollandaise gave it a nice twist. It also came with a few pieces of plantain chips, keeping with the Latin-inspired menu. My cousin opted for the GARLIC LIME CHICKEN off the lunch menu, which looked like it came with mashed potatoes amongst other things. Both menus are available from 7a-4p.

I read a lot of hype surrounding their lattes here, so we both decided to try iced ones: SALTED CARAMEL for me and LAVENDER for my cousin. Our waiter accidentally brought me mine hot, but said I could just keep it. When he brought my iced one, he took back the hot one. Indian giver! In fairness, I said I wasn't going to drink both of them anyway, so shrug. Also, they seemed to run out of mason jars for us, so it was brought out in plastic cups. It honestly just reminded me of a glorified iced caramel macchiato from Starbucks, but still enjoyed it. We forgot to check in before, but 20% off your latte if you do.

This is an amazing coffee shop/restaurant. They have amazing customer service. The people are friendly and they really treat you like family. Their coffee is amazing. Absolutely spectacular. If you haven't been they explain everything in detail for you. They are so patient. So if you haven't been you need to come.

I'm in love with this restaurant!!! I couldn't be happier to visit them at their new location as well! I can't wait to go try their lunch menu I can not change my breakfast plate since I love it so much. 
The coffees are amazingggg!!!!! I love how they have unique flavors that combine perfectly. I love the authentic Mexican cuisine they created and every time it comes out right. The service is great too the staff keeps Up with you and makes sure you are comfortable and enjoying your food. 

Go visit them and try them yourself you won't regret it! 

I had the lavender latte and the chilaquiles.

I had to change to a two star,  due to hours.   I have come here at times when it's closed.  Opens at 10 am on Sundays,  closes at 4 pm most days.   

Expensive, but nice atmosphere.  My espresso seemed watered down a bit, but it did taste like a good bean and plenty of foam on top.  If you want to hang out, I highly recommend this place  The staff is very friendly.

This place is for coffee lovers! The food is good. We loved the Empanada sampler plate. A great thing to share for brunch with friends. The atmosphere is hipster casual. We had the Carmel Latte with sea salt and a French Press that serves two. I was  happy to experience a Sunday brunch in the arts district. If you love great coffee this is your place.

Omg sooooo good, it was truly food I have had but not like theirs. Everything was so thoughtful and good. It's not cheep but worth it. We had everything from pastries to coffee and all in between... just go! Our new favorite place in Vegas.  Oh be sure to make time to check out all the cool vintage shops around too.

When you first walk up to maker and finders it has a totally different feel. It's definitely a diamond in the ruff. Right when you walk in, it has an amazing vibe. Great place to meet people, study, chat. I ordered the lavender infused latte. I have to say it was hands down one of my favorite latte. For one it wasn't basic like most are. It had a great balance of sweet and the lavender wasn't over powering. Then I had the smoked lox. I probably eat bagel and lox at least once or twice a week since I'm big on seafood, but that has to be one of the best iv had. I'm really happy I actually came across maker and finders, and will be going back with all my girls.
