Experienced their pop up shop downtown today! Had the honey Carmel latte and it was to die for. The barista was super friendly and fast!

As a Colombian, Paisa to be exact, I ordered the Bandeja Paisa this morning and have never been more ashamed that a restaurant would promote this sort of misrepresentation. The meat was burnt. The chicharron was pork belly marinated in Hoisin sauce. The beans were black with cotija cheese (COLOMBIANS use cargamanto beans and NEVER put cheese on top). The rice was long grain yellow. So offended by this misrepresentation of Colombian food. Let me not even get started on the "artwork" of Pablo getting shot. A poor imitation of a Botero and just using gangster culture to their benefit to sell bad food.

The coffee was good. They have milk Alternatives so I got the coconut milk. This sweetened my coffee up quite a bit. 

Vegan options on Sunday are a no-go. I had a bagel with peanut butter. It comes to me as a surprise that this downtown hipster place in the arts district doesn't have vegan options. Pretty disappointing.

If i came back, it would be for coffee but that'll be it sadly.

We have given this place plenty of chances, but the customer service is just awful. I just cannot come here anymore despite the good coffee. On my most recent trip, I waited 20 minutes for one drink (and no, it did not feel like 20 mins, it really was). Waiting is bad enough, but the customer service is even worse. Too many other options that would be more than happy to take our business. Good luck in the future, you will need it!
Came across this gem walking through Downtown Summerlin and I loved the atmosphere, the setup and the friendly customer service. I will be a returning customer!

Hipsters be raving about the coffee here but there isn't a really a whole latte to talk about. I consider myself an avid coffee drinker and have become pretty picky about my coffee. I will say I am NOT A LATTE PERSON. I drink my coffee with a little half and half with a a dash of sweetener, but still like the flavor of coffee present. I had a regular cup of coffee which was nothing special, just like the food.

THE FOOD: The food is not that great... Pretty bland. My lady odered the Arepa Benny, which I could care less. We also tried the Lavender Latte which wasn't bad, but also nothing special. 

THE PRICE: About as much as you would expect for hispters in a coffee shop. 

THE VIBE: TOOK FOREVER! It was not super crowded but the food and coffee took a really long time. The staff was super friendly, but geez their cook must be cooking with one hand cuz that took way too long, although, if he was cooking with one hand I am thoroughly impressed. Nothing special about the decor. Not fancy but not dirty, just that typical... "hey im a hipster drinking coffee" vibe.

OVERALL: Nothing special... I have had better, and considering you are in vegas and off the strip, it is guaranteed you can find better.

Decided to try the avocado salad because I was craving avocado and chicken. I ordered for delivery and will say the taste was great but this was a tomato salad with a light bed of lettuce, four strips of chicken and less than half of an avocado. Mind you I ordered extra avocado or an avocado salad and still didn't come close. It suppose to have cotija cheese on top and I can't even say it had a sprinkle. I don't know if they were in a rush or what the deal was but very disappointed with what I was given.  I will admit the flavor was amazing and for that reason I would try it again to see if prepare it better if I'm at the restaurant instead of ordering for delivery.  I also ordered te chicken tinga empanadas which were delicious.  I can only imagine if done correctly how amazing this salad would taste.  Defiantly worth another try.

I can't wait to come back here!

I had the lavender latte and the sofritos burger. Both were delicious, the atmosphere (and playlist) was great, and the baristas were so friendly.
Brilliant place for breakfast and great coffee from an Aussie coffee snob. Friendly and attentive service, great vibe and really delicious food. A must try!

I stopped by Makers & Finders since I had read some good reviews and was in the area.  I had the Lavender Latte with coconut milk and an order of the mushroom empanadas.  Both were really good.  Service could have been better.  I was acknowledged fairly quickly, given a menu and some recommendations and then ignored when I was ready to order until different person saw me and asked for my order.  I'm still giving it four stars since the food and coffee were good and the 2nd guy wasn't bad.

This coffee place is located at the Vegas art district. We were all excited before coming in but then left with disappointment.
Don't be fooled by the great reviews! I think most of the great reviews go to the cute and nice environment instead of the food. 
I ordered the bon bon latte and chicken tinga omelet with a side of Brussels sprouts. The Bon bon latte (layered latte with condensed milk and coco powder) came in a small cup ($5). It was unique but too sweet for me. The chicken omelet was wet and the whole plate was watery, it made the chips on the side all wet, gross! The Brussels sprouts came in a cute small pot which is great in presentation. The dish was flavorless, I expected something roasted and flavorful but it's not the case at all! 
The service was slow! My other friend ordered the house coffee (which I think it's simple and quick, may be I'm naive?) we waited for about 15 mins for that. We told the server to check for us and he did. Then we saw the barista poured the last portion of coffee from the container. It wasn't enough for the cup then he watered it down. I was like ..... 
I won't come back for sure!

I had higher hopes for this place. The look of the cafe (restaurant? coffee shop? what is it?) is cool. They have a covered front patio with plenty of seating, which is a nice bonus. It's advertised as Latin American, but the only Latin feel I get is from the music. There were some Latin food options but most of it was too American-friendly when I'm looking for a Latin experience. 

We were feeling more peckish than hungry, so we ordered the avocado toast, smoked salmon toast, and tomato soup with grilled cheese. Both toasts were perfect. The tomato soup had the consistency of puréed tomatoes and was served lukewarm. The grilled cheese was made with a croissant. Now, I'm a huge fan of croissants, but as a grilled cheese, it's not the best. Instead of a crispy bread with a soft center, the whole thing felt soggy and greasy. Then, when dipped in tomato soup (as is the tradition), it fell apart. Especially because the soup was thick. And finally, I ordered the Nutella crepe but never got it.

They also recommended the Beermosa to me. In theory, it sounded interesting. But to me it tasted like a sweet cough syrup. But that just might be me.

Now as for the service, it was fine. Our hostess/server was nice. But we were the only two people in the place on a Saturday night at 7 pm. It felt like they were getting ready to close (mop was out, cleaning the windows) and they weren't due to close for another two hours. 

The espresso and coffee are good! And they have a walk-up window for coffee orders--so that's probably cool when you're walking around the area.

After this experience, it's hard to justify traveling all the way here for a second visit unless I happen to be in the Arts District.
I love that we found this place. They have amazing coffee and food for a great price. I'm moving to Vegas soon and can't wait to come here more often.

Clean with a little old downtown vibe. Simple artwork painted on the walls. The bar is visible so you can see what they are making for you. Which I enjoy the look of drip coffee. Everything is mason jars and glass wear. So your drink is visible giving that refreshing vibe. The space is very open so no worries about running into everyone. I highly recommend the lavender latte. If you don't want whole milk, they also have almond milk available. You can place orders online which is very helpful when you need to grab your drink and go. Thank you to the staff this morning for having my drinks ready. My coworkers and I loved them!

Went to Vegas for the weekend and decided to grab breakfast here before we went home. It's located at the arts district and the cafe itself had a good ambiance. Has a very bright, clean and modern latin feel. Loved the music. 

We ordered mexican spiced mocha and the iced matcha latte with coconut milk. The mocha was delicious--not too sweet but also not bitter. The iced matcha isn't like the starbucks matcha--it's a little stronger and less sweet but not anything I couldn't handle. 

We ordered the chicken tinga empanada. We loved it so much we ordered some to-go for the ride home. The pulled pork benny was also good--it came with plantain chips and I thought that was a nice touch to their menu. It is "latin comfort food" as they like to call it.

Service was great. We asked the server questions about the food--she was knowledgable and recommended some of the food she likes. There are gluten-free, vegeterian and vegan options for those who have diet preferences.

Parking wasn't too great, we got lucky there were some empty spots across the street and there was some construction going on. Not their fault at all so I will not dock any stars.

I don't think I was ready... 
I came in with a Denny's expectation and left wanting an encore. 

The service was great and friendly. I tried things I had ever even heard of and they were all amazing. Who knew Bacon and Peanut Butter went together.  

If you're looking for a change in pace from the normal breakfast, I urge you to check this place out. You won't be sorry...
Wished I lived closer so I could grab some lavender coffee more frequently! Amazing food!
Very nice and unique place that lives up to the revitalization of the downtown area. Coffees are fantastic!!

My friend and I drove all the way from the NW to try this spot. Based on the reviews I was eager to be amazed. I ordered iced London Fog which was a STASH Earl Grey tea bag in a mason jar with lavender and milk. None of the flavors stood out. Apparently it started as hot tea then ice was added to the mason jar glass. The melted ice watered the tea down and was served lukewarm. I expect iced tea to already be chilled so when poured over ice you don't water down the beverage. If this is the method they use to make iced tea then add 2 tea bags to the glass so enough tea flavor is released to accommodate the extra water from the melted ice. For $5 I want to taste the tea and lavender. For food I chose the Mango Aperas. What a disappointment! If the word mango is in the name of the dish then put enough mango in it to showcase it. I got 5 matchsticks of mango that measured about 1.5" X 1/4" thick. The portion of mango looked like there was only one mango left in the kitchen and they were using it carefully to last the entire day. The sliced thin tomato, and 3 slices of avocado hardly makes this dish worth $9! Considering the location and the neighborhood their prices are way too high for the portions. I left disappointed and hungry!

My expectations were either too high, or my taste buds weren't impressed. Customer service can be better.  Coffee was excellent, food was average. I had the empanadas they were average at best, there was no crunch to them, but flavor was decent and they were on the cold side. Also ordered was the latin hash, it was good, had a home cooked flavor. Also got plantain chips I am assuming they buy bags of this and serve them. I thought they were actually frying them. Coffee was awesome, this place is definitely a coffee house ...my cortadito was excellent not bitter, not too sweet, temperature was good, and I like the glasses used. Over all go for the COFFEE.

Had a lovely salmon "benny" at Makers & Finders today. Tasty and satisfying! We sat on the patio, which was comfy if a little bit awkward in terms of table height. The thing that stuck out to me was the quality: the benedict and cappuccino I had were both very well prepared. Personally, the smallish portion size was perfect for me, but I can imagine it might be a bit disappointing for the average appetite. The service was a bit spotty, but it was obvious that they were trying to handle the lunch rush. But these nitpicky complaints feel like no big deal thanks to the yummy food. All in all, an enjoyable lunch spot! I would definitely eat here again if in the area!

Place is busy. Expect a wait. They have outdoor seating which was expectedly full. 
Got some lattes to start. The hot lavender latte was just ok. Good for trying once. My husband got a salted caramel latte and it was delish. Waited quite a long time for them to be made....
I ordered the La Paisa which came out fairly quick. Good, quality food. Could've used a little heat..but overall good.
My husband got a breakfast croissant. Pretty basic, nothing special.
Atmosphere was nice and bright. Modern decor.
Service was pretty slow. I think there was only one girl helping most of the place, so that didn't help considering how busy they were. She didn't come around much.

A nice stop in the arts district. Walk off your food afterwards and check out all the vintage shops down the block. :)
Great spot!! LOVED the coffee, my meal was delicious too I had the chilaquiles and pancakes so so good!!

This review is dinner only - no coffee.  We got the lomo saltado and la paisa arepas.  Both were good, but not amazing, and overpriced for what we got.  Lomo: the beef was flavorful but tough, stingy on the onions and peppers, fries delicious (highlight of the meal), no jalapenos though the menu called for them, egg was done right, and rice was just meh.  For $14.00, the quality wasn't up to par and the serving size was disappointing.  Arepa: like the lomo, the beef was flavorful but tough, plantains weren't very good, pretty tough and flavorless, black beans were meh, avocado - stingy!  Avocado looked almost like garnish than part of the meal.  Overall, good, but not great, and for the prices, we expected more.  Without the automatic markup for being in Summerlin, this might be four stars, but for the quality and mediocre portions, three stars.  We hope their coffee will be better!

3 stars at best...the cafe is cute. The hipster vibe is cool but food was just ok. I'm factoring in that Vegas has a small up and coming trendy scene and that's why people love this place.
GOOD-
The cafe has a bunch of local Vegas hipsters hanging out and a really interesting selection of creative food and beverage items.
Coffee drinks were great and clearly the highlight of this place.
The menu had a lot of tasty sounding options.
NOT GREAT-
The prices were high for SMALL PORTIONS of food.
The food itself was good but not stellar! Not for what you pay. My friend ordered more food cause she was still hungry after her "appetizer sized" breakfast.

Not great enough to warrant a revisit next time we are in town.

I was pretty disappointed with this particular visit. My food (chilaquiles with beef) was delicious, but my mother had a bad experience ordering off of the al la carte menu. Her eggs were fine, but the bacon she ordered was burnt to the point of inedibility. The side of potatoes was very cold and soggy (ridiculous considering the $4 price point). As always the coffee was delicious, but I can't help but feel underwhelmed this visit. I would like to see more care taken with side orders. I myself have experienced the cold side of potatoes in a previous visit.

Very VERY cute spot! 
I'm here as I write this. Even tho they open at 7am, I thought I'd be the only one here...let's be honest, who's in this area at 10am... I sit corrected because there were a few patrons at the coffee bar, community table, and a few tables on the floor. 

I sat at the community table (as I am solo-dolo) & I wanted to get some work done. 

Immediately ordered the cortadito as I order wherever I see it on the menu....loved the presentation with the HEART coffee art in the middle. It was strong and distinct in flavor. 

Christian, the manager, offered me a toffee biscotti which they get from a local bakery & and ice tea with cinnamon on top, which they just made and like to play around with the flavors. 
The ice tea was super refreshing and was an added kick of flavor with the cinnamon. 
Biscotti, which I normally don't like, was good in todd flavor but, SOFT, which I especially liked. Reminded me of a cookie! 

Ordered the chorizo brussel sprouts, which we're TO-DIE-FOR! Chorizo everywhere with few pieces of grilled shrimp. But, that pungent red wine vinegar taste was just up my alley!!!! Crunchy, savory, and very meaty. The only bad thing I have to say it, I think the shrimp were grilled too long because it was kind of tough. 

As I ate that, barista Sean, offered me a spiced almond mint coffee and OH-MY-GAWD, it was perfect for this weather. Lots of cinnamon, creamy, and I think bits of mint in it. I could just picture myself drinking this by the fireplace and getting all cozy-wozy. Perfect for cuddle season :) 

I would love to try more of their slow-drips but, I'll wait to go with my boyfriend as he's the true coffee lover!

Reviews talk about the long wait for items but, I haven't found that as such. 
Workers are great. Super friendly and pretty attentive considering how must they've gotten since I've sat here. 

As I sit here with 3 cups of drinks in front of me, I am happy!



***15 minutes after I write this review*** UPDATE

This place is now buzzing with customers and my community table is now filled with a group of rather good-looking Aussie (some kind of accent) men talk about how to market their brand and how DTLV is changing culturally for the better... Totes hipster -- I LIKE IT! lol this place is something I can very well picture in San Francisco. 

The manager, also, brings out Ojaldras (honey orange batter, cinnamon sugar, lechera) with seasonal #peppermint ice cream and fruits. It's one of their sweet treats and reminds me of a filipino dish with the cinnamon sugar fried batter chip thingies (Ojaldras). Paired with the seasonal peppermint ice cream it was L O V E! 
I'm so full. All I came for was the cortadito. 

I swear, I need to get a bigger tummy to inhale more food/drink as a Yelper!

This place was an average brunch place in terms of food and drinks. The place itself is very hip and trendy but it's a great place to just get a quick bite. Our server was nice and accommodated to our needs just fine. I ordered the salted caramel latte with extra shot of espresso but it was still a bit too sweet and not as strong as I expected. Then I got the arepa la paisa which I enjoyed. The serving was just right for me but I wished there were more avocados on it (looked like it was just a garnish - see picture). My friend and boyfriend got the arepa benny which they enjoyed as well. Then my friend's husband got the chicken tinga empanadas (also good) and the chorizo brussel sprouts (a little underwhelming). Overall, it was a good quick fix and a nice trendy spot to hang out in.
45 minutes for a cup of coffee to go is ridiculous, and shows a blatant disrespect for a customers time ....to top it off,  coffee was lousy.  I will not be back.
This place has great Latin fusion breakfast and the tea & coffee options are very unique and healthy.

We came here for lunch today, and I was really looking forward to coming here. We ordered our food and waited a very long time, more than 45+ minutes even though the restaurant wasn't necessary that busy. The table next to us who was served later even got their food much sooner than us. It was very difficult to flag down a waiter as well, and our server changed halfway through. I ordered the chicken sandwich expecting a filling meal, and was very disappointed to have two small crostini type sandwiches with very little meat. It didn't come with the avocado cream listed on the menu as well.
To top it off, I ordered an Arnold Palmer, and I got a super sweet orange juice concoction that they charged me $5 for. We waited more than 20 minutes to get our check back as well. I am just very disappointed in a place that has high reviews here on yelp since my experience was not good. I'm sure this place has good coffee, but I don't recommend coming here for a sit down meal.

Bro, what a great spot!  A chick I was with here called it delightful. I overheard someone saying something about it being orgasmic. My brain and taste buds registered top points with the Cuban Espresso. Coconut Turmeric Latte... Holy-S it is the best Latin latte I've had in the past 30 years - I'll throw in a period dot there.

First time was great was second time not so much
I got old coffee and the music they where playing was horrible, plus our waitress was very rude. The only okay thing was there Arnold Palmer. I don't recommend
Great little spot in the arts district. Staff were nice, atmosphere was chill and the food was delicious.

I LOVE this spot. I'm staying at The Cosmopolitan and came here to escape The Strip. Makers & Finders is amazing for Sunday brunch. It's packed at 12:30p on Sunday (get here early for no wait). The lavender latte with almond milk is my new favorite coffee drink (homemade lavender syrup)! The Eggs Benny with Hollandaise (modified from the red sauce) and the Avocado Relleno (w tuna and capers)... really?? This spot is a dream come true! Thanks Makers! Keep up the great work!

Food was okay, overpriced for mediocre bfast options specifically on the healthy section since that's what my table mainly ordered from. Basically another hipster place with a really awesome Latin cuisine twist, but I wouldn't come back. Coffee is on point, but left hungry. :/
This a cute spot for Breakfast, brunch, or Lunch. Great food. Great Coffee. Love finding new place like this to try. Definitely coming back.!

I'm fairly new to the area and a work contact asked to meet here on a Monday morning. It's in a very non-descript location in between some Mexican restaurants and mattress stores. Oh and it's next door to a Brewing co. so that's cool. 

I was pleasantly surprised at the pleasant, polished atmosphere as I walked in. Well dressed people were sipping coffee and eating at tables in the all white, chic decor and plopped at the bar reading newspapers and chatting. 

I was also surprised that I had the option to sit at a table, given a menu and had full service for a coffee date. They even had food too, had I wanted breakfast. (need to try the food next time). 

I didn't know what to order, but the server was helpful, friendly and suggested the Cortadito. I said "sure why not". Oh, man was it amazing. It was tiny like an espresso drink and served in a mini-mason jar with a pretty heart drawn into the foamy top. I started sipping slowly and while a little bitter at first, it finished smooth and sweet. By the end of the drink, I realized this was probably the  best coffee I've ever had. Needless to say I live in Henderson but have gone out of my way to stop by and try other things. The next time I tried the honey & vanilla latte after asking for a drink that wasn't super sweet. The staff is so courteous, professional and polite! 

Seriously, just do yourself a favor and go. Treat yourself.

This place is an amazing breakfast, lunch or just coffee spot with a Columbian flare!! Great atmosphere and easy to get to. They have unique coffee and breakfast options, I had the lavender infused latte and fell in love. One of the owners, Valerie, was so sweet and came to tell us about their place and wanted our honest feedback and we had nothing but great things to say. This will be our new work meeting spot :)
Such a cute coffee house. Food and coffee was INCREDIBLE. Amazing atmosphere, service was great. Definitely recommend for lunch.
Cool place located near Antique Row. I tried the Rajas arepa, which was only ok. I liked the plantain chips better.

I'm glad more places like this are opening up downtown, and I would like to see m&f do well. The ambiance is nice and the employees were friendly. Others commented on the temp of the lattes, which I thought was perfect - hot, just below scalding. Waiting 20 min before I can drink my coffee without burning my tongue makes me sad. But $6 is a lot for a coffee - remember when we used to order those outrageously priced $4 lattes from other coffee shops? I ordered the Mexican Spice latte, which was tasty, very sweet, and seemingly made with love. The Veggie Bagel on the other hand, was disappointing. It was basically a dinky little Sarah Lee bagel with a few tiny pieces of avocado and tomato slices on one half, and nuthin on the other. For $8 I want a good bagel and enough veggies to cover both sides of it. All said and done, I spent almost $20 on a latte and a bagel (inc. tax n tip) which is silly.

Oh. My. God. This places serves the only lattes that have ever found their way into my heart. I wish I could bring this place to Chicago because nothing compares to the quality they serve! I ended up stopping here twice on my trip, two days in a row, because I couldn't get enough of the lavender latte. They had such an amazing and expansive menu of coffee and espresso drinks, which from the ones I tried, were so unbelievably good. What really stood out to me was the consistency and quality of the drinks. Each one was made with a lot of care and attention to detail! I know I keep repeating myself, but every so often I'll sigh and reminisce about how wonderful the lavender latte was.

Aside from the drinks, the food was phenomenal. I loved the tinga and the arepas! Our waitress was lovely and very friendly. I really enjoyed everything about my experience here. I'm looking forward to returning next time I'm in Vegas!

Went to try this place out with my husband during the week. LOVED it ! It's a small place but very cozy. Their lattes a DEliCious ! And I absolutely adore the designs they creat with the foam! I also saw a person next to me have a purple latte! Pretty cool! My husband had their breakfast dish with Tinga and I had their popular hash dish. They were both really good I just wish the food could have been a bit warmer. Kinda felt like it had been sitting out for a while till they brought it out for us. Also taking one star off due to the length of time it took for us to receive our food(we went on a Tuesday and it wasn't really full with customers). Also I had ordered my latte and the server forgot about it! But still loved the place and will for sure come back! They also have WiFi and an outdoor area to relax and get some work done.
Quaint little nice place. Service was slow but the food was good. I had smoked salmon Benny. It was very tasty but was not very warm. I would probably give it another chance

Me and my wife come here every Sunday for coffee and brunch. Service and food quality are always on point. Today I brought my family that is visiting and it had multiple situation with the kitchen(poached egg way over cooked and became solid egg and outside substance in the egg white) However, GM ed and server Johnny handled it very very well. Definitely the service made up for this trip. Will come back for sure!

Great service, atmosphere, coffee and food. I had pour - over coffee and the arepa benny. Delicious. Hubby had the salted caramel latte and the la Pais arepa, and we got some crispy fries to try. Coffees took a while to arrive, but it didn't bother me at all and were well worth the wait. We were there about an hour and spent under $35, which is amazing. I definitely recommend checking it out if you want to try something a little different than the typical breakfast offerings, and if you appreciate an excellent cup of coffee!

A cute cafe in the Arts district. The coffee is great. I had the coconut turmeric latte--delicious! 
The food was good, but not great. The dough for the empanadas is more like a puff pastry, and the filling-to-wrap ratio was a little too low.
The bandeja paisa was A LOT of food and proteins. The steak was a bit overcooked and dry. It comes with a 1 inch-wide strip of pork belly, not to mention a fried egg and avocado, beans, plantains, and rice! Aside from the steak, everything tasted good, but it was way too much food. 
The service is very friendly. I'd definitely return for the coffee!

Heard great things about this place and in an area full of cute antique stores, we HAD to try it out and grab a coffee before exploring!
We were greeted as we walked through the door and shown to a table/given menus.
The atmosphere is really cool, there's a little study spot which people were making the most of near the bar, pretty tile, neon lights and a great open space. The tables are a little close together but as it wasn't too busy, we had space either side.
Israel was our server and he was very friendly and always came over with a smile. There were a LOT of options for coffee and they all looked so good it was hard to decide, but we went for the cortado and cortadito - mine the smaller one - and it was SO good!
The food menu was again, extensive and there was so much - too much even - to choose from. Thankfully they had a screen near the bar with images of all their dishes and drinks that it became easier when you could see it all. We went for the breakfast croissant and the arepa benny. 
When they both came, the benny looked impressive and the croissant a little measly, especially with no little side salad or even garnish, but the croissant was delicious! They didn't skimp on the bacon and the orange sauce it came with was so good we asked for a little more! The benny on the other hand was disappointing! The poached egg was runny but when I broke into it, a whole lot of water came out and made everything a little soggy. There was a good amount of meat but it wasn't seasoned and as such, was pretty tasteless. The hollandaise also pretty tasteless. Such a shame because I was craving a benny before arriving but didn't care to finish this one.
M & F really seem to have their strengths along with the odd weakness, so I would try something else next time and either way, come back for the coffee!

Went back here back in early January, but getting around to the review now. But I got to say this is one of thee great coffee places I've been to in Vegas. The lavendar latte was really good, I'd not only recommend it, but I'd say I'll be back for sure !
awesome! delicious food, friendly staff, nice atmosphere. good place to eat, hangout and/or get done work done. recommended.

The atmosphere in Makers and Finders is amazing. Very relaxed and a chill vibe. It's has art on all of the walls. The customer service is impeccable. Our waiter was very friendly, even to my 3 year old daughter. They bring you a large bottle full of ice cold water, which I loved. I ordered the Chilaquiles and an Iced Salted Caramel Latte. Let me just say the Chilaquiles just melted in your mouth, so full of flavor. I devoured every single bite. It was also the just right amount of food. So you felt full without overeating. The Salted Caramel Latte was just sweet enough, rich and creamy. I could have drank several. And I know it's a little detail but the ice they used in the latte was perfect. Similar to slushy ice, not big ice cubes. They were very accommodating and let my daughter order cheesy scrambled eggs that weren't on the menu. She had their orange juice which was so fresh. They even gave us a to go cup for it. We cannot wait to go back.
Great spot to hang out and have coffee, however,  the food lacked flavor and wasn't cooked properly.

Was debating 4 stars because to-go orders take 30 mins, but told myself it's because this is more of a sit down and converse cafe. Def not Starbucks! Thank God for that!

We ordered the honey vanilla latte, lavender latte, and breakfast empanadas. 

Honey vanilla latte: Lightly sweetened with hints of cinnamon and honey. If you like more coffee than sweet, this is a nice option. 

Lavender latte: Syrup made in house daily!!!  Ayyyyyyeeee. It was sweetened just right and it didn't overpower the coffee at all. 

NOW FOR THE SHINING STAR! Holy shit!! The empanadas. DAMNIT!!! This is what we waited 30 mins for. I was waiting on the car with the babes and the hubby went in and ordered. I text him, "the hell is happening? Is the place being robbed?" He said, "they're making the empanadas to order."

I thought, damn, they aren't just THERE in a case? These things better be up there with AMAZING and THE SWEET BABY JESUS. 

They were. Fuck. They were fried, crispy, with some type of orange deliciousness on them and filled with bacon, eggs, and potatoes. I was so sad that we only ordered one each. I almost ate the hubbies too, but realized he's driving us so better not. 

If you can dine in, do so. Thirty minutes was a lot to wait for a to go order. Coffee was ready in 5 minutes. 

Definitely want to go back and try the chipotle chicken empanada.

How can I give any less than 5 stars when a small business owner opens his doors for me before his business is actually open?

I stopped in to check out Makers & Finders the day before the soft opening, and I found the owner doing some work to prepare. I was just asking him the closing time for the next day, and next thing you know I'm sitting at the bar drinking a fruity pourover from Costa Rica.

This place looks amazing. Clean and modern, you almost forget you're in old downtown Las Vegas. They have a couple couches to relax in and a row of USB ports at the bar.  I saw a food menu and pictures on Yelp and can't wait to try the food, too.

As for the coffee, it's delicious. These guys definitely know their stuff.  I will be coming back as much as possible to try different beans prepared in different styles.

Apparently their hours for the first month will only be 11:30-3:30, but starting in December they said they'll have their full 7am-7pm hours. This will definitely be my new hangout to get some work done. Much more comfortable a spot then The Bean.

Coffee and food definitely 5 STAR the wait was unfortunate though. My family had a birthday brunch on a late Sunday morning and boy were my husband and I surprised at the delicious coffees and meals we had. We waited for quite some time before we were seated so I wouldn't suggest showing up famished...hungry people can be grouchy...but the food was definitely worth the wait. As busy as they were, all the help was calm and polite.
Awesome food and awesome coffee. The Arepa Benny was delicious. I also tried the empanadas and the sliders which were also great.  Great customer service.
Awesome spot worth checking out if you are downtown. Great set up, low key, and artisanal. Get the honey vanilla latte. Not too sweet plenty of taste.

Love this place! Great tasting food and a friendly atmosphere. Started with the Lavender infused Latte. Amazing and delicious! Server suggested a maple and bacon Latte, so I had to try. One word, awesome! Tried the tomato soup that has chunks of potatoes, kale, onions, and chorizo. Had a bit of heat to it, but was hearty and delicious. Main course, I did the Arepas Benedict. The Arepa part of the dish took some getting used to, but it worked. With a grand opening on December 5th, this place is already super busy. Talk of a dinner menu being added later on down the road. Sounds like a great plan! Servers were superb with very attentive service. Suggestions were offered and smiles were a flowing. This place is definitely worth the trip and is a great addition to a dismal area.

Ok this is third time here and I have not been  disappointed. First of all great atmosphere and very clean. Second of all the fella that makes the coffee has a gift. I'm a cream and sugar kind of person but not here. Food is delightful and super flavorful. Today I had the something hash. Basically potatoes and pulled pork with veggies and extra delish. 

I definitely recommend!!
Amazing customer service along with delicious drinks and food! The vibe is perfect inside and out....would highly recommend to anyone and everyone

My go to spot before work! I honestly jump around from other spots, but makers and finders is always consistent. As far as good goes, I always try to order something different. And I have yet to be disappointed! Their plates are particular wonderful for the gluten intolerant! Lots of gluten free options! My go to cup of coffee is an almond milk latte. No sugar needed! That's how good the coffee is! One of the baristas mentioned they're learning to hand roast their own beans? Something along that line? Either way, their coffee is sourced locally! Which I'm a huge fan of local businesses and supporting them!!! 

Food? Love the arepas. Avocado toast. Plantain chips... Brussels sprouts. Just had the chilaquiles today! Sooooo good!! With a tomatillo salsa  and beef!
This is the best breakfast I've ever eaten. The pork empanada was my favorite. The Bon Bon was good. It was decaf. When you are done you can sit on a lounge chair. It was AWESOME!

I had a meeting with two friends and this was where it was suggested we get together.  I ordered a salted caramel latte while I waited.  It took longer than I thought it would be--almost 5 minutes--but it was brought just as my friends were entering the shop.  

Salted caramel will get me anytime and this was no exception.  A good tasting coffee with the right amount of flavoring and salt.  There is wifi offered by I didn't get the password so I went without using their wifi.

The place was fairly quiet when I went in for our 2:00 pm meeting, but by the time I was leaving a short time before 4, the place was fairly crowded and quite lively.

This is definitely worth another visit to try for breakfast or to get an empanada that I saw on their menu.  I will be back.
Excellent service & the coffee is the best I've had in Vegas.  I had the steak arepa & it was amazing... Very flavorful and perfect portion.

Congrats on 3 years, I happened to be here when they were being recognized and celebrated for it.  Damn, have I been coming here for 3 years and only now writing a review?!

I'm just getting back from Seattle where coffee is around every corner but really good coffee shops in Las Vegas are a dime a dozen and there are few that offer food that matches the quality of their drinks.

I've been here numerous times now, to sit in/out, and take out and I've pretty much know exactly what I want now.  The Smoked Lox (salmon bagel), and a cooled off lavender infused latte.  

I love salmon bagels and the one they have here I have to say is one of the best I have ever tasted.  And for your lavender latte, let it cool a little bit before you burn your tongue and can't taste any of the lavender.

Thought I'd try this place and drop by for breakfast and a cup of coffee, since I work down the street. First off the atmosphere was really cool and relaxing, the staff was really nice also. I ordered the Latin hash and a cup of the vanilla latte and it was absolutely the best cup of coffee I had in awhile! The Latin hash was also good a lot of flavor but the coffee was hands down the best! I will definitely be back!
I ate there twice in one day. Their brunch is amazing! Great omelets! Friendly staff, beautiful ambiance! I'll be visiting again!

Loved this coffee place! Their breakfast croissant sandwich I got was really good. It came with banana chips with some sauce that was good. My only complaint is that I waited about 30 mins for my coffee. My food came out before my coffee. And my coffee was cold. But the ambience was cool the food was good and the vibes were nice for the rainy day I went so I'll go back and try again

My favorite coffee shop 
I tried salted caramel latte, it was so good I love it ! 
For parking,
I can park my car next restaurant for 2 hours for free 
Price was regular 
Menu was easy to read 
I love my coffee and my omelette!

A good walk from Fremont, this place has it all. Coffee, bar, breakfast and.. T-Shirts?? Best coffee I've ever had, had to go with the most renowned coffee they offer so got the Lavender infused latte and the honey vanilla iced latte.. Both surpass the competition.. For a hot drink the Lavender infused is a cozy and decedent choice where as the honey vanilla is a bright uplifting cold drink. Also had to buy a shirt for my girl when we stopped here. They have a strong selection of well designed and manufactured t-shirts and tanks. Def worth stopping here if you're in Vegas.

I love that you can get brunch until 4. It's unrealistic to end breakfast foods anytime before that in Vegas.

My friend got the lavender coffee and the only adjective I can think of is "divine". She's a smarty pants so she asked for less sweet with simple syrup on the side.

Portions are perfect for one person and everything is so fresh. If you're with a big party, you'll be sitting for quite some time before receiving your food or beverage. Come not hungry and by the time you receive your meal you'll devour it.

Decided to have coffee here again and was not disappointed at all! Taking my drink to go I sit here and watch them make my iced Carmel drink and it smells so good. The barista is very quick on that machine too! The art on the walls is so awesome. I love the goat image hanging above the leather couch. Plus the throw pillow on the couch describes my mood currently. This pillow say, "Don't bother me yet, until I have coffee!" Now coffee is ready and time to enjoy and enhance my mood.

Unimpressed. The waitress was not knowledgeable in the coffee origins and not willing to ask for assistance. We ordered 2 pour overs and had to switch. The food was not good, my chilaquiles lacked flavor and were extremely small portion. We will not be returning

Makers and Finders is so much more than just coffee. What a great restaurant for breakfast or brunch and drinks!

Some recommendations are the sea salt and caramel latte and their plantains with black beans!

Their drinks are great iced or hot. Sit outside if it's nice out. My huge gripe with this joint is their lack of nearby parking. This is due to construction, but it's a huge issue. It was nice to enjoy the weather and walk though.

My weakness for Lattes and love for hole in the wall coffee shops led me here this lovely morning.

We sat out front because the weather was gorgeous. That beautiful overcast after the storm type of weather that begs for a warm coffee and good conversation.

Ordered:

Mexican Spiced Latte- 5/5

Super flavorful! You definitely knew what you were drinking not like some places where your order a specialty latte and what flavor its supposed to have is completely hidden away under a heavy layer of coffee taste. 

***Bonus Points for having an adorable heart design on top of my latte***

Bionico- 5/5

What a wonderful way to kick start my morning! Fresh, seasonal fruit (Pears and Strawberries) layered on top of a decent bed of crunchy granola topped with a scoop of Greek Yogurt and finished off with a light drizzle of warm honey. Light and fresh, this was everything a breakfast should be.

Makers & Finders is pretty much ideal when it comes to coffee shops: good selection of fancy, pour-over coffees and actually delicious tea drinks, too (side note: why does any shop NOT have matcha??). Great hip location downtown, next to a brewery. Cool patio. Good food, ranging from pastries to 'latin comfort food.' (other side note: I like anything latin), and including greek yogurt with granola.
I've enjoyed taking my out of town family here for breakfast, meeting my run club for post-run drinks, and just hanging out with my green-tea loving daughters.
Only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because the prices are a li'l high.
This place is a great hangout... Loved the lavender latte and honey vanilla latte... Good food, good atmosphere!

This is such a cute and modern spot nestled right into the Arts District. The service was fast and friendly, and the food was AMAZING. I got the coconut waffle, which was soft and sweet and covered in the most amazing fruit compote. My mom got the vegetarian benny, which looked and tasted superb. The plantain chips add deliciousness to every plate. Both of us had the "lavender fog," which I want to figure out how to replicate because it was the most amazing tea experience!! I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.

The coffee is good: unique preparations, decent roasts, attractive lattes. The atmosphere is open, nice outdoor seating, and friendly staff. The food is expensive and not of high quality, in fact it looks much better in my mind's eye than in front of my actual eyes. It was just not good...it's a nice place, but over priced.

I've been going to M&F since they first opened for years. I've always had a good experience and this place is all about the vibe. The ownership and management are young and fresh and totally know what we as customers are looking for. I'm trying to eat some tasty, healthy food, sip my coffee, and chill. They have vegan options and great prices ! I am more of a straight espresso kind of girl but they have the most decadent coffees if you're into different flavors. I personally like to sit outside and listen to music but you can grab a table or sit at the bar as well. They just opened a location in the Summerlin Mall that is just as swanky as this one for those who live on that side. I work on the strip and people are always asking me the best spots to check out, especially the local spots, I always include Makers & Finders on my list .

Customer service was excellent. Food is delicious. The Arepa Benny with avocado was exquisite and the vanilla latte was perfect! I am definitely coming back to try more items on the menu. 

The ambiance and decor is very simplistic. I enjoyed the open area. You don't leave smelling like coffee if that makes any sense lol.

Got the chicken omelette and it was literally the most boring, sad meals I've ever eaten. It had zero flavor, and I literally had to pour tons of hot sauce on it to make it edible. I was extremely disappointed because I've heard great things about the place and the decor is gorgeous. Located on one of the more hip parts of town I would've expected a lot more. In the restaurants defense, the waitress tried to steer me away from what I ordered by recommending something else. Perhaps maybe she knew how lame that meal was? I would recommend it be taken off the menu to be honest. That way, no one else's first time there is a negative one. Any way, the coffee was great. I had the cold brew and it was nice and strong. If this was just a coffee spot I would give it 5 stars just based on the coffee, but it's not. Probably won't be coming back, I mean $23.00 bucks for a bad meal just sucks man.

We were visiting Las Vegas and wanted to go to NOT a buffet on the strip, and this place caught my eye! Totally worth it, I will be going here every time I am out in Vegas for work or play! Had the best waffles, and the lavender infused latte was heaven! I highly recommend it! Our servers were all incredibly kind and helpful too, especially considering we were in a large group with a LOT of kids! We never felt judged (that honestly never happens) and the kids had a great time and loved their food too! Will be back for sure!
Amazing service, amazing food and drinks, super cute place and nice to get work done here! Favorite new spot! :)

Stopped for breakfast before heading to outlets. Excellent decision!!! Pour over coffee was delicious. I had arepa benny. Server said it's very popular and I know why!!!! Not enough fancy words can describe the flavors. Really well done! My friend had bionico and honey vanilla latte. She said both were yummy. Excellent service. Cool atmosphere. I'll be back!!

Hands down the best chai tea latte I have ever had. It was so creamy and smooth. I usually go to Coffe Bean for their chai tea latte because I haven't been able to find anywhere better, but this place beats them and any other coffee shop I've been too. I highly recommend them, especially if you love chai as much as I do. Also, the restaurant is just so cute and modern!

Super tasty. Their fries and cuban espressos are amazing.

I only wish they called their guest wifi 'Makers & Wi-Finders'
The ambience reminds me of a cool hangout spot in New York. The lavender latte is a must try!

Wonderful place all around! We had a group of twelve early in the morning before doing a photo walk and they accommodated us all with a smile We even had the bill split up individually and our waitress never flinched...it's tough to find service like this anywhere!
I had a breakfast croissant that was simple and fantastic. Fried egg, bacon and cheese to go with a superb cup of their house dark roast. My friend had a salmon eggs Benedict with chipotle hollandaise that really surprised me, the whole thing was good but the sauce was amazing...I will be having that the next time.
Great ambience and a cool location on Main St right downtown in the art district. They have an outdoor seating area that is half tables and have lounge with comfy couches to enjoy some good coffee and people watch all the vintage stores surrounding it. Definitely try this place and support a solid local business!

Not located in the best part of town and I was not sure where to park at first (probably best to find street parking across the street and walk over) but I'm so glad I didn't give up on this place! 

Delicious brunch cuisine paired with an impressive coffee menu. I ordered a cold brew and breakfast arepas Benedict. The arepas were so good, not like  the ones I have had before. It is rather heavy though. Most their savory dishes sounded good - i saw many be served in cast iron personal pans. 

Plenty of seating in this space. Free wifi, Friendly knowledgeable staff. Would definitely come again!
Really enjoyed Makers & Finders. The coffee's are great and the breakfast selection was perfect. Bonus for being dog friendly on the patio, a great morning spot.
Yummy comfort Latin food and tasty lattes, hot or cold. Sit on the covered patio with your dog! Chill place.

Wonderful customer service! We sat on the patio, the weather was perfect for it. Building faces the east, so the sun was not an issue. Got the lavender infused and honey vanilla iced lattes, not a lot of ice(which I appreciate!) both tasted perfect, not too sweet. This is a sit down or take out restaurant, located right near the corner of Charleston and Main St. Not a lot of parking available near the entrance, which may be an issue for some.
Definitely one the must try locations for specialty coffee and satisfying American/Colombian food

Ambiance: with the location somewhat excluded, (as downtown is very artistic, yet run down), this place is very cute and rustic. The decor is your typical minimal, hipster-esque

Service: friendly but not very prompt. Our lattes took a while to go out as well as the food. They leave a water at the table so you can refill your own glasses. 

Drinks: we got the lavender latte and matcha latte were so good! I liked that they had the choice of regular milk, coconut, or almond milk. I chose almond milk. My only gripe is how long it took to get out. Instead of a nice and hot latte, it was rather a luke warm that did not warm me up at all (it's chilly inside)

Food: I got the empanada platter with shrimp and mushroom. The empanadas themselves were amazing! It was almost as if it made from a puff pastry. Super flaky and delicate and delicious :) it also came with beans and rice and a small (I mean like 5 leaves) salad. All of which were delightful and flavorful. It also had a side of salsa which was perfectly spicy, tomatoey, etc and I asked for a side of cheese. My friend ordered the egg white chorizo kale dish. She said she could've made it at home, as it was rather bland and a simple dish. Butttt I think she should've just gotten a different dish. Because I absolutely loved my dish.

All in all, I am glad I tried this place but with the hassle of the parking and stuff, it might be a while before I come back! It was reallly good tho!!

Two words:  AWE SOME. The Lavender infused Latte was amazing. My husband had the Coconut Tumeric Latte and the Chilaquiles...eggs with tortilla chips, salsa verde, black beans, and Quedi fresco. 
I had 4...yes 4 empanadas, because the first 2 were SO GOOD!  
We leave this fabulous city tomorrow, but will be back for breakfast in the morning.

In the revelation of the fact that this private event and the food, kitchen staff and space was the only provided "staff" from Makers & Finders and the bar tending was a different thing I will re review.

The space was amazing with a industrial feel on the inside but it was still inviting, outside had space heaters and small tables to enjoy a beautiful day here in Las Vegas.  The food was really really good, the sliders were moist and very flavorful even after sitting in a warmer (we went back for thirds)  The fact that they had Truffle Fries with truffles amazed and thrilled me, the bonus is they were legit and delicious.  There were lots of other food items and all were good.

Space- Amazing
Food- Flavorful, Thrilling, Delicious...
Kitchen Staff (people who actually work there) pleasant, accommodating, helpful, fast, and good cooks.

The front of the house was not the staff and that is who I reviewed, now that I know the front of the house staff was rented I advise the owners to review that choice because I did not review all I saw behind the bar.  However you in the back of the house did amazing.  The food service was top notch and the food taste was amazing.

Thank you for clarifying who I am indeed reviewing, you.

I am so glad for Makers & Finders. From the beginning a few years ago - I was excited for a quality coffee spot downtown - along side places like Public Us and Vesta Coffee - Makers & Finders is the OG and another gem. 

The staff is always friendly and helpful - and I find their product to be really quality, and the food delicious and filling. There isn't much else to say other than - thanks! See you soon.
The place has excellent coffee, service and ambiance.  Only reason it's not a 5 star for me is because I had to fish my ceviche out of a pool of lime but my partner's food and was delicious!

Well, it's a hard one to write. I wanted to love this place. Feeling forever disheartened about the lack of enticing or unique places to eat or sit with a cup of coffee in Vegas, most places generally located in ugly and/or plain strip malls or in areas that are visually less than appealing, I'd hoped that Makers and Finders would be that enjoyable spot to meet up with a friend. Located on Main Street over in the Arts District area and across from stores such as Retro Vegas and Buffalo Exchange, it seems that few city blocks are beckoning the artsy, hip and eclectic to come join the gentrification movement like over by Container Park. Keep working on it...
The outside offers a few tables and sofa to sit under a covered patio area. Inside has black wooden tables and plastic, white chairs that sit opposite of the coffee bar area, illuminated with a neon M&F sign. 
I ordered the Lavender Latte which was rather nice. Thick foam mixed with subtle floral notes of lavender was a different, yet pleasant change from my regular vanilla latte that has become my daily staple. 
My friend ordered the seasonal coconut-turmeric latte which I sampled and while coconut is not my favorite flavor, it was in fact, delicious. 
We ordered Chicken Tinga empanadas which honestly, were a bit oily and did not hold the typical Tinga spice which to I am accustomed. Having lived in Mexico and have traveled throughout central and south America, these empanadas did not hold up to my past experiences. 
The kale Cesar salad was good, however the kale could have been chopped up a bit more, the leaves were ginormous. 
My friend ordered the chorizo and brussels sprouts salad. I did not try it, but she said it wasn't as good as her previous times ordering it. 
The service, very pleasant, very friendly, but seemed a bit slow or off. My friend asked for salsa  or whatnot multiple times. Our lattes took over 15 minutes. 
I'd probably return for a coffee date. The food I'd have to try something else next time, as well.

My buddy Rob and I were in town working a music festival...long days, longer nights. We had been planning to grab some cold brew coffees from MFC on our way into work. On our way there, realized they were about to close. We called and said we were going to be cutting it close to closing time but let them know how much Rob had been talking up there cold brew that he was trying to get some for our crew. The owner was cool on the phone and even cooler in person, as he stayed and totally stoked us out by making sure we had everything we needed. 

Now, as if their customer service wasn't worth 5+ stars, their cold brew was delicious. Everything that touched my taste buds that day guaranteed I'd be making another visit whether I was in Vegas for work or play.
First time there with a few workers yesterday. We had breakfast and the service was superb. Food and drinks were delicious! Would go again !!

This place is perfect. The atmosphere is pleasant and relaxing. The service was efficient and courteous. The food is outstanding. Each individual component is fresh and delicious and the seasoning is really well done. I had the breakfast bagel and espresso and it was an absolute dream. I highly recommend this establishment

I went here today and had a cordito and a pastry.  Price points were right on.  My other friends had different items like the empanada that the server seemed to forget to put in.  The server was sweet but maybe it was his first day.  He couldn't seem to remember orders and didn't know the menu- like I requested decaf and he didn't know if anything could come in decaf.  The cashier helped close all our checks out and she really seemed to know what was going on.  My girlfriend loved her empanadas and my other girlfriend loved her croissant that had bacon and peanut butter or nutella on it.  I ate all my chocolate croissant- it was not dry or stale and seemed very fresh.

I don't care about, nor do I really comment on food prices/value - BUT... in Vegas, it matters. 
For some reason, photos of the dishes here are deceiving (even pics of my order!).
The prices do not fit the small portions. My lavender latte was FANTASTIC, but it was lukewarm, immediately after they handed it to me...LUKEWARM!!!!!!(almost cool!)
The food is flavorful! But breakfast is not complicated, so no extra stars for that.
The word "coffee" is in the establishment's name...how do you serve it lukewarm????? Some people may ask, "Why not just let them know it's lukewarm so they can correct it?". My answer is... "I paid you for something that you claim is worth the price. So you are giving me your best already. If you didn't give me your best - what did I pay for? I should be paid to give you a second chance, because now... I'm training you!"
This is a business transaction, not an attempt at a friendship. 
Now I have to go and get some hot coffee and a meal somewhere....

Skip the long lines in the casinos and come here for breakfast/brunch! Everything tasted fresh and delicious and service was great. Definitely try the Mexican or lavender latte. The eggs Benedict were made to perfection! Will definitely be back!!!

We had a wonderful experience at Makers and Finders coffee! We walked in when they were just a minute or two from closing (not on purpose) but they were very sweet and didn't mind making us a cup of coffee to go. The decor is urban, rustic. I had a lavender coconut milk latte and my boyfriend had a salted caramel latte. I LOVE that they have a house-made lavender syrup. My latte was very creamy with just the right amount of flower essence. Both lattes were light on the flavor which I really enjoy. I still like my coffee to taste like coffee so that's my preference ;) we will definitely be returning to Makers and Finders!
The service at Makers is warmhearted and attentive. This shop is a reminder of humanity and brotherhood. Oh and they have single origin beans and coldbrew :)

Loved everything about Makers and Finders! The space is light and bright inside with modern and simple decor... Outdoor patio on Main Street is available too. The iced lavender latte was perfect. Had the carne arepa with plantains, avocado, black beans and a runny egg on top. The corn arepa part was light flavorful n crisp, not heavy at all like other Arepas. The warm Brussels sprouts, mushrooms, shrimp and chorizo dish was great. Healthy and flavorful! Our server Celeste was a sweetie. Will definitely return and spread the word about this locally owned gem!

Best coffee anywhere I've ever been. We ended up here for breakfast twice during a trip to Las Vegas and it's amazing. The lavender latte will surprise, the straight up latte is great, the Mexican spice latte is fantastic. The breakfast (also twice) is great - the chilaquiles and arepa benny stand out (a few shots of hot sauce on the benny if perfect). Fantastic staff. If you're in Vegas head off the strip and relax...

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! Some of the best serving staff I've ever had! Exceptional service, coffee, dishes, the server was even helpful recommending vegan substitutions.  Love this place and can't wait to go back

We found this little place, Tottaly recommended... for me, the Mexican Latte is the best if you are a coffee lover! Food is awsome urban style normal size plates, very fresh and unique cuisine.  the vibe is awesome too young people come to this place its a great experience for locals to have.

This place is great! Had a delicious salmon lox bagel and my husband really enjoyed his chorizo soup for brunch. Not too many items on their menu but everything that was on there looked amazing.

Several people who worked there stopped by our table to make sure everything was okay...and it was! 

You have to try their Elvis Presley dessert... so yum!
Never have I waited so long (20 min) for a take-out sewer looking matcha green tea latte. I can appreciate a good cup of matcha iced or hot, but never grass-tasting, chalky-feeling hot milk.

Breakfast lovers- here is your hidden gem. Upon arrival this place was quiet and a little tucked away. Once inside, a few more people came in, then  a few more, and more. The crisp, clean, decor had an artistic flare that while somewhat hipster was also uniquely styled and inviting. Since I'd read here that each day lavender syrup is made on site I ordered the lavender latte while hubby chose the coconut turmeric tea. Our waitress suggested a warm hot chocolate for our young one and the taste and temperature were spot on for him. From the menu we ordered the waffle with fruit for little one, breakfast hash and chicken Benny. The food was beautifully presented and flavors bounced to the perfect level. The energy was calming yet vibrant and I wanted to stay and try many more items from the menu though vowed to return another time.

A nice little coffee shop and/or brunchy place on Main street. I really like the way that the area is going and it appears that there is a place that shares a patio right next door that could be opening up as another bar or food establishment. 

From first walking in, I liked the decor and that it was so brightly lit. During the time we were there, everyone was able to get a seat when they walked in, but it was never empty. A perfect balance of people coming and going.

I ordered the lavender latte which is honestly one of the reasons why I wanted to go to this place, while my boyfriend ordered the Cuban coffee. The Cuban coffee was amazingly strong. Some of the strongest we have ever tried, which is saying a lot because the BF is Cuban and I have lived in South Florida. 

When it came to food, I ordered the La Paisa arepa and he ordered the Latin Hash. As far as my arepa dish, I liked it when I could get all of the components in the bite. There are a lot of elements but they are piled high, so it is awkward to eat and to capture everything at the same because the carne and the arepa do not have much flavor on their own. The Latin hash was simple but very good. I actually liked the beef in that dish over the beef that was in mine because it had more flavor.

Decent service and an interesting mix of people coming and going at this place. We even bumped into some people we knew which made it feel even more like a neighborhood coffee place.
Authentic food and excelente service! Defenitely returning during my next visit to vegas! It was finger-licking good!
Awesome place! I would definitely recommend, it's super cute and trendy , very clean,  and friendly staff.  The menu is also great! A great addition to DTLV!

Best coffee shop in Las Vegas. I will drive all the way across town for makers and finders. Must try their vanilla latte and lavender latte. My favorite Latin dishes are the Latin hash and Arepas. Can't go wrong ordering anything from their menu!

Nice cozy little coffee shop, very hipster. Staff was friendly. The coconut tres leches waffle was fluffy and very filling. The cafe con leche and Mexican spice coffee were very good! Definitely a good place to catch Sunday brunch. Will be going back for sure!

I can't believe I haven't written this review yet.

Makers & Finders Coffee is my go to place for any coffee or lunch appointment I set for work. I was initially introduced to it by a friend downtown, but I immediately fell in love with the quality, location, and staff.

I have tried a variety of things on the menu, but I always come back to my go to: tomato bisque with a croissant grilled cheese. It's not super large, but it is DELICIOUS. I also tried I believe there empanadas, and they were also extremely tasty. The loaded chorizo soup was disappointing as employees raved about it, but I found it small and not too loaded. 

They also have some pretty amazing coffee (duh, it's a coffee place). I've never had a bad cup, and the one that I keep going back to is...grr...I forgot the name. It's like an entendido? Something like that. But it's made with condensed milk and espresso I believe, it's surprising smooth.

I mostly have sat at the bar and always get great service from the staff. Sometimes when they are busy and I sit at a table, service can be a little slow.

Overall though, great space, great experience, consistently delicious. Even better, they generally have super convenient free and available parking out front. Now THAT truly makes this an easy place to have a quick meeting.
Great pourovers, speciality coffee drinks, and food. Try the arepa benny. Good wifi and nice casual space perfect for breakfast or lunch or a coffee and work.

This place is great!  A new fav here in Vegas.  The staff is incredibly friendly and super attentive in a non overwhelming way.  We came here because we heard the coffee was good...good is not how I would describe it...amazing, smooth, rich, just perfection in a glass.  Since we were here we also had some food and it was so good we both devoured it.  I eat eggs Benedict all over the country and I'd say they made one of my top 5 ever!  The albacore sandwich had this great refreshing taste.  If you don't try this place you are truly missing out an a great experience!

This place is the perfect combo of retro, old Hollywood with a Latin twist. The food flavors are to die for and the coffee is something I dream of getting again. You can't go wrong stopping here to get a coffee to go or to stay awhile and get some work done or just relax on their patio.

Awesome place!! Great down town addition. Had the Benedict's love them. And must try their latte's. 
Good Job guys.

I have given this place so many tries... I can't continue to fool myself that the terrible service and the lackluster food is "just a fluke". I have never recieved prompt, attentive or even friendly service here. The hostess always seems bothered to even be there while the servers are either overworked or lazy with no sense of urgency or promptness.

This place will get by for a while because it's "cute" and "eclectic" but it's actually just pretentious and mediocre. They've lost my business, and as a downtown resident that should worry them.

Love this place! Such a great little coffee shop in the heart of the Arts District. They put a great twist on latin comfort food. The coffee here is excellent. The lavender infused latte is so good and not sweet at all which is a plus if you want coffee to go with savory food. The couple times I've been here the food did not disappoint! Everything I've had to eat here was excellent!
Great atmosphere, came here for the soft opening. Everything i had tastes great, the banana chips are a great alternative to regular potato chips. Oh and theres WiFi!

Great variety of lattes, great tasty food and atmosphere. It sums it up! 
Far enough from the strip crowd and made for locals. Very nice and friendly staff that knows their menu and loves their coffee. I wish it would be more places like that

Great downtown coffee slash food bar. The energy in there is great. A lot of people use it as a work space. So it's great for getting work done. Lots of people on their computers dialed into their projects. I like that because it creates creative energy. 

Food was good. Coffee was better! A1 spot in the arts district of downtown Las Vegas.

Like you need another reason to leave the strip, but the search for a good cup of coffee in Las Vegas is a real issue. Fortunately there was Makers solves all my under caffeinated needs. The walk from the Stratosphere also brought me through some fun antiquing.

Always up to try a new coffee place!  This place is located on Main St off Charleston in the Arts district area.   I had the Mexican spiced latte as wanted to try something different than a regular cup of coffee, and wow it was awesome!  Very nice flavor and spice.  Also was greeted as I entered and the overall service was good.  The only slight knock is their prices are on the high side but if you like good coffee, trendy environments and supporting  local businesses it is worth trying!

Delicious cortado (2 shots espresso with condense milk steamed to perfection, complete with latte art) and a good bagel w/ tomato/avocado. Minus one star because the avocado was maybe one day under-ripe. Would definitely come back and get a siphon coffee, as I've never seen that offered before and it is their logo so they probably do it well!

I found this place on my commute to work and was very excited and decided to try it on my day off which is Sunday. Oddly enough they are closed on Sundays. So I decided to try again yesterday. The coffee menu is very small and their prices are very high. My favorite place is Sunrise Coffee! Anyways my fiancé ordered a small latte with 2 shots of espresso and I ordered an iced vanilla small size. The cups were I believe 12 ounces and they do not carry iced beverage cups so I felt very awkward drinking mine through the sippy lid. My fiancé enjoyed his and mine was absolutely not delicious and not worth the $5.25 I paid for it. Now here's why I'm giving them 1 star otherwise I may have given a 2 possibly three. We arrived today, Christmas Eve at 7:52 as the hours state 7am-4pm and there was not any signage posted for holiday hours. We were turned away because they don't open until 8. We left as we had to head to work. Got off early today and decided to try again. Now there's a sign saying closed on Christmas which is very fair. Walked in and approached the counter and saw two male employees and was told they were closed. It was 12:30 I'm sorry but that is extremely poor business. And why were the doors unlocked?? For this place only being open 7 weeks you would think they would want to try and build a strong loyal customer base. But nope not here. Not going to be returning again. Prices were too high for the quality we received. $4.50 for the 12 ounce latte with only a single shot. For an extra shot it's $.50 more to add vanilla $.75 more. So my drink is now $5.75 for a 12 ounce cup that's not even meant to hold cold beverages.

I want to like this place so bad, but the crap service kills it everytime. This last time will have to be the last time we try. Ordered a bowl of soup at 12:15 and came out cold at 1:00. The rest of my parties order didn't even come, stuff was missing :/ my husband had to hunt down a hostess to even find a fork. 
Come on guys. You can do better.

Found this place via Yelp, was excited given the positive reviews I read. Went there with the hubby and while our server was polite, the food and speed of service was sorely lacking. It was expensive for what it was. 

Ordered breakfast items and they do not come with potatoes or toast or anything else--that cost extra. Portions were terribly small. The chicken tinga omelette was bland and really was only egg and chicken with the other ingredients seemingly just lightly glazed over the top - offering no flavor whatsoever. The Latin hash, described on the menu as 'pulled beef, fried potatoes and yucca, peppers, fried egg,' had zero yucca (red potatoes instead--so sad since I was really looking forward to this), over cooked egg, and loads of oil. The one redeeming factor for the hash was that it was somewhat flavorful. The latte tasted like burnt drip coffee not at all like espresso, and it was $6!!!! We left feeling extremely unsatisfied, still hungry, and grossly overcharged for the skimpy meal we had!

Makers & Finders makes a lavender latte and it is fabulous. I've had it iced and hot. I've taken it to go, I've had it in the restaurant, either way it is delicious, refreshing, and made perfectly every time.

This cute little restaurant/coffee shop is located on Main Street, south of Charleston, so it is a little ways off from the many restaurant openings of Fremont. This makes the restaurant a nice retreat in the Downtown area. 

As for food I have had the Chicken Tinga Empanads which are awesome. Perfectly fried with succulent, spiced chicken inside, served with a small bed of lettuce. I have also had their tomato bisque soup, which is creamy and bursting with flavor.

I will miss Makers & Finders for sure. I hope I can find an equivalent when I move to Texas.

Came to this place in late-June. 

I want to give this place a 3.5 because it's a nice place but there aren't half stars on Yelp. 

I love the service; we had a really friendly, chill, and knowledge waiter.

We ordered large iced lavender infused lattes, Mexican spiced lattes, and I ordered honey vanilla latte (after having spent ten minutes between that and the Nutella latte). The lavender kicks in after a while, so give it a while. 

For food, we ordered the la paisa arepas and the ripened mango arepas (which were both okay). Lastly, we ordered two arepa benny's (nickname for benedict), which is probably the best thing. You will also feel full with this dish, whereas the other two might leave you still wanting more. The thin crispy fries with the aioli were good and I would get them again for $5.

When dining for lunch, several people there ate alone with their drinks and MacBook's. Couches available to hangout inside, as well as outdoor seating (choose wisely, like on a warm-not-so-hot day!).

Totally in love w/ this place! I've only had the chance to pick up coffee, and not actually sit down (which I am far too excited to do) but this place is so cute and from the minimal interactions I had, the staff was friendly. My friends & I got 3 iced lattes:

The lavender infused latte - OH MY GOODNESS! So good! I don't want to try this creation at any other shop (my friends are itching to go back to get their own)
Honey vanilla latte - pretty good
Cortadito - ehhh, I was super stoked over the condensed milk, but maybe it's just better served hot

Overall, you're paying a little more, just like any local coffee shop, but for the atmosphere and the product, it's definitely worth it. I hope their food will be good and the staff will be great upon my next visit.

Nous sommes tombés par hasard sur ce restaurant alors que nous quittions Las Vegas et avions raté le buffet du petit déjeuner du Wynn ou nous voulions aller. Pas de regret, un vrai délice!!! On regarde sur Yelp et on voit que c est classé au top, pas étonnant. Super service , endroit sympa , ambiance musicale latina douce.
ufs , bacon, omelettes excellents.
Café très bon et chocolat chaud unique (recette maison), nos 3 enfants ont adoré!!
Les waffles fruits rouges, coconut, chocolate chips sont succulentes.

I've seen the other reviews and photos of this coffee joint and couldn't wait to try it.  Makers & Finders Coffee is located in the Arts District and the modern decor fits right in with its neighboring proprietors.  The inside is bright and fresh and the staff members are all very welcoming.  I had brunch with my sisters and we each tried a different iced latte.  We ordered the lavender infused, honey vanilla and Nutella lattes and were dying to take a swing from each other's cup.  We were all pleasantly surprised that each one tasted wonderful.  These alone would make us come back! Which is a good thing because the food we ordered we thought was good, but nothing remarkable.  We ordered the shrimp ceviche, Arepa Benny, the veggie bagel, & the Capirotada (bread pudding). When the food came out, no veggie bagel showed up.  Instead a second Arepa Benny was placed on our table. The ceviche has a couple of shrimp shell pieces left in the dish and the Capirotada missed it's mark with the orange marmalade on top.  With that being said, I would still go back for the coffee and maybe next time just some pastry.

This place is more a sit-down eatery than a coffee shop. To-go coffee orders are taken at the coffee bar, which was a bit overwhelmed. Ended up waiting about 15 minutes for four coffees.

Highlights:
Lavender-infused latte: you can taste the lavender, but a bit dear at $5.50 for the small size

Didn't like:
Coconut turmeric latte: we only had ourselves to blame, but it tasted sorta like how you might expect it to, which wasn't very good.

During the cooler months, the patio would be a cool place to plop down and get a bit of work done.

"Coffee for pups ... why not ?!"

Yelped this hipster coffee bar located in downtown Las Vegas. Perfect for locals and tourists who want a more low key/local spot to enjoy away from the strip!

The place makes their own syrups and have an amazing lavender latte... swear it's the second best I've tasted ever (next to steel town cafe located in Pittsburg, ca)

Other highlights: 
- puppocino- $3 drink for dogs (basically whipped cream)
- Happy hour (4-6pm) and $7 breakfast special before 7am
- A pretty cool cocktail menu for a coffee spot
- Latin influenced meals 
- Outdoor seating/patio with couches 
- animal friendly 
- Friendly crowd (a lot of Californian transplants of course) 

Note:
- I'm pretty tiny so their serving size for the Latin hash was perfect for me (must add hot sauce!), but if you want a more hearty meal for $11 - you might wanna look elsewhere!

Fun hipster-type of coffee shop, inconvenient location for me since I'm from henderson, but I was in the area and felt like venturing out from starbucks. 

I think I would like to come back and try out there killer food menu...especially for breakfast. 

street parking, otherwise, not sure where to park. Their are couches, and free WIFI if studying is your goal here. 

I came for lunch to go and got:
1. Cold brewed coffee: large $4.5, very mild taste, didn't need to add mild or cream. Would recommend.
