2. Spice mushroom empanadas $6 small, but unique  would recommend if your a vegetarian. Took about 10 minutes to bring out...

Makers & Finders is a terrific respite if you're doing some thrift shopping along Main Street. The atmosphere is hip, but inviting and photo-op ready. Parking is easier than I thought. The service is great except for a minor hiccup on placing our food orders. 

The iced Mexican Spice Latte is fantastic--rich, slightly sweet and had the right amount of spice. My Latin Hash and fries is good too, but I envied my sister's arepa benny more. The real standout was espresso flan--a decadent dessert with great flavors. Overall, M&F's is a great place for a casual meet up for coffee and food.

Wanted to come here because it got so many good reviews ! Had the veggie bagel with a side of poached eggs. The barista was super attentive, but the food is very subpar. The bagel was soggy and was lacking flavor, the poached eggs were undercooked. I was scared to try anything else! I feel it is difficult to find good food in Vegas is general. I'm sorry makers and finders! I wanted to like you and I know how hard it is to run a restaurant, but I'm sorry I spent my money and calories here :(

LOVED this place. Cute, quaint, eclectic. Food is delish and not chainy or processed tasting at all. Good variety of choices. Loved the mason jar water on each table. Prices were very fair. We'll definitely be back!

I am giving them good marks for atmosphere, food and service.  Really 4 1/2 stars     However I came in search for a good Cortado in Vegas and was disappointed.   First of all came in a large glass with too much milk, second the espresso was simply not good.  A bad taste     Hence the need for all the sugary drinks everybody raves about.  So if you're into sugar the Lavender Latte is amazing.
Start your day with the mushroom empanadas and the coffee. The crust is tender and flaky.  The coffee is rich and smooth, and they have so many options.

I decided to wait a few days before posting this review.

I was here on Saturday morning with my boyfriend, and we didn't have a good experience, at all.

This was not our first time experiencing Makers & Finders. Usually we order from Uber Eats and decided to go out for breakfast. 

As expected, for a Saturday morning it was busy, and we were told it was a 20 minute wait. That's where problems started, but not on our end. We saw 2 different people leave because they were seated and no one came to them to offer them water, give them a menu or even great them for almost 10 minutes. It took almost 5 minutes for a server to even realize they were gone.

This same thing happened to us when we sat down. The couple next to us were seated even before we got there 25 minutes before, and they hadn't even ordered. 

By the time we got our drinks, we had been there for an hour. Neither us nor the tables around us were given spoons for the sugar on the table and had to resort to forks and knives in replacement. 

Jacob got the breakfast sandwich, which he said was cold, and dry. It was flavorless, and for us having been sitting there for an hour and a half, were not too thrilled. I got the salmon Benny, which was missing a vital ingredient, salt. The arepa was extremely dense, chewy and bland. My poached eggs were hard in the center, and the mariquitas were unseasoned. The only thing good was our latte's and the breakfast empanadas. 

I would not order the food here again. I would not drive here again, I might Uber Eats a latte, but I'd rather go somewhere else for that effort. 

Happy Eating!

One of the things I've always loved about Los Angeles, is all of the unique coffee shops. When I came back to Las Vegas to live for a little while, I was sad about the food options. I've always thought Vegas' local culinary scene needed a game changer. Makers & Finders Coffee is exceptional! 

Check Out My Full Review Here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6dptOphJm5g
Great spot for coffee and Latin comfort foods. The Iced Honey Vanilla Latte was awesome as well as the Mango Arepa and the Espresso Flan to top it off. Will definitely come here again.
One if the best coffee spots we have ever visited!! The lavender latte is to die for. And the best breakfast I've had in a very long time. Best coffee house in Vegas by a mile!!!

I have been wanting to try out this place since I had first heard about it. I Finally got the chance because it is not close to where I live, since it is located in the downtown Vegas by the art district area. 

Phenomenal place! Artisan style Latin food with full bar and coffee drinks! I love that you can get French pressed coffee too!! The ambience makes you feel like you are in a hipster San Francisco neighborhood coffee house.
Wow! Love this place! Downtown chique, REAL coffee, friendly knowledgeable staff, and yummy bites

Such a great little find.  Love their coffees/Lattes: Lavender, Lemon, honey, shall I go on! Very unique tastes.  Baristas have always been helpful.  Atmosphere is fun and inviting, even the outside patio!
We shared the fried plantains, the pork plate and the ribs. My omelette was light and fluffy and the vegetables and peppers inside were sauteed just right.

Great unique coffee and amazing food that isn't your traditional coffee type style. Can't wait till fall so I can sit outside. I had the flat white and the la paisa arepa. So so good. I want to try everything on the menu. Super cute decor. Fun place to come and work, have a small meeting, or just eat and drink.

Don't get me wrong. The brew is very good and it's actually well priced. But 15 minutes for two cups of coffee?? Not siphon. Not french press. Just two cups for my wife & I, that arrived by the time I was half way finished with my breakfast. It was literally the first thing I asked for. Both the hostess and the owner(Josh) explained to me that the coffee was "made to order from scratch"(which kind of annoyed me, because it was repeated word for word) but this excuse can only go so far in a breakfast-lunch restaurant. 

The saving grace was my waiter, who could tell I was agitated by the length of time and gave me a discount on my already considerably low bill. I can tell it has potential, but "soft opening" or not, if you have the word COFFEE in your name, you should hire at least TWO baristas to handle your demand for it.
While the coffee is legit, the breakfast Arepa is just okay. For a real tasty Arepa, go to Viva Arepa!  But I do like the hipster coffee geek vibe here. We had great service for breakfast.

Makers and Finders. A brunch spot of dreams. Outdoor seating, delicious food, yummy coffee. I arrived as a four top, and asked the very sweet hostess if we could have the 8 top that said "reserved" because I was with someone who was pitching a presentation and we needed some laptop space. She went to management and asked, and they accommodated. Awesome. We sat down and ordered coffee first- I ordered a dirty chai tea latte with almond milk (that I later found out was A+). If you know me (and most morning people) you know I need coffee ASAP. About 30 minutes later we got our food still without our coffees... which was a bit underwhelming. I was hoping for coffee before food. Seems that the barista is (often) backed up. I ordered the Vegetarian Chilaquiles. They were different than the traditional chilaquiles, they were little crunchy tortilla chips with salsa verde.  They were REALLY tasty, though. Everyone enjoyed their food. Latin hash looked gorgeous, and the veggie burger had hash browns in it. Neato. Brunch Latin flare at its finest.

Eclectic and free - this waterhole represents the best that is the art district. Come in, relax.

Honey Vanilla Latte is divine.
Coconut Soup is rich and nourishing.
Place is cool, food was good. Aprepa with rajas was delicious! The shrimp ceviche had way too much lime! Price was little high for the portions. Orange honey latte was ok.
Great hipster atmosphere, clean and with good wifi for working remotely. Amazing lattes with housemade syrups and tasty Latin breakfast foods (try the Latin Hash!)

I am not a coffee drinker but this place makes me want to drink their coffee every time I am in town. The lavender infused iced latte w/ coconut milk is to die for and absolutely amazing. The food is great as well. I'm particularly in love with the plantain chips. Even if you don't consider yourself a coffee drinker, you will find something here for you. You're welcome.

YES!

I finally got to check out this awesome spot in the Vegas arts district (for lack of a better description). Turns out it's right next to Hop Nuts Brewing--another relatively new business I've been meaning to try.

I wasn't sure if lavender anything would be good, but I gave the latte a try. It was fantastic! I'm definitely going to try making my own lavender simple syrup for homemade lavender lattes. If they are half as good, I'll be happy.

I also suddenly got hungry and ordered their Arepa Benny. One of the points of getting Eggs Benedict to me is for the Hollandaise. In this case, the mother sauce is replaced with Chimichurri and the English muffins are replaced with arepas. Eggs were perfectly poached. Bloody brilliant!

With their dog-friendly patio, Makers & Finders could be my new bi-weekly chill spot.

Cute coffee shop with great coffee and desserts. Had lunch before this so just stopped by for a quick coffee and snack. Tried the iced lavender latte with espresso flan. Will definitely try the food from the kitchen next time im in vegas.

We had an amazing experience!  I found this place on Yelp and we were so impressed!
The establishment is very funky fresh retro.
It's very cozy and the coffee was the best I've ever had in my entire life!  It was a coconut, turmeric, cinnamon flavor.  They have a very desirable list of beautiful coffee drinks including beer, cocktails, etc. the service was top notch and the food was so delicious!  It's definitely a gem and has its own very unique appeal!!!

Wanted to stop somewhere for breakfast/brunch on the way to the outlets, and picked this place off of yelp. Best decision. 

This place hasn't been open 6 months yet, but it's definitely an up and comer. To start off the hubby and I got the two unique lattes from their menu. The Mexican spice latte had mocha, cloves, and I think some other light spices in it. It was the perfect amount of sweetness (barely there letting the flavors shine), and and was wonderfully made (not too hot and delicious creamy foam). The lavender infused latte was a little sweeter, and had just enough lavender to titillate; it was wonderfully made as well.

For food we got the Arepa Benny and the Rajas Arepa. I'd never encountered an arepa before, but it's a little cornmeal patty with a lovely flavor and texture. Both dishes took a little longer than I expected to come out, but they were so worth it! The arepa Benny was similar to an eggs benedict, but with coffee rubbed beef instead of ham and the arepa instead of an English muffin. The hubby is a fan of eggs benedict, and said it was the best he'd ever had. The Rajas arepa was a mound of sautéed peppers and onions on top of an arepa, drizzled with an amazing avocado cream sauce; absolutely recommended for other vegetarians out there! Both dishes were served with long sliced plantain chips.

There was one mistake on a dish, and the owner came out to talk to us and gave us the most amazingly soft and fresh jam filled croissant (they get them from a bed and breakfast nearby I believe) to apologize while they remade the dish. He was very nice.

Will definitely be back! Want to try some of the tasty looking empanadas I saw a person at the table next to us eating.

I'll have to come back for a proper meal, but just had my first cup of pour over coffee (a medium roast of Bolivian origin) and it's an early frontrunner for best cup of java downtown! Staff is super friendly and place looks great, looking forward to brunching there this weekend.

This was by far one of the most exciting and enjoyable experiences in Vegas.  The Latin Hash was to die for.  It should be shown on all the food networks.  The flavor exploded in my mouth.  The yucca mash was so unique, I am hooked.

Great staff and prices that made me smile.

Food was excellent however the service really let them down, this was all down to the waitress I'm afraid. 
Baristas finished our drinks and then they sat for a LONG time before I asked the bus boy about them. 
Waitress also didn't get the food order correct. The place is over staffed but this does not equate to good service. I hope for their sakes that it's just the one waitress with the problem or that she was just having s bad day. 
Otherwise a nice little hipster place with service that is a bit too casual for my taste. 
Hipsters take your ironic beard or moustache here but have a Starbucks to feed your addiction first or you'll pull your beard out.
Benny's were great! Coffee was alright. Check out the cool graffitti on nearby buildings. Made me feel at home

Overpriced food with no flavor. Ordered the veggie bagel sandwich, below average. Stale wheat bagel that was not even toasted, dill honey cream had no dill, puny slices of tomato. 

Maybe their strength is their coffee?

Oh well.
Oh sweet nectar of the gods! Mexican Spice latte has left my tastebuds in a state of pure ecstasy. THIS is the reason to never visit a Starburnts.

This is definitely my favorite place for coffee and breakfast in town! I've brought quite a few friends and family here and have never had any complaints about the food or coffee.  I always get the same thing, the Chilaquiles, and my only complaint is that you can't get them for dinner!

Simply amazing. Found this cute little spot for breakfast on Yelp and we had heard good things from friends. They have many different flavors of lattes which were all delicious. If you like lavender, I definitely recommend the lavender honey latte! So delicious! 

My boyfriend and I split a couple of different items so we could sample more food.  We split the tres leche coconut waffle, chicken tinga eggs benedict, and breakfast empanadas and they were all SO GOOD. the shell of the empanadas if cooked to perfection - so flaky and delicious. 

I would love to come back here and try some more of the menu - maybe for lunch and dinner! they also have outdoor seating which is lovely for a nice day out. not to mention that the staff is so kind and attentive!

Finally decided to check out this unique coffee shop in the Arts District of LV for brunch on Sunday. We were welcomed with an amazing aroma and hip exterior/interior. It really is a gem of the neighborhood. I had the smoked salmon benedict and love that it was gluten free- their cold brew was delicious as well! Everything had a hint of cayenne and spice but not overpowering. My only complaint was that service was slow- the hostess, the waiter, and the barista (my coffee took forever- never something anyone wants!) Will definitely try out their Summerlin location and want to return for their violin brunch!

Such a cute concept, but Makers+Finders unfortunately did not deliver in terms of food. My friend was taken with the idea of arepa benedicts, so we came here for brunch before heading back to LA. I had their Lox Benedict, and also shared the Empanada Sampler and Fries with my table.

We were super disappointed in the arepa part of the benedict - it was undercooked, bland, with no nice toasted color to it lol. The best part of my Lox Benedict was the braised kale, and it only came with 4 plantain chips. C'mon, y'all can do better than that! The empanadas were sparsely filled, making it mostly fried dough. The fries were probably the best part of the meal, with a delicious garlic aioli on top. 

While service was okay, the kitchen seemed to be a mess. Our starters (the Empanadas Sampler + Fries) were the last to arrive, and it took a good 25-30 minutes for our food to come. Makers+Finders have a lot to improve on, but I can definitely see it as a great place to return to once it does!

Cute spot & price is fair! The smoked salmon Benedict had an mediocre hollandaise sauce and the arepas wasn't for us. The whole dish was blend. The chicken chilaquiles on the other hand was over seasoned but the overall dish was still good and we still finished the whole thing. Also enjoyed the house coffee and cold brew. 

Even though our experience with the food was meh (3/5 for food), the overall environment was comfortable and we feel like we might have just ordered the wrong brunch items.

Delicious Coffee and Crispy Fries! Very nice, casual coffee house! I love the vibe in there, great place for dates. You have the option of sitting inside our outside on their patio. When you and your significant other don't know where to go have lunch, give this place a try.

Wow Vegas has came along way from when I lived there. This is forsure a great place for vegans.


Check it out.

This is the best coffee in Las Vegas, hands down. Very unique and well-crafted coffees and coffee drinks. The coconut turmeric latte is creamy with the bold color of turmeric and a fresh coconut flavor (I'm not a huge fan of fakey coconut flavors that one usually gets:). I'm also a big fan of the dirty chai latte. Kind and helpful baristas. Looking forward to trying breakfast there next.

Arepa Benny ($10): Golden poached eggs, coffee-rubbed beef, grilled tomato, salsa verde hollandaise. Overall, slightly bland, which is surprising considering the ingredients. The arepa wasn't very tasty on its own and neither was the beef. Even the hollandaise lacked oomph. Everything just lacked flavor (or salt).

Chorizo Brussels Sprouts ($12): Grilled shrimp, crispy onion, sautéed mushroom, ground and sliced chorizo. **We were told that the chef refused a shipment of Brussels sprouts that morning, so they offered Kale instead.** Perhaps this dish is best with Brussels sprouts and only with Brussels sprouts. Although the kale was nice, it was just an odd concoction and needed a lot more chorizo. The grilled shrimp was really wonderful.

Chicken Tinga Empanada ($6): Chipotle chicken, lime avocado sauce. This was probably the best item we tried. Great flavors and composition of the empanada. I would eat it again.

Crispy Fries w/ Garlic Aioli & House Sauce ($5). The fries were really great. I didn't care for the sauce drizzled on top - I guess it was supposed to be the garlic aioli, but it tasted almost like honey mustard (weird). The house sauce was good.

Lavender Infused Latte ($6): This is probably the most intriguing item on the beverage menu and both of us couldn't resist. You would smell the lavender, but you couldn't taste it. Subtle is an understatement. Perhaps it's best that way, but it seems that if you're going to make a fuss over a coffee infused with something, it better taste like that something. It was still a nice latte. My friend also ordered a Cuban Espresso ($4) at the end of our meal. Holy cow, that stuff will put hair on your chest!

I really like the space and the menu seems so fun, but the food was disappointingly underwhelming. I was definitely expecting a better food experience. On the other hand, the coffee was good and the staff was fantastic. Overall, it was a nice place to hang out with coffee, but I would skip the eats.

A cozy spot off the strip that seriously exceeded our expectations!! We had the Mexican spicy cafe, shrimp ceviche... The best we ever had!! The Breakfast arepa, maple bacon, Brussel sprouts & tomato bisque... Everything... Each & every bite was freaking delicious!!! We even took 2 coffees to go... Our total bill was $63!!! We'll be back tomorrow morning! Support local businesses first!!!

I'm a little biased because I grew up in Las Vegas while larger corporate hotels overshadowed the value of arts , music, food and local culture.  On my most recent visit to the Life is Beautiful festival in downtown , I spent an entire afternoon here with my cousins. I sampled 3 types of coffee all of which remind me of my trip to Madrid. I thoroughly enjoyed the iced honey lavender latte and a single shot of espresso .  I also sampled a lox bagel, empanadas , and several other conceptually dynamic appetizers. The food is tasty but it can use a little fine tuning.  More focus on composition of flavors rather than the presentation would take the dishes to the next level. The fried plantains make an appealing garnish but they add little to the overall taste.  Maybe soft plantains would make more sense.   Service was very friendly but slow and that's great if it is the vibe they are going for. Stay a while. Chat. Siesta!

Hipster hangout in a up and coming part of town.  Service is with a smile and the owner greets all customer's.  Only had coffee to drink, wasn't hunger enough to try the food.  Great place to kick back, check some emails and do some people watching.

It's finally time to write a review! (After coming here 30 times and ordering everything !)

 Arepa Benny is a MUST! It's a dish that I get specific cravings for. Every dish that I've ordered has been tasty, fresh, and delicious! Oh and they might just have the best fried plantains. YUM

The coffee is the super hipster, fancy coffee... Which I'm not complaining about. From a black iced coffee to a fancy lavender honey late, there are ZERO complaints. The quality of coffee alone is worth the drive downtown. 

My service has always been outstanding, whether sitting outside or up at the bar, it's always a great experience. 

I'm not one for hipster joints but this one has my heart with amazing dishes and coffee! Definitely worth trying! Although watch the time because they close a bit early !

I am so jazzed to hear that this place will have a Downtown Summerlin location!  The boyfriend is very particular about his coffee and enjoys a simple blonde roast, black. The coffee made his eyes roll back...so good!! 

We were both excited about the food menu. I ordered the empanada sampler! The presentation was simple and satisfying. The outer casing of each empanadas was light and flaky. The first and subsequent bites of each individual empanada suggested that someone knew exactly how to make our taste buds cry. 

If you like el desayuno, gotta check this place out for yourself!

I truly enjoy coming to Makers and finders coffee bar and restaurant and bar for matter they do a great job in terms of service atmosphere and being able to post up here getting some work done and getting a great meal is a wonderful option and downtown I got here a couple hours ago had a coffee and they left me alone to work on my computer and the more importantly I had a great option to grab dinner later on where I got the wonderful avocado tuna fish with the aduro's as a wonderful compliment great flavor great presentation incredible service I love this place only thing I wish they had was more comfortable chairs.

I've been going to this place since they opened and I've NEVER been disappointed! They have a great variety of hot and cold coffee beverages and their menu is just perfect! It's not a long menu so you won't have a hard time deciding what to eat and the best thing of all is that they serve Latin comfort food. I've personally tried the Arepa Benny and the Arepa Paisa and they remind me of my trip to Colombia - delicious authentic food! The personnel that works there is also very courteous and always so attentive. This restaurant is also in a great location as it's in the Downtown area close to where I work.

Keep up the good work guys! You have a customer for life.
Great find in Vegas. One of the best lattes I've had around the world. Redefined American breakfast. Busy place and I would recommend anyone to go there.

Makers has a good reputation and it is earned but I've never been pleased by any of their offerings aside from their drink menu. The Vanilla Chai Tea (cold) is definitely a winner but I've always missed on getting good food. Nice decor and a good crowd make this place, for me at least, somewhere worth walking in with a friend but no food please. A water will do.

I had the lavender latte. It tasted good, I liked it over other places as the lavender was not strong; just right. For a regular size the price was a bit pricey, with all the bells and whistles included I can get something larger someplace else. I like the vibe of the place though, so I will come by again to try the Mexican latte!

Came here since it was on my way to my office. I love this place, it is very unique great coffee place. I had cafe con leche and it was great. The service was good. Parking was easy and a nice walk to the coffee shop. I will come back to try their food.

After an appointment in the Medical District, my mom and I decided to head to the Arts District to try a spot that I had been to before. Upon arrival, the place wasn't there anymore. Sad face. I did my usual, go to Yelp for the next best place and came across Makers & Finders, which offers Latin comfort food, and glanced reviews about their coffee and lattes. We shrugged our shoulders and said sure, why not, it's a new place.

When we walked up, we saw there was seating outside, which the weather was perfect. When we walked in, we were greeted and seated right away. The lady gave us a run down of the menu, and the coffees that they offer. My mom ordered the Lavender Latte and it came out so pretty. I'm not a coffee drinker, but I tried the latte and said I should have ordered one for myself it was so smooth. I feel like we were sent here, because while we were waiting to place our order, what to my wandering eyes did appear, but Catherine Cortez Masto appear! What a pleasant surprise. She and two ladies had a seat right behind my mom and we "brunched" together haha! All the staff greeted her and she was seated. Nothing changed with staff, they didn't all suddenly change their attitude because she was there. If anything they were excited she was there. But they all were very nice and attentive already! 

In no time was the lady back to take our order for food.  I ordered Roasted Rajas Empanadas and Yucca Mash which is yucca, green onions mashed. That sounded so funky to me. I had yucca before, fried and sauteed, but never mashed. I took one bite and that was it. I was sold. I said to my mom she needed to try some and after her first bite, she kept dipping her fork in to get more. The empanadas were tasty too. Peppers were perfect with the dough. Complimented each other well. Definitely comfort food, as I was very pleased with my food. Did my little chair dance.  

When we were done eating, we got to take a picture with CCM and wished her luck.My mom and I left happy and comforted, and glad we came across Makers & Finders. The latte is one to come back for.

So my drink, had the chai latte.. ehhh it was okay nothing special. I also had the empanadas and if anything that is what is getting me to return. So good, great portion and i thought they were prized correctly. Heard they have an empanada flight , getting that next time!
This place is super cool! The aesthetics make you not want to leave. The black coffee is amazing. Food is great and the prices are reasonable. I am coming back next time I come to LV!!!
Great service and selection. Had a great night with our hrc communications team. Thanks for having us and we will be back.

The coffee tasted great (once we got it) and the food was okay, but we were told it would be a 20 minute wait to be seated. We went to the coffee bar to get a drink while wait, ordered drinks and were left waiting 45 minutes before we were even acknowledged again. We weren't even sat at a table yet after an hour. We asked where our drinks were and they told us we couldn't get them until we were seated. About an hour and fifteen minutes after waiting we were seated then ordered right away. It took an additional 45 minutes after ordering that we got our food. Nobody told us it was coming out shortly or anything. The food was okay, but being a local, I would not come back. No one even apologized for us being here for 2 hours or the slow service. We should have left after the 45 minute wait for our coffee but we wanted to give Makers & Finders a chance.

Seated immediately during brunch hours. Honey lavender latte was delicious, as was the Mexican spice latte! The former is more aromatic and serene, versus the latter, which is sweet and spicy. They have such unique lattes that I want to try! 

The La Paisa arepa was a sight for sore eyes. You get shredded meat, plantains, and rice, and I ordered eggs on the side. SO FILLING! MUCH PROTEIN! Also, service was great and the place is modern and cute. It's family-friendly, but also good for dates. Totally have a soft spot for this place, and want to return to try their other lattes and Colombian dishes!
Love love love. The place is small but the contemporary decor made it very welcoming and cozy. The service was exceptional. The coffee? To die for. The food were delicious. It's a nice discovery.

There is a reason everyone raves about the lavender latte. It's perfect. I ordered a hot one with my veggie bagel(pretty good, would get again). The lavender latte was so good I ordered an iced one for the road to keep me perky on my trek down to AZ. Our server also did a perfect job--didn't catch his name, but he was the one with a tat sleeve on his right arm. I plan to stop here again when I pass through Vegas on my way home next week.

This place is ahead of the curve. Located in Las Vegas fashionable Art District.  The food is flavorful, and unique to Las Vegas. Everything is freshly prepared, and the vibe of the establishment is extremely uplifting. Definitely bring your guest to this hidden Vegas Secret.

Amazing coffee and food! These people take their coffee seriously but have maintained a chill vibe as well! The kale, chorizo, Parmesan and mushroom omelette was fantastic! The sauce on the bagel sandwich added a twist to a standard egg sandwich!

Try the lavender latte! It's what brought me in.The tastiness will bring me back to try more. I was sat at the bar, which is neat if you want to watch them make your coffee drink. That was fun. I also ordered a benny, which was half the price of a similar quality one I could get at other breakfast/brunch places. I was impressed with the food, the latte, and the service. After a great first experience, I'm planning to come back soon.
Great food, best coffee drinks I've ever had! Staff was awesome and so friendly. Will definitely go back.
Fantastic pour-over Coffee, fantastic food. So good I ended up going two days in a row on my last visit to Las Vegas.

If you are going to order delivery go directly to Makers and Finders' website and not through the yelp delivery option. I tried to order delivery through yelp and after clicking on the items I wanted to order it automatically changed the order to pick up. I went through this huge hassle, by fault of grubhub not the restaurant, before I could get a refund. At least an hour on the phone with grubhub. However the food was very good. I loved the arepa benny. They don't short you on the meat. Huge amounts of beef on it. I was full half way though the meal. I also got the empanada sampler and wasn't impressed. It was very greasy but the inside was packed with fillings.

Downtown Las Vegas has so many hidden gems. I gave this place a try for the first time today. Now I'm thinking where have I been and what took us so long??? Upon entering you get a really nice laid back vibe. With people laughing and talking and blaring Latin Music. This place is a restaurant/coffee bar which I find perfectly convenient. The Decor is hipster mixed with vintage. They have a decent sized menu with lots of new things (for me) to try. I had the Smoked Salmon Benny, and my husband had the Bandeja Paisa. Both were really good. We didn't try the coffee but definitely will next go round. We love downtown and if you haven't been, you should definitely visit!

This place is super cute! It is a hidden gem amongst the shops along Main Street in Downtown Las Vegas, right off of Charleston. It's completely flushed with light due to the large windows in the front of the shop. They have enough tables inside, outside, and at the bar/counter for you to sit at. 

The staff is super friendly as well. They are always willing to have a genuine conversation.

I ordered the Honey Vanilla espresso. On the menu it is described that it comes with a cinnamon crust and a vanilla mist. (Your server actually comes out with your drink and mists your coffee with vanilla. Super cute.) It was definitely made well.

They have a full lunch menu here that I have yet to try but I definitely recommend to check this place out.

Totally worth every minute of waiting. Super-full, so it was loud. But not too bad for the outstanding food. We walked in and were seated in about 1 minute. Post-seating, we got our food after a brief wait. 
The only reason I gave 4 stars is because the food could've been hotter. It wasn't cold, but you could tell it had sat for a few minutes. 
The coffee was extremely bold, which I like. So if you like bold, then I recommend the Italian. 
My father ate the Arepa Benny, which was absolutely delicious. I got the bagel with lox. Eating the entire thing was no problem. I would've liked fewer herbs in the cream cheese, but otherwise I loved it. 
Great decor. Simple, but done well. I would love to return one day if I ever come back to Las Vegas. If you are going, I recommend parking on California Ave right next to the restaurant.

Our large group came here after a particularly long NYE, luckily it was one of the few places open on New Year's Day to feed the incredibly hungover crowds (including myself). I was so impressed with the large array of unique craft drinks!! From lavender lattes to "matcha-chinos", there was definitely a beverage that catered to every individual. These drinks were also beautifully presented and tasted wonderful which was the most important part. The food which was $7-15, was absolutely delicious and provided a lovely Latin flare that sets it apart from other breakfast joints. The interior was spacious, cute and had retro (70s-80s) music playing in the background along with a nice patio in the front. The only reason why I took off a star is because service was quite slow. We were the first group there, yet it took an unusually long time for them to take our orders and give us our food/drinks, so much so that we had to wave them down a couple of times. Other than that, I would love to go here again!

My experience at Makers and Finders was great! The food is phenomenal and their coffee is one of a kind. If you're looking for a place that brews coffee in 30 seconds, this isn't the place for you. You come for the experience and the many varieties that have to offer. I had their horchata mixed with expresso and was blown away by the flavor. I can't wait to return again for the breakfast!

I've been here plenty of times, and I absolutely love this place! They offer an array of authentic Latin coffee along with some great mixed cuisine. My favorites are the iced lavender latte (with almond milk), the Arepa Benny, & the Tomato Bisque. I'm from LA where Kitchen 24's "Afterschool Special" is quite popular, but hands down the Tomato Bisque from here takes the lead as far as tomato soup accompanied with a grilled cheese is concerned (maybe everything is just better on a croissant). Their shredded beef is always moist and seasoned to perfection. I only wish this place was open later!!
Excellent coffee, brewed siphon style, strong and smooth.  Delicious and authentic arepas la paisa.  Nice friendly service a big bonus.
Food is much better and so is service.   The coffee here has always been 5stars and the people are always friendly.   I will definitely be back again.

I have yet to try their coffee, but I can tell you their food is unique and delicious. You can find this cute restaurant in the Arts District. I stumbled upon it after my visit to Buffalo Exchange across the street. I have been looking for Latin and Carribean food around the desert and I'm glad I found this place. I tried their empanada sampler and it did not disappoint. It came with rice and black beans. I had one of the beers on draft since it was happy hour. Next door is Hop Nuts Brewing and they have some of their beers on draft. I sat at the bar but I love the outdoor/patio seating too. I will come back again to try their coffee.

I really love this place for a nice breakfast/brunch/lunch to catch up with a friend. The atmosphere is really cozy and the staff has always been really nice. I highly recommend the Arepa Benny, and you really can't go wrong with ordering any of their drinks.
Had the Chicken Tinga Omelet here, and it was great.  They do a really good job with their pour over coffees as well.  I went back again and had the Turkey Club which was also fantastic.

If your an Australian visiting Vegas. This is the BEST coffee youll find.. Taste like coffee from home. So good. We have coffee and breakfast. The food was fantastic. The service was excellent and everyone was friendly. We will back back for the duration of our stay. Come down and enjoy the coffee..

Hands down. 
Amazing coffee. 
Had a regular latte with almond milk. 
My girlfriend claims it's the best she's ever had. 
We ordered food, and I wish I had more of it. 
Flavor was on point, but I wanted more meat lol
The place is hipster central. Very young, cool, and hip. 
Recommend this place, highly! 
Will most definitely come back. Especially for the coffee

Worth trying.  We came for the coffee and were a bit disappointed.  But we LOVED the food.  So think of this less as a coffee place and more of a breakfast place that does a great job at doing almost everything right with the food.

First off, the service was good.  We came in on the first day and they were busy and were willing to move things about to get us seated as quickly as possible.  Then, we realized that we weren't gonna get the coffee we wanted, and we had already eaten.  So instead of just sticking it out we let them know we were heading out and would be back the next day for some of the great looking food.

The next morning we were there, and we had a reservation.  We were seated promptly and our drinks were taken.  Now don't get me wrong, the drinks are just fine for a breakfast place.  Standard fair with some nice drink options.  But no craft coffee.  No snob coffee.  But the food was great!

With Vegas having so many places and with us getting into Vegas only rarely.   I doubt we will go back.  But if I lived here.  It probably would be a go to place when I want the unique breakfast fare they offer.

Plus, it was really cool of the waiter to offer to take a picture of us!

Being a downtown resident, and a fan of M&F coffee, I brought a friend visiting from Los Angeles to a Sunday brunch here. Man, oh man, was it an embarrassing representation of local dining in Las Vegas. Although the restaurant wasn't busy, it took our waiter more than 15 minutes to approach our table. Once we submitted our coffee order, he assured us that he'd be back to take our actual order. 

Sure enough, he did return, 20 minutes later, sans-coffee, to ask what we would like to eat. He was cold and abrasive, neither of us felt comfortable enough to ask for recommendations and he certainly was not offering them. 

I ordered the salmon benedict. It came out cold, but our server didn't follow up until he dropped the check...so no hopes in sending it back to be reheated.

I'm *ALL* for supporting local businesses, especially in Las Vegas, but not for the sacrifice of service. There are plenty of other local eateries in the downtown area with ample service - check them out before you make the mistake of dining here.

I would, however, recommend stoping in for a coffee! Cute aesthetic, great for Instagram, full bar and lots of interesting drinks to try!

I would love to have hung out and tried one of their breakfast items but I was in a hurry so that wasn't an option. Instead I got a chocolate croissant and an iced mocha. The mocha was fine but not memorable. The croissant was gummy in the middle. 

But the thing that really got my attention was that I only got part of my change. The bill was $8.57 or something like that and the girl handed me only bills. I looked at my change then back at her. "I think you forgot 40 cents or so." She then explained that she could "totally give me my change" but that they usually round their prices up or down to the nearest dollar. 

Well that's weird. 

If you're going to round to the nearest dollar than don't bother to tell me that the price was anything except your rounded price. I've never heard of any other place that does this and there was no sign describing their rather unusual policy.

The 43 cents doesn't matter. But clearly communicating to your customers...THAT matters. Especially when you do a really uncommon thing with their money. Then it REALLY matters. And on that front this place failed miserably.

Passable coffee, mediocre baked goods and very poor communication. Total Fail.

We are very happy with the food and coffee here. We ordered the chicken tinga omelet and aprepa benny with a lavender latte, chai latte, and espresso flan. Everything was delicious. It's a great place to visit and get away from the Vegas strip. This would get 5 stars from us if the service was a little better. While the waitress did apologize for the wait and not bringing water immediately, it was a bit awkward to wait that long while there were several open tables. We will visit again when we're back in Vegas. Also they had one of the best chai lattes I've tasted.

Finally got to try this place for Sunday brunch. Got there an hour into brunch and there was plenty of tables since the indoor dining area is small. The patio outside is cute, but the Vegas heat is not forgiving. I love the coffee bar menu, and the Italian espressos were a great wake me up to start my Sunday. If I didn't have mommy duties after brunch, I would totally have ordered some mimosas as there were so many flavors that sounded amazing! I got chilaquiles which was a good size portion and had a lime, spicy kick. I ordered the chilaquiles as is on the menu, but next time I might try to see if I could get a sunny side egg on top instead as the scrambled egg on the bottom was over cooked. Service was really friendly, and very attentive with no rush.
Such a cute place employees were nice. The food was great drinking lattes instead of mimosas was a nice change of pace. I loved all the Latin flavors incorporated. I will definitely be coming back.

So, first let me say I really liked this place. I ordered a cucumber mint iced tea and a kale salad with grilled chicken. Every thing was delightful my only gripe is I thought it was a bit pricey. So the tea was 5.5 and I am ok with that because it was delicious and I am sure not super simple to make. It was very fresh. The salad however was 11.5 plus 3 dollars for grilled chicken. It was tasty, filling, and I would get it again because I can't get anything healthy near my work BUT 14.5 for the salad feels over priced. I would come here once a week at least if the prices on food were more reasonable. I will be back for coffee though!
This place was introduced to me by my buddy Lonnie Love of near by gym Real Results . Incredible coffee and delicious food .

Delicious, flavorful and beautiful food. Truly the best coffee in Vegas. Husband had his coffee hot and I ordered chilled. Both tasty and I considered ordering another for the road. The environment is tasteful and well put together. Touches of life brought to the table with live plant centerpieces. The staff is friendly and knows about the food and offerings.
The menu isn't always in the same order, so look at all the pages! All and all, delicious and highly recommended. We went two days in a row!

Food and coffee is superb! I love all the substances at this place. However, they need to pick up the pace. Service is ridiculously shitty. I've ordered Togo & dine in and always waited half an hour for either my bill or my order.  Not a good look and I wished their service was great otherwise I'd be a a regular on the daily

Since it's been a while I figured I should update my review. I really enjoy Makers and Finders coffee and their food is always fresh and healthy. I can't give the fifth star just yet because of their service. They are friendly when you finally get their attention, but super slow. It took a full 15 minutes for someone to even come over and ask if I needed anything. I feel like Makers and Finders has a slight identity crisis. They want to be a hip coffee shop, but they also want to be a Latin restaurant. This could totally happen, but maybe a different way of ordering. Maybe take a note from Public Us? You can have people stand in line and order, then give them a number and have waiters or waitresses bring it to you. Simple and easy. 
Don't get me wrong this place is amazing for coffee! My favorites are the Cuban coffee or the Salted Caramel latte. As far as food goes you can't go wrong. They do have a different menu for brunch during the weekend that kicks ass. On my most recent visit I was a bit disappointed in the food. I tried the veggie bagel. It comes with dill cream cheese, avocado (like 4 little slices), thick cut pieces of tomato all on a giant half toasted/have burnt bagel. With a few tweeks it would have been better. 
Will I be back? Yes. Will I make sure I have plenty of time? Yes. Will I just order coffee? Probably!!

I was disappointed with Makers & Finders Coffee for many reasons. First off, after spending an extra 16 minutes driving across Las Vegas to this supposedly great coffee establishment, I find 1. A rather frosty reception from the maître d'. Makers & Finders is more a  restaurant than a traditional cafe. As I intended to take the coffee to go, I had to give my order to the unfriendly maître d' (you can't even really step into the "cafe" if you are not getting food)  2. The coffee was expensive ($5 for a Cortado and $5 for the larger cold brew). I am willing to pay for coffee because I enjoy a good cup of coffee. But it was really not that great. I had Cortado that was tastier and, even in San Francisco, cost only $3.50. If you are already in the area, yes, perhaps try this place out. But if you are a visitor (like me) who is in town and craving a fantastic cup of coffee, don't bother going across town just to make it to Makers & Finders. It is not worth it.
The menu is a bit limited, especially for vegetarians. The lavender latte is amazing. I'd go there just for that alone. It's a cute restaurant.

I have heard about this coffee place for a long time but never tried it until very recently. I can't wait to go back! I tried the honey vanilla iced latte and my friend tried the lavender iced latte. I usually get lavender latte is wherever I go and even though mine was delicious I regretted not getting hers! 

I did not know that they had such a big food menu. I thought it was just your typical coffee shop with maybe some pastries or small sandwiches but they actually have a lot of food. I am excited to try the empanadas as well as some of the other items that I saw On the menu. I will update my review once I try the food but the lavender latte was one of the best I've had! I recommend coming just for that if nothing else. 

Also they're very close to a lot of vintage stores and a buffalo exchange so it's nice to walk around that area after lunch
Great brunch spot for vegetarians. You must get the their veggie bagel and arepas. All the dishes come with plantain chips--even better!

This place is absolutely amazing, I tell everyone about this shop and take every chance to eat here that I get. I love that they have a variety of vegan options and they are all tasty. My favorite order is definitely the honey vanilla latte with coconut milk and a chia pudding, the fruit always tastes so fresh and the latte is the best one Ive had. The staff here is amazing and the atmosphere is welcoming and friendly.

Dude this place is awesome!!

It's across the street from buffalo exchange and retro vegas.

Their chicken empanadas, arepa benny, crispy fries, coconut soup and hisbiscus tea are to die for!!!!! I also love their coffee selection. They offer this really cool one (forgot the name) with condensed milk! Everything is made super fresh and to order.

Such a cool concept, Latin and a coffee bar! Everything is reasonably priced, it's always busy but people eat quickly so you're not standing around forever. Johnny is the best server! Is he always attentive, accurate, and gives the most immaculate service ever. This is probably one of my favorite coffee/restaurant combo! Thanks guys for keeping my tummy full and my wallet happy!

I came for a brunch with Sarah-Marie V. I've been wanting to try this spot since it opened. 

For beverages she got a cortido which was solid, but I liked my lavender latte better. It was balanced and really well made. 

Loaded chorizo soup had good amount of spice from the chorizo and had potato and kale. It was a simple and solid soup, but at least something not standard. I'm in a soup mood and tired of chicken noodle being the only option everywhere.

Arepa benny I thought was great! It makes a lot of sense to use the arepa for this type of preparation as it sops up hollandaise well. I will order this again - and soon! 

Carne mechada empanada was good as far as empanadas go.  I enjoyed the aji sauce on them, though the roasted potatoes and tomato accompaniment was a bit salty.

We also got the elvis press for dessert. It's a decent crossaint rich sandwich, but nothing you couldn't whip up easily at home. It works as a sweet option for a snack, but I dont know if I would call this "dessert". I love having nice beverages with something cakey. If they would fill the dessert category with patisserie items, this could be an even better place. 

I like the easy going flow of this place. It's brand new so there's I'm sure some hiccups and a groove they need to get into, but the people are enthusiastic and friendly about what they serve which is the step in the right direction. 

I will be back soon with the fiance. It's in a convenient spot near our cigar spot.

Found this perfect little coffee spot just walking around. The iced salted caramel latte hit the spot and I love that they have crushed iced! It's sometimes the little things :) I also tried the empanadas. They weren't traditional as the pastry crust was just puff pastry but they were pretty good! The carne was better than the shrimp. But the coffee was the star and I'll be back for more when I'm shopping!

Have been to this place a few times and have been meaning to write a review. Food is delicious and feels very fresh, but don't come in here thinking you will get out quickly, a cup of coffee takes a long time to make due to their process.  Also feel the portions are a little small for the prices they charge. But overall decent, I will be back when I'm not in a hurry.

I would first like to say that the coffee and the flavor of the food is wonderful. The establishment has a very fun  hipster vibe to it. I have been here 5 or 6 times and every time I come it's more and more busy.  That being said the quality of the food and service has gone down.  My server was fine but he had quite a few tables so it reflected in his attitude and body language.  And since the front was understaffed I can imagine that the back was understaffed as well since I ordered a dish that came out cold. I asked them to please heat up my food and put it in a Togo container so I could eat it on my way home only to find that my food was cold in the Togo container.  I hope management gets it together to come out with a way to make the current staff function better or to hire more for front and back to relive some stress of the current staff.

Loved it! had their lavender infused coffee; it was the best thing I ve had. Goes so well. We had the arepa benny; which had pulled beef, eggs and hollaindaise sauce. It was really good. Recommend trying this place for brunch

Loveee love lovee.  Little cute place in the arts district of Las Vegas. The lavender latte is sooo good, I cant wait to go back for more ! Also the mexican coffee was great! loved spice you can taste

I love this place!! I have been here half a dozen times now and every time I love how charming this local coffee place is. I love the Lavender Latte and Salted Caramel Latte. I also love their unique menu items. Last time I was there I had the Veggie Bagel and it was really delicious. The honey dill butter spread was so different but so yummy. I always love meeting friends here because of the fun atmosphere and great menu options.

Requested a table rather than a seat at the bar. Although restaurant was less than half full, six + empty tables, I was told 20 minute wait. I went elsewhere rather than sit on uncomfortable stools with little space to eat. May try again if I am not alone. I suggest avoiding this place unless you are in a group.

One of my favorite local gems in Las Vegas. The coffee is brilliant, made with love and there are great food options to go with it. I sometimes will bring my dogs and sit at the tables out front. The mexican and caramel lattes are two wonderful options, and my favorite food items are the arepa benny or la paisa. Everything is made with care here, just as it is all consistently excellent. Parking on the street isn't so difficult depending in the time, but it is worth it any time to steal away from the noise of the city and enjoy a relaxing drink.
Update: They now offer a vegan menu (many options!) although my favorite is the avocado toast. Marco is absolutely amazing! Great coffee and great food :)

No question the food is VERY good BUT the service is amateurish at best. If you have a hankering for something different then M&F would be the place to quench your pallet, except the service was terrible. TERRIBLE!  We were  seated promptly and the waiter introduced himself, said he would give us some time to decide and then everything went south. Timing is everything with serving and this guy had no idea what he was doing. We had to wait too long for him to come back and take our coffee order. So we ordered our food as well when he finally  showed returned. The food came out BEFORE our coffee hit the table, not good. BTW not all our food made it. A $15 order of empanadas never made it. So the order was comped. Because our coffee came late we only had one cup each and  that also cost the owner profits. No manager made it over to our table to see how things were going and given the price of the food you'd expect to see a little team support. This our second time here and both times had a similar experience. PROBABLY won't be back.

We enjoyed our breakfast. It was definitely delicious. I had the Nutella Crepes, my girlfriend had Breakfast Bagel Sandwich, her hubby had Kale Chorizo Omelet and my other half had the Arepa Benny. Our only complaint, our service was a bit slow. The coffee isn't free refill. They do charge you for another cup so that's a great heads up to know or be aware of. The place itself is super quaint and loved everything about it!

EXCELLENT place for breakfast!  Hip vibe in    a cool kinda industrial setting.  Incredible coffee.  And breakfast selections (and lunch too) were Latino - lots of arepas on the menu. I had the Arepas Benny (eggs Benedict) and the Mrs had arepas with mango and avocado.  Both really good. Great job, Makers!

This place is freaking delicious! I ordered the Arepa Benny, which was good, but I definitely need to order the La Paisa arepa next time! The arepa quality is so tasty and so good!

I also ordered the honey vanilla latte, but wanna try the lavender latte (which I guess is very popular), and also coconut tumeric latte, just out of curiosity. 

The people here are also very friendly!

I'm a local, and I am  always on the hunt for good, honest, again Good! local restaurants, but this isn't it. The food, I tried the chilaquiles never in my life will I ever enjoy my chilaquiles drenched in a fake lime flavored green salsa, as for coffee I'd rather the one I make my self at home and I'm not a barista. Finally the service, sucked! Server left we never saw him again till we aaked for him. I think I'm being fair by giving them 2 stars because maybe I had a bad experience maybe I didn't choose any of the right menu items, for the price all the food should be edible.

Yep,  this is the real deal.  Cool vibe plenty of space, great tunes,  outstanding food.   And the coffee is amazing. 

I'm a huge fan.  This is NOT Starbucks.   This is craft coffee at its best.   Don't be in a hurry here. 

And a huge shout-out to Ed for making my first trip to M&F fantastic!

So happy I discovered this gem with my friends. Awesome atmosphere, music, delicious lattes and dope staff. Still haven't tried their food, will do on the next visit.

Imma sucker for a good lavender latte, they make theirs with a homemade lavender syrup, just the perfect amount of sweet.

My friend had a coconut turmeric latte and oh my god was that goooood!

I also heard they opened another location in downtown summerlin so I know where I'll be spending time after my yoga classes
This is the only place I have ever had an Armando Palmer! It is this lemonade and hibiscus drink that is to die for. The food is always great. One of my favorite places to relax and get centered.

I'm a local, born and raised, and I had been wanting to check out Downtown Las Vegas to try more small businesses. I was absolutely stunned by this café!

First off, the idea of a coffee shop mixed with Latin comfort foods is original and brilliant. And the menu is full of innovative combos and classic drinks. I ordered the cold brew, chicken tingas empanadas, and crispy fries to share with a friend. I was served pretty quickly, and the food was not only presented nicely, but it tasted just as good as it looked!

The exterior and interior of the shop is immaculate. Due to poor Vegas weather, I was unable to enjoy the couches and lounge chairs outside, but the thought is so inviting. The inside is beautifully decorated and a very comforting atmosphere. There's copies of literature and free Vegas magazines to read. There's an open area for laptop use. And there's your standard bench and table seating, which was perfect for my party of two. 

The staff was very friendly and inviting! I never felt over serviced or badgered, which made me relaxed. 

Absolutely a place worth checking out if you're a tourist or a local! I'll definitely be back. Often.

I been waiting for table for over 20mins when they said it would be 10 and then they gave my table to other white couple first. This is terrible service and I will never step my foot back here again and be treated without any respect.

I live in Arizona and visit Vegas quite frequently,  The highlight of my trip is stopping in with my family at Makers and Finders.  The atmosphere is so different than your every day coffee shop!  The food is fresh and homemade the coffee is amazing!!! I have never tasted a Empanada as good anywhere else! The staff is very attentive and friendly! There is always daily specials and a great Happy Hour! I would love to see this restaurant expand in the future!

I couldn't get enough of this place! Went 3 times while we were in Vegas for the week. Bomb breakfast and coffee!! Servings are perfect I had the Lavender infused Latte...Delicious! I need to find a place by where I live that makes the same thing. I did have their regular coffee on my first visit and it was good but strong. Their chilaquiles were my favorite. Amazing place...we'll be back on our next visit

Great little local spot off the strip.  Had the tres leches waffle and a yogurt parfait for Sunday brunch, along with a siphon of their Kenyan Coffee.  
I enjoyed everything but gave it only 4 stars because the coffee arrived after we had finished eating our meal (we wanted it with our meal) and baristas made a good cup/siphon of coffee but were not that knowledgeable about the coffees they offered (at least to a serious coffee geek).  Would definitely come back.

Soooo yummy!!  And the service was so great!  Brought my puppy and they were so sweet to her.  The hostess brought water for my pup before I asked!

Had the pulled beef Benny and it was AMAZING!  Coffee is on point too!

My amazing husband and I were on the hunt for a good iced latte this morning.  After trying a couple other places downtown that happened to be closed (stupid hours), we came upon M&F Coffee.  It's a restaurant but also has a "coffee bar".

Our order was simple, 2 iced vanilla latte's to go.  Now understand, I am a coffee snob and in turn, my husband is too all because of lil ol' me.

Our drinks were poured over crushed ice (awesome in my book).  The presentation was great too.  Milk and vanilla on the bottom, espresso on top.  They mixed easily as we walked back to our car. 

The drinks were awesome.  I opted for half the vanilla flavor they typically use as I don't like my drinks overly sweet.  It was perfect.  The hubs felt his was a bit sweet for his taste.

The location and parking are ideal.  Just South of Charleston on the West side of Main St.  It's like a half block before Casa Don Juan.   Prices were a bit steep.  We paid over $12 for 2 larges.  It's expensive but I guarantee, we will be back!! 

Do yourself a favor, try the food but definitely grab a latte to go or better yet, have one while you eat and take one home too!  I lamented on 4 vs 5 stars because of the price.  I decided they deserve a full 5 as the drinks were just that good!

Makers & Finders has a really good happy hour (that's why we went lol) and an amazing espresso martini. The food had a Latin twist to it and was pretty delicious. Their avocado salad is really refreshing and tasty, the empanadas were flames and my crew really enjoyed the poutine. 

We sat outside because it was warm but it got chilly pretty quickly so they turned on the heat lamps for us which helped a little. Bomb customer service and tasty food. \

Oh, and their coffee is better than Starbucks. Yea I said it. Try their lattes and see what you think.

Everthing here is WONDERFUL. Wish it had existed when I lived in Vegas four years ago but now that I'm back and forth for work I'll come here as often as I can.

Their house-made lavender syrup IS as beautiful as everyone raves - try it in an iced (almond milk!) latte or a cocktail. Coffee in a V60 pourer is par excellence; although not roasted in-house it's sourced sustainably and fair-trade. I typically drink the Bolivian. There is a Stella Artois tap that is always tempting, but since this place closes at 4pm, I'm usually still in coffee mode. But the baristas have told me that 2017 is the year to expand: location #2 AND dinner/late-night hours are on the horizon! I'm pumped for that.

The la paisa is phenomenal. The perfect arepa-based breakfast complete with sunny side up egg on top and accompanied by rice. The other popular breakfasts food look phenomenal as well: I've never seen a Latin-fusion place with quite the flair as this one.

Spacious, including a patio, and a bar. The staff is all fantastic: pleasant, accommodating, conversational. Love this spot; will be back as often as I can.
Loved the almond milk flat white, ordered at the bar on a quiet morning in downtown Las Vegas!
The food was INSANELY delicious, I got TWO different lattes which were both so yummy & everyone was very friendly

This review is based off of my experience with getting a latte to go, and will be revised when I return to dine here. 

My favorite cafe closes pretty early, and my partner and I were out and about, checking out the vintage stores and antique shops in the area when I wanted coffee. Bad. Our friend had mentioned this place when we were out and about the other day, and she had raved about their coffee. 

I hadn't realized it was a full on diner. 

The staff was friendly, and we were greeted immediately. The place is cute, with a rad M & F sign over their bar.  I had a Mexican Spice Latte that was delicious, and totally gave me flashbacks to my nana' chocolate growing up. The service wasn't the fastest for a cafe, but this place was primarily a diner, so a bit of a wait is to be expected. 

I can't wait to come back for breakfast.

I was wavering hard on a 3 or 4 star rating. I feel a bit torn. The coffee was very good. Had a nice variety on the menu and all felt like the prices were fair for coffee. I also like the option to purchase alcohol if you desire. What really left me unsure about this place was the food. While the food was not terrible, it also wasn't great. I also genuinely felt like every food item on the menu was about 2-4 dollars over priced. 10 dollars for a bacon egg and cheese bagel is ridiculous. And it was very average. All and all the environment is cool. Staff was friendly. But would not want food again. 3.5/5.

This eatery reminds me of all the hip eateries in Austin, Texas but cheaper. We ordered chilaquiles, arepas benny, and house coffee. The chilaquiles were layered with scrambled eggs, black beans, tortilla chips, and a green sauce with just the right touch of heat. We ate it all up. It was a unique idea to use arepas for the base of the benny and it worked! The two arepas were topped with pulled beef, spinach, and runny eggs. The pulled beef needed more seasoning, but overall taste was very good. The fried plantains that came with the benny didn't add anything to the dish. Coffee was very good and worked perfectly with our dishes. Table service from the waiter was very attentive without being intrusive. We can definitely recommend this place with no hesitation.

Items Selected:
Cold Brew
Mango Caprese Arepa - Sliced Mango, Queso Fresco, Tomato, Balsamic with plantain chips
Elvis Press - Sweet Croissant, Bacon, Peanut Butter, Nutella, Banana
Ojaldras - Honey Orange Batter, Cinnamon Sugar, Lechera, Vanilla Ice Cream

Almost unabashedly targeting the hipster crowd with a clever name complete with ampersand it was just after lunch at El Sombrero Mexican Bistro that I entered Makers & Finders, the 'urban coffee bar' still in its soft opening phase just across Charleston on South Main Street and with a focus on roasters not yet featured in Sin City and a menu featuring loosely defined "Latin" cuisine the experience component still needs a little work, though the promise is great.  

With owner, operator, and marketing folks working front of house while a team of three manned a small kitchen in back it was mere moments after crossing the outdoor patio and entering Makers & Finders glass door that I was greeted by a young man named Christian and seated along a wall with full view of the extensive coffee bar the service that followed was fun, informative, and efficient as can be - all questions answered and feedback sought on every item tasted throughout my nearly hour long stay.

Stripped down in décor with Botero posters lining the back walls as a mod-techno infused soundtrack filled the air it was with an clean, full-bodied cold-brew that the afternoon began and browsing free WiFi while a few already-regulars chatted at a table to my left it would not be long before the first of three plates arrived, an arepa with a piping hot bun so crisp that it could barely be cut with the flimsy flatware provided while the flavor of crisp fruit, vibrant tomatoes, and mild cheese tinged in balsamic was anything but meek - a restrained sweetness added to the Italian classic and a perfect option for vegetarians and those looking for something healthy and fresh.

Moving onward to things more sinful it was perhaps good fortune for Makers & Finders that I am not, in fact, a vegetarian as the whimsical "Elvis Press" was described on the menu with no mention of bacon and although I was admittedly underwhelmed by the doughy croissant - something the restaurant would be well advised to remedy via quick consult to Chef Ogasawara at Sweets Raku, perhaps - the constituents within were again pleasant, the crisp pork offsetting decidedly sweet flavors as molten hazelnut spread and peanut butter made the composition more fork and knife friendly than the sort of thing eaten by hand.

Still sipping the coffee while debating a caramel or honey infused espresso it was not long before a final plate of Ojaldras arrived and having never tasted this dish, thus with no precedent to judge, all I can say is that the crisply fried strips were excellent beneath a veil of citrus-kissed honey while "seasonal" vanilla bean ice cream was icy and inert, another outsourcing job to be considered...in this case a job for the team at Art of Flavors, or perhaps another 'unique' purveyor not yet featured in the Las Vegas market as it is with the focus of the brew.

At this point an imperfect vision tucked amidst the unique antique shops on Main Street there is little doubt that Makers & Finders is apt to grow with experience and time, the team obviously interested in the customer experience while the menu aspires to things far more interesting than the typical soups, salads, sandwiches, and pastries popularized by large chains.  Not yet ready to take on spots like Sambalatte or Grouchy John's but obviously much more convenient to the hip-urban crowd it will be interesting to see how this project develops, the brewery next door another clear sign of the direction downtown continues to progress.

We stumbled across this place while
in search of a guitar shop. It's in a funky little
part of town between the strip and downtown. I found it on yelp and decided to give it a try and it was a find! I was feeling adventurous so ended up ordering a coconut turmeric latte to see what all the hype was about and it was beyond my expectations. I ended up dragging my husband back there 2 more times and was disappointed that I wouldn't be able to get this drink until the next time we go to Vegas.  If anyonr knows where I can get a good turmeric latte in L.A. or O.C. let me know!
The Mexican spiced latte is legit.  Also had the Latin hash and the chilaquiles.  Both were delicious.  Great atmosphere in a cool little section of dtlv.

What a great find this place was! Went here for breakfast and coffee with family visiting from out of town. Nice patio area which was dog friendly *thumbs up*. Food was really good. We all tried something different and there were definitely no complaints! The salted caramel latte was a great choice as well. Would definitely go back to try some of the other things on the menu!

The coffee, food, atmosphere, and especially the people make this one of the best discoveries in vegas, but the 18b arts district gets to claim this treasure! This is worth any detour in vegas and enjoy the patio too!

Awesome place!!! I love you every time we go to Vegas we have to have brunch here it is just amazing!  The food, yummmm...
But I think they need to hire more people to make the service a bit faster...

THIS REVIEW COMES WITH A FUNNY STORY. (But it's still relevant to this review so don't worry) 

A great hole in the wall coffee shop that offers delicious Cuban breakfast meals, sandwhiches, sweets, and a variety of coffee. I ordered the Arepa Benny $10 (which seems pretty popular via Yelp) and a Honey Vanilla Latte $5.50. The Benny was amaaaazing! The yolk broke perfectly and their hollandaise was delicious. The latte was also equally delicious. It was actually reccommended by our server. 

Okay here's my funny story:
When you walk into Makers & Finders there is (or should I say was) a wooden bench that's connected to the entire right side of the wall. Those seats are obviously intended for 2 people parties. Well anyway... my cousin and I have already been seated and eating for a good 30 mins, then a group of 2 men sat at the table next to us; 1 guy on the chair and 1 on the bench. A couple minutes after that, a friend of theirs walks through the door and sits next to the guy on the bench. At that moment I hear a loud "crrraaaccckk" and instantly think "This sh** is about to break." Then literally seconds after that, a woman they knew walks up to the second man on the bench and hugs him. Right when she goes in for the hug and puts her weight onto him the whole entire bench disconnects from the wall. True story. No one fell onto the floor or got hurt or anything, but the fact that the bench detatches itself from their concrete wall is pretty insane lol. The staff and the owner were extremely apologetic and kept making sure everyone was okay. My cousin and I actually got free dessert out of it lol. But the reason why I wanted to add that story in is because, although I had a near death experience (jk), I'm still giving them a 5 star rating lol. And THAT, ladies and gentleman, is how great their food, coffee, and service was! ... Just not their bench.

Absolutely amazing! The neighborhood is kinda sketchy and the parking is almost nonexistent (just street parking and not a lot of those), but do not be discouraged by that. Service is excellent and the food is out of this world!! Very pleasant  and relaxed atmosphere. Give it a shot, you won't regret it!
M&F is wonderful, their food and coffee is awesome. Must try their Lavender Latte, it taste really good

Flat Whites!!  After a week in the US without a decent coffee, we stumbled across this place in Las Vegas of all places. Great coffee, excellent food of normal proportions & great fresh ingredients. My friends said it was the best Chai latte they'd ever had! A breather from the Vegas madness. Come here!!

great coffee in a fantastic place more reminiscent of San Francisco or New York....something this town sorely needs....and the bagel sandwich was fantastic but a little pricey.....$15.00 for a bagel sandwich and an iced coffee?? I understand you want a good more upscale crowd here and I am all for it but be careful that you don't run off people that would come her a little more frequently if it weren't so spendy.. beautiful building and great staff so I will return but not as often as I would like

People you really need to get downtown and start enjoying our city. We need to support our community and local businesses. The people were great. The coffee was delicious. We hng out outside with rhe kids and watched local kids dance and then went to the antique stores rhe best day. So many wonderful places to go see. Please people get out and see this amazing downtown the people are amazing and are local and trying so hard to keep up our amazing city

This place is a find! Contemporary, relaxed, Colombian infused cuisine. The yucca smash-superb, had the Benedict done with veggies, was amazing. The Lavender latte is a must! Great service and staff! Definitely going back for more

Extremely slow service. The ambiance is nice, staff are very friendly. But slow service is unbelievable! I dont blame the servers but I think they are quite understaffed.
We waited 25 minutes to be seated which I guess is fine for a trendy place on saturday morning. But it took them another 15 minutes to take our order and about 40 minutes more to bring our food. I had Latin hash which was pretty good. My friends had garlic lime chicken and arpena Benny which were only mediocre and more importantly very cold. My food was right temperature though. 
We wanted a pastry so we ordered a chocolate croissant. We waited for it for another 20 minutes, on top of all of the other wait. Finally they came to us and they said they don't have it and they reimbursed us for it. I really think management should add to the number of staff.
The empanadas are fantastic, the vibe is chill and available parking is nearby. The outside space is a bonus. It's in the Arts District Downtown which is a bonus. Great cold brew and pour overs.

Super good food and great coffee.  The empanadas are sauced up and they come with rice, a salad, and beans.  The fries are good as well.  ...dont forget your coffee! I went with the vanilla honey latte with almond milk Mmmmmmmmmmmmmm

I came back for a 3rd time. I even had my friends from PA and NJ meet me there instead of eating near the strip. Coffee. Amazing. You can tell the food was made right but by the time we got it, it was cold on top and the middle. Ill keep trying bc i know something is right here and shit happens...This place will figure it out soon. Until next time. They even forgot my friends bacon and he was devistated.

The coffee is always amazing! I typically order an iced honey vanilla latte or the Mexican spiced latte. They have a variety of non-diary milks (soy and nut milks) so that's always a plus in a my book (as I am lactose intolerant). 

I recently had dinner here as well and ordered the lomo saltado and the empanada sampler. I was surprised when the food arrived it wasn't as good as the coffee. The lomo saltado is sort of a deconstructed version as the fries, steak, and onions are traditionally stir-fried together but not in this dish. I did like that they added an egg though. I was underwhelmed with the empanadas because they are made with flour dough as opposed to the traditional corn dough. I generally prefer corn dough or corn tortillas to the flour versions but I know I'm also the minority in that aspect. That said, the fillings were pretty well done! I had the chicken tinga (which was my favorite), carne mechada (seasoned shredded beef), and the cheese blend. I found the rice and black beans bland (which is odd because they're flavorful all on their own but maybe they didn't add enough salt). Although the rice was really fluffy so it had a wonderful texture so I definitely finished it! 

Overall this place is still 4 stars (although if I rated just the coffee it'd be 5). The service is great (even at 45 mins before closing) and staff are friendly. I would go back and try other dishes for sure.

Friendly service, remarkably fresh food, and coffee that will open your eyes and brighten your day. Makers & Finders was everything we'd heard...and more. I highly recommend the vegan empanada sampler. All were good, but the mushroom empanada will bring me back next time I'm in Vegas.

This was a great find!  I had the Arepa Benny and a regular coffee.  The coffee was amazing!  All of the latte options also sounded delicious.  The Arepa Benny was delicious with coffee rubbed beef and plantain chips on the side.  

The service was fast, kind,  and attentive.  The environment was relaxed, and the price was very reasonable. I would absolutely come back here!
Trendy Latin hangout. The food is delicious and is suitable for families. It's a great place for taking insta-worthy pictures. The waiter was very nice to me and adjusted my coffee as pleased.

Yelp people overrated this place for sure!! This place took a long time to make our food and my coffee. The place wasn't even busy. My BF and I weren't very happy. I would say the staff was friendly, but everything else was a disappointment. I only went to this place bc Yelp due to good reviews. I was very disappointed. It was close to an hour before we got our food. It took the waiter a long time to come back, if it was to take our order or bring our food. When the food came, it was warm close to cold. My BF order the Latin Hash (skillet type) dish and it was cold and the potatoes was hard. I ordered Arepa Benny (an egg Benedict type) dish. Both dishes was seasoned well and it tasted good.
