However, it felt like it was under the heat lamp awhile so it didn't taste fresh. I think we watched our waiter talking and eating his own food. I also got an almond milk latte and it had a strong coffee taste, didn't taste any thing like the name. I would say close to no almond flavor in it at all. Lastly, we went to the bathroom before leaving and walked by the kitchen and we could see, it was well staffed. And at the coffee bar, there were two more staff and another two as waiters. I don't understand why the heck my food took forever?! Probably would never return here due to the wait plus the food was so so. Overall, this place wasn't worth the wait.

What a great spot!! This place is great and I'm defo going to be visiting here on every time I'm in vegas - the food and coffee are top notch , the staff are great , 

Love it , thank you!

This place is pretty hipster. I had the lavender latte with almond milk, and Benedict (I forgot which one). But the food and coffee was excellent! I took off one star since no one really checked in on us, but that was fine. The latte was wonderful. My fiance had the iced matcha with almond milk. It was somewhat bland, cause we thought they would mix in some sugar, but nope! I enjoyed this experience.
The menu is limited and the service is always slow. Expect to spend about an hour and a half there, even if you're only ordering a bagel. The coffees are good.

I had lunch here with my mother on a weekday. She had the Empanada plate with a side of Brussel sprouts and the lavender fog tea. I had the empanadas sampler with a side of french fries and a salted caramel latte. We both enjoyed our meals and beverages and the service was good. The only downside is accessibility to the restaurant. I was able to park a block away and that was no big deal but my mom had to park 2 blocks away and she has bad knees and can't walk long distances.
Such a hidden gem with amazing coffee and lots of great food options! On our way through Vegas and so glad we decided to make the stop.

This is more a brunch breakfast place then the straight coffee shop I imagined. The coffee drinks we ordered were good. The food however was mediocre. We shared the empanada sampler and the poutine. Both were small plates and the flavors just didn't quite deliver for the $40 tab I ended up with. Overall, I might stop in again if I were in the area but just for a coffee.

One of the hidden gems (to 80%) of people fhat live/visit vegas....

Went here for coffee only and it was one of the best i've had here in Las Vegas. They have a wide variety of different coffees and teas and the one I had was the Salted Carmel Latte....salt, milk, and coffee is so legit just like sea salted ice cream...Hopefully will have an updated review including food soon!

Alongside their signature drink, coffee shops usually offer pastries and small salads. You can find some of the same fair here but with a Latin infusion, and those dishes are only in addition to their Hispanic inspired cuisine. Actually, this flavor flair even blends with one of their speciality coffees, the Mexican Spice Latte, which is an artful mix of subtle seeet with a savory touch. It is a refreshing change that is one of the main features that sets Makers and Finders apart. 

The service and warm reception is another important element of Makers and Finders' atmosphere. The staff is always curteous, friendly, and completely skilled and knowledgeable in regards to the coffee they brew. When I first arrived, I ordered an espresso, and realizing I was new, I was told, "Just so you know, we serve doubles as the standard here. Is that fine with you, sir." Yes, yes it is. In fact, that is exactly what I want to hear from a coffee shop.

Makes and Finders offers a great environment for groups or individual dinning, providing a bar counter, formal seating, and open areas with large tables and lounging sofas. Additionally, upon request, they can serve French press coffee or stove top espresso. I will definitely visit with a group of friends some time.

Whether you are stopping in for lunch during the work-day, or visiting for a casual afternoon coffee, you will always feel comfortable, welcome, and pleased at Makers and Finders.

Really awesome place with a great soundtrack, amazingly diverse menu. Parking is easy and the service is attentive. Vegas needs more places like this. 

I had an iced coffee and the La Paisa arepa, definitely tasty filling food. Portions are small and the prices are higher than average (think $6 lavender lattes, and $12 chorizo Brussels sprouts) but it definitely is a unique, modern cafe which are definitely missing in vegas.

This place is legit!  Try it.  Save your money and skip the typically overpriced Vegas breakfasts.  The food and the coffee are amazing.  Every bit as good, if not way better, than any high end Vegas stop hotel breakfast.

My wife and I stumbled on it on the way to old Vegas and highly recommend a visit!

The food was DELICIOUS. I had the "La Paisa arepa" and I will be coming again for more of it and to taste every other thing on the menu because it all sounded DELICIOUS. Cozy place. Great customer service.

We were in the Artist District exploring for the day.  We tried Makers & Finders Coffee based on the good reviews.  Was a very good experience!  Excellent coffee and food was good as well.  Service was extremely friendly, made us feel like regulars.
It's a good place to relax and enjoy breakfast. Must try the salted caramel latte ! The Lavender infused latte is not bad too. According to the server, the lavender syrup is make in house.

Everything is delicious and there's so many items on the menu to try. I got the Latin hash and the salted caramel latte. The hash was amazing the meat was super tender and the peppers were sweet and together it was awesome. The latte was so smooth and not too salty like most salted caramel items can be.

I really want to give this place 4 stars but the service lacks which keeps it at a 3. Love the small eclectic food menu and of course all the coffee options which is what brings me in. If the servers could be a bit more attentive I may be inclined to increase my rating.

Excellent teas in a very special cup! Over-easy eggs hidden under Bacon & Brussels Chips! Yummy! Friendly servers and cool modern decor. Eat here before you hit The Strip and merge into grand American money obsession!

Came for the coffee, stayed longer for the breakfast. They have a great selection of coffee, teas, and other drinks and their breakfast menu caters to any cravings. We came on a Saturday for brunch and our table got the tree leches waffles (it's a wet waffle), the Latin hash, and the chilaquilles. Portions aren't large but it's enough to get you full.

I'm a self proclaimed coffee snob - so after the rave reviews from both locals and yelp alike - I thought I couldn't go wrong at M&F. I enjoyed a leisurely (and by leisurely I mean sluggish service) salted caramel latte and a cortadito. Both were good...but by no means were they the best versions I've ever had and they certainly weren't worth $6 a pop. Cool ambiance, nice staff, but not recommended if you're in a rush or are looking for a coffee that will blow your mind.

My family & I enjoyed our experience. The service was legit. Almost 2 legit 2 quit. I got the Chilaquiles and a Latte and it got sent straight to the gut ya feel me. We're definitely pulling up again our next visit to Vegas. They treated us too good. I give this place a bomb bam shipshap snap!
Had lunch today.   Service pretty slow but really enjoyed the arepa benny.  Cold brew coffee a little disappointing but an overall positive experience.

Beautiful hidden gem near downtown Vegas in the arts district. 

They have such a beautiful space with unique artwork and quirky touches such as neon lights and mason jars as spice holders. 

I went for the lavender infused latte and the arepa benny and both were so flavorful and delicious. 

The lavender in the latte was strong in presence but not overpowering, and not too sweet. 

The arepa benny blew me away. I had never had a Benedict with a Latin American twist like that. Pretty sure I blacked out from happiness because before I knew it, it was gone. My only tiny wish is that the eggs had been more runny, but that's just personal preference. 

Will definitely venture off the strip for this next time I'm in Vegas. So worth it!

I was recommended the arepa benny from the menu and it was "THE BOMB"! I was never a breakfast person until I tried it. I will definitely come back. Also, they have unique varieties of coffee/lattes/ teas and a comforting interior/atmosphere.
A great downtown coffee house. Staff friendly and menu is great. The Brussels sprouts are delish and the salted caramel latte is the best!

This place is one of my favorites in the city. I like to come here on weekends for lunch, but I've been here during lunch break on weekdays as well. My first impression of this place is that I love the interior space. It's very clean, simple and modern. There is a variety of areas for seating, for casual individuals or conversational groups. The staff here is super friendly and service is great. Their menu has a good selection of food and all that I've tried have not disappointed. Additionally, their coffee is delicious. I usually just get a cold brew, black coffee or latte, but they've all been satisfactory. Love everything about this place. Would definitely come back whenever possible.

I'm giving this place 3 stars because the food and coffee is good. I chose to bring Costa Rican friends here because they didn't want to wait in the long lines at brunch places on the strip. Although we didn't have to wait in line to get seated here it took 40 minutes to get our coffees and another hour to get the food. By the time our food came our coffees were gone and we weren't offered refills. I ordered a chocolate croissant. My two friends got their food and 10 minutes passed so I decided to ask about my croissant. The waitress told me they ran out of dough so they were making it and it would be another 10 minutes. Could you have told me that an hour ago? Or when you brought my friends food? I told her to forget it and decided not to eat because I didn't want to be there all day. So if you're really hungry -beware you'll be waiting a while for your food.

I gotta say this place is amazing! The proportions are perfect and the flavors are extraordinary. It's Colombian based food. I ordered the chilaquiles with over easy eggs. The eggs were perfect and really complemented the crunchy tortilla chips for the chilaquiles. The black beans were so creamy and soft. The sauce had a great consistency. And wasn't drowning the chilaquiles. Over all just had a great experience and atmosphere of this place!

For a Las Vegas coffee shop this is as good as it gets. I do hate sharing my local secrets but its for the best right??? Makers and finders is right up there with Sambalatte battling for my coffee addiction. The location is in the arts district so unless you are staying downtown or near/on main street you will probably need a car to easily get here. Once you are here though, the staff is friendly, the coffee is amazing and the ambiance is well, hipster-esque. Me personally I am not a hipster but I don't feel really turned off coming here at all.

My favorite things here are of course the lattes, specifically the lavender latte or Mexican spice latte, and a few of the random food items they serve. My favorite will have to be the chicken tingas, which are basically homemade chicken enchiladas that come in an order of 2 and cut in half with sauce ON them. If you want them plain you better say something when you order. As for my second favorite thing here I would have to suggest the tomato bisque soup. Tastes delicious and looks homemade. As for the 'grill cheese' croissant that comes with it, I could pass, but that still doesn't stop me from ordering it!

I have been here many times, have tried about half of the menu and I must say I have never really been disappointed. My coffee is always amazing- keep in mind on weekends or when they are super busy, expect waits of up to 10 minutes for your lattes but it will be well worth it. I drive out of my way to come here. And will continue to do so unless they disappoint me!

I stopped by here on a Friday morning looking for a good cup of coffee. We were greeted and seated right away and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We decided to just get two lattes to go, I chose the lavender infused latte. I am a huge lavender flavor fan, so to me it was very subtle hint, but I definitely enjoyed it. The only set back was that it did take quite a while to get our lattes. I'll definitely be returning to try some of there popular food menu items.

Love their food and lavender latte. If you're in Vegas you gotta check them out! Great atmosphere and clean! Lots of different foods to choose from and like nothing else. They pair foods you would never think of pairing and it creates an amazingly wonderful taste and experience. This place is a must try you will not be disappointed, unless you don't know what good food is!

This place is awesome! I had 2 totally different types of coffee and they were both the best. I highly recommend this great little place for all you coffee lovers... The food was also a nice treat, I enjoyed everything I had. You all need to hit this place up!
Great food. I highly reccomend the latin hash and the cortado. A relaxing break from the strip
WOW! Their lavender & honey flavored lattes are to die for! Good little breakfast items to complement as well.

We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. We decided to have lunch before checking in at the Palms. 
Cute patio. Cute bar. Good food. Menu looks big. Presentation of the menu is unique. Lots of choices. Hard to decide... bathroom is clean, outside, and shared with the brewery next door. Cool graffiti outback. Cool photos on the way to the restroom. Wait staff is friendly and helpful.
We want to go back and try more! 
Only bad part could be the parking. I told all my friends!

Urban coffee shop DTLV at the arts district. Good Latin food and friendly service. Can't wait til' they opens up for their regular hours.     The place looks amazing there's patio seating, and a lounge area inside.  Try the honey vanilla latte and AREPAS (see pictures).

This place is a Gem!!!!! You will not be disappointed. The Latte's are amazing and I don't even like Latte's! I had the Mexican Spiced Latte and also their hibiscus mimosa both are excellent. 

Try their skillets and the Arepa Eggs Benedict  mmmmmmm so good! Also their bacon is OUT of this world delicious!!

We had Chris G as our server and he is one of the best servers I've had in a long time!! Very much enjoyed our experience at M&F.

This place is fantastic! Came in on a Sunday around 12pm with a party of 5. It was pretty busy inside but we were sat down at a table within 10 minutes. 

For drinks we ordered an iced lavender latte, chai tea latte, and espresso con panna. Everything was absolutely delicious, I would highly recommend getting the lavender latte! 

We got 2 Arepa Bennys, one chicken Benny, a yogurt parfait, and I ordered the Latin Hash. We all greatly enjoyed our meals, and everything came out in no time at all. 

Our wonderful server was Ruben. He was super friendly and helped us out with anything we needed. 

I don't live in Las Vegas, but if I find myself coming back to this city I will for sure be stopping by Makers again.

When you are tired of Vegas and over priced crap food go to Makers & Finders for breakfast and coffee.  The coffee selections are fun and I had a Lavender coffee that was not too sweet and better than anything I had in a while;  moreover, just the regular coffee is great.  Service was fast and the staff was caring.  The food selections were great for everyone and everything tasted good (as far as all the dishes I sampled from everyone around me).  Enjoy the coffee stay for the food and more!  A quaint spot that makes you feel like a human amongst the chaos of Vegas.

My husband and I were visiting Vegas for a week and stumbled across this place while thrift shopping. It has a super cute patio and very nicely decorated interior. 

The first time we just tried the coffee, he had a cold brew and I had their special latte of the day "honey almond latte with crushed pecans".  It was the most amazing latte I have ever had in my life. Creamy, nutty, and not too sweet. Would highly recommend.

We came back the next 3 days we were in Vegas. Mostly for coffee but decided to try out the Arepas for lunch. They were both very tasty and the plantain chips were delicious but it was a bit pricey for the serving size. 

Overall I would highly recommend, especially the flavored lattes!

Stopped by this morning for the first time- its pretty unique to have a host greet you instead of ordering at the counter, but it's nice!  Each drink (even drip coffee!) is made individually by hand, and my god are they good.  Easily the best chai I've had since moving to LV.  I also got the veggie bagel, which was surprisingly flavorful and distinctive for something that seems so simple.  Service is a little slow, but I think that's the vibe - a place to hang out and savor all of the interesting flavors this place seems to impart in every sip and bite.

WOW! What a pleasant surprise!  We ordered the 
1. Breakfast Bagel $9.50 **
2. Kale Chorizo Omelet $10.00 **
3. Smoked Lox Bagel $10.00 
4. Honey Vanilla Latte $5.50
5. Salted Caramel Latte $5.50 **

I can't even find the words to describe how amazingggggg the BREAKFAST BAGEL was!!! The best bagel I have EVER had- hands down. The KALE CHORIZO OMELET was exceptional as well! I usually don't like omelets but this one made me a believer. I also had the Salted Caramel Latte which we all know was amazing- can't go wrong with salted caramel :)

My man friend however really enjoyed the smoked lox bagel and the kale chorizo omelet. He also really liked the honey vanilla latte! 5/5 for us!!!!

It's nice to have a new cafe like this in the downtown area without being in the middle of Downtown Las Vegas, per se.  Located on Main St. near Charleston Blvd., the boyfriend and I stopped in on Saturday afternoon at 3:40, 20 minutes before they close, unbeknownst to us.  Parking was easy since we got lucky and snagged a spot right in front.  The staff didn't shoo us away, even though they would be closing soon and we were ordering more than just coffee.  The menu offerings include breakfast served all day, bagels, sandwiches, salads, soup, arepas, empanadas, desserts, pastries, plus various teas and coffees, including cold brew.  Since time was not on our side during this visit because we had a 4:30 appointment elsewhere, I just had the Turkey Club and a lavender latte.  The club sandwich was nothing special, but I did like the plantain chips that came with it; I wouldn't pay $9 for this again, though.  I did love my lavender latte with almond milk, however.  It smelled wonderful, of course, and was creamy with just the right amount of sweetness.  
Service was excellent and I really like the ambiance.  There is a counter as well as an area for the electronic-toting patrons who want to plug in and do some work on their laptops.  I also spied at least one couch in the corner.  I look forward to more visits to try some of the other coffees and the Latin food items, especially when we're not pressed for time.

*Closed Sundays
Open Mon-Sat, 7:00-4:00

Update:
I am updating this review since I've had six more visits since my original contact which prompted the review below.  

Normally, I wouldn't update a poor review if my impression changed--I'd just leave subsequent reviews. However, given how consistently great my experience has been there and that I heard the company had a VM issue with its VM vendor, I feel an edited review is appropriate.

Let me share my three most important impression that keep me coming back.
1. The food here is awesome!  This coffee shop rivals most restaurants in town with their food menu.  The Latin-inspired menu is creative and delicious.  One of my favorites is the Beef Melt with mixed peppers, caramelized onions, and mozzarella crust.
2.  The service is great--all the time.  In addition to the great service, you can tell the staff love working with each other *and* enjoy their work.  It's a pleasure to be around people who are so genuinely engaged.
3.  The ambiance is inviting and tasteful.

I'll keep coming until I've tried their menu then move on to the next place on my list in this new town of mine.  Until then (and probably quite often in the interim), I'll enjoy this gem.

Greg

Take me back to Las Vegas, not for the gambling, not for the shows, just for THIS place! 

The coffee, the food, the service, the ambiance.. Yes yes yes and yes! 

Breakfast was amazing, can't remember exactly what I ordered but I remember it had eggs and I loved it.. But what I do remember perfectly is the empanadas.

The empanadas were to die for, we tried both the chicken and the mushroom.. In my opinion, the mushroom was better but both are just scrumptious.

And don't get me started on the coffee.. I literally ordered my second cup while I was still drinking my first, that's how good it was. I tried both honey cinnamon latte and the lavender latte.. Both delicousssss but I preferred the honey latte (a little less sweet).

This place needs two listings!!! The coffee here was 5 star all the way, super inventive and tasty. The food was fairly awful, probably a 2 star experience. 

Let me start by saying the food menu sounded great and I was pumped for some eggs benedict. My friend and I got there and were seated in their super cute dining room (tres hipster chic or something). We got coffee... I had the latte made with condensed milk, she got a special - lemon latte of sorts. That drink could have gone one of two ways, great or horrific. Obviously, it was great. Like coffee with a light lemon cookie inside, so tasty. My coffee was also primo delicious. Sweet, but not too sweet. 

Now the food.... we both got the eggs benedict, described like a Mexican eggs benedict with the bread being an arepa and having some kind of slow cooked meat on top and a jalapeno hollandaise or something... sounds good, right? Wrong. The 'arepa' was not what I have known to be an arepa in other restaurants (aka a flat masa type pancake with a filling inside that is soft, warm and delicious), this was hard, like it was made a day or two ago, kind of chewy/dense, and not filled with anything. The meat was tough and obviously not cooked long enough. The hollandaise was mediocre at best. I didn't even finish my plate, I was so disappointed. 


Take home point: Come here for coffee, skip the food.

Sitting here about 30 minutes after we ordered our food, still nothing has come out. Orders the empanadas and a croissant sandwich. 2 couples next to us arrived much later (about 10-20 minutes after we ordered, had their orders taken and got their food within 10 minutes. Not sure how the kitchen works but this is a bit disappointing. Maybe it takes longer for them to make empanadas? Why not make a batch ahead and have them ready to fry? Server hasn't updated us either on the status of our order (i.e. busy making it, running a little behind, etc.). Unacceptable. The Nutella latte was eh. Didn't taste like Nutella. Chai latte was good. 

Update: So we never got our food order because our server never put it in! He came back out asking again what we ordered and we were just floored. That was it. How'd he forget to put in our order when it wasn't even busy at all? We were maybe only the 3rd table seated when we came in at 12:15pm. Cardinal rule of serving - don't forget to put in your customers' orders! Needless to say, we were extremely upset and just asked to cancel our order. He tried to comp 1 of our meals, but at that point, we didn't want to eat here anymore. If I could give 0 stars I would, but at least he said the coffee and chai would not have to be paid for his mistake. Very poor service for a place we had high expectations.

Coffee and food are delicious, I also like the ambience with the settle music and their drip coffee device. Very hip and in the heart of downtown. Parking can be difficult, but that's just downtown. 

Comfortable indoor/outdoor seating area with lots of room for groups. And there's a bar next door! 

I appreciate the water service to the table and the attentive staff. I was here for a business meeting, about an hour, and the waiter asked us too many times if we needed anything to the point where it interrupted our conversation.

Just ordered from here through Postmates because I heard rave reviews re: their coffee. I think those customers ordered the siphon coffee, but I ordered a French press at an eyebrow raising $5.50 (although, still $2 cheaper than the siphon). I would compare the coffee to the gas station coffee I've had up the street at Arco. I also ordered their lox and bagel (in photos), which was just kind of sad, especially at $10 a pop. Lox and trimming only included on one half of the bagel with a few tiny shavings of onion (which I don't personally have an issue with). If the food and beverage were half the price they ask, I wouldn't complain about the underwhelming quality.

Really comfy n art gallery is my fav point.smoked salmon benny was sooo good!!

I'm not big fan of sweet drinks.But when I orders slanted caramel coffee wit lil bit sweetener was the hit the point!!love it!!!

Great coffee and expresso drinks.  Terrific small plates with a South American flair.  Loved the mashed yucca, cerviche and the stuffed avocado.  Good brunch.  My wife was disappointed in the kale salad but I am not a kale connoisseur so I do not know a good one.  On Main Street where parking is a challenge at times but worth walking a block or two to hang out here for a while and enjoy life.

Heard such wonderful things about this place. We stopped by on Sunday for a bite. Great location as you can walk around before or after. Sat on the patio - It was cute with a few tables and pallet seating around, art on the walls. Although looks like it's time to update a bit since the restaurant seems to be doing well. Inside of the restaurant really cute. 

Service was a bit slow. Drinks were delicious. We had an iced chai tea latte dirty (shot of espresso) and a lavender fog tea. 

I ordered a simple bagel sandwich which I didn't like. It was a lot of bagel. And they went heavy on the avocado cream cheese which made it feel greasy. Table also ordered the ceviche which was light and fresh and the arepa benny which was also delicious. Flavor was really good. Both came with a side of crispy plantains.

The atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed and the food is amazing. The yuca mash is my favorite side and the empanadas were delish. I ordered a side of maduros but they never arrived....I'll try again next time. If you're in for coffee try the Mexican Spiced Late, it's fantastic!

Great vibes and delicious food. Tried the salted caramel and Mexican spice latte... Great flavors!! 

Being a first timer I had to try the chorizo and Brussels sprouts and was not disappointed everything was perfectly seasoned with quality ingredients.

You can't leave without trying the Elvis press. Nutella, bacon and strawberries pressed in a soft croissant- I was full from my entree but I definitely made room for this!! 

Attentive service and great food, will not be my last time at Makers!
Amazing breakfast and the Mexican late is the best EVA! Don't sleep on this small cozy intimate spot. Love Love Love it!!!

Visited on 7-16-16 at about 9:30am.  This restaurant is located on Main St. between Charleston and Oakey.  It is surrounded by antique stores so it was fun to eat and then go peruse for some treasures.  We were able to find free street parking on the side of the building.  

$36.77 got us two coffees, a side of fruit for the boy, an arepa benny, and chilaquiles.  The decor is hipster but not in an exclusive way...the decor and service are very welcoming.  I like their unusual artwork on the walls.  

$3.75 Iced espresso machiatto- I couldn't help but giggle when they put this thing in front of me.  It was served in a 4 oz. mason jar.  I am used to Starbucks' version I guess but this really threw me off.  My husband exclaimed, "WHAT IS THIS, A MACHIATTO FOR ANTS?" I guess Starbucks is like the Wal-Mart of coffees and this is what a proper machiatto looks like.  It was very strong.  I experienced complete awareness after I drank it. 

$10 arepa benny- had golden poached eggs, coffee rubbed beef, grilled tomatoes, and salsa verde hollandaise.  It's the only hollandaise I've ever liked.  The beef was nicely spiced, salty, and tender.  I highly recommend this! 

$10 chilaquiles- A small iron skillet with scrambled eggs, tortilla chips that have been dipped in chile sauce, black beans, and cojita cheese.  This was my first experience with chilaquiles.  It's basically soggy tortilla chips and eggs.  It was extremely spicy.  I'm glad I got to try it but I don't think I'd ever eat it again.  It had very good flavor, though.  

This place is much more friendly than the other douchey hipster coffee shops and their food was really good.  I highly recommend this place.

I come here a lot and I love the atmosphere and proximity to my house. But, the food and especially coffee are very inconsistent. If I get my coffee black, it's usually good. But asking for a cappuccino. I usually get a latte. I'm not much for doctored up drinks. So the flavored beverages don't really do anything for me. I just want perfectly steamed milk with an espresso shot that is extracted properly. I've had some good meals here, but I cannot say that they were great. I really want to like this place. And I do. But it makes it difficult for me to want to come back. I've tried a lot of apreas and I have had one here that was cooked right. The Greek yogurt was great, but again. That's a hard one to mess up. A salad here and there was tasty. But I've also had greens that tasted old and extremely bitter. Odd in fact. So again, there's no consistency. It feels like everyone is on their own wavelength. I will always be willing to give it another shot.

Loved the ambience and design of this spot. The coffee was pretty good - not AMAZING, but still good (maybe a bit overpriced). The staff were lovely, although we had to wait a very long time for our food, and then when it arrived it was sort of cold. It looked delicious and I liked the menu, in the end the food was not very flavorful. Would have hoped to get my second coffee on the house since we waited over 45 minutes for the food.

AREPAAAAASSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!  Wooooohooooooooo!

I really loved their lavender coffee and hibiscus tea. So refreshing and sweet just enough. I tried the arepa with mozzarella, peppers, and avocado lime cream and It was super delicious!!! (Raja)

Pulled beef on a Benedict?? Yes, please!!!!  If you need a break from the flavorless buffets or mega chain breakfast plates in Vegas, this little gem in the Arts District is just the ticket. A coffee shop with benefits... their meal offerings are limited but YUMMY! And, the vibe is super chill, bright and breezy. A little latin breakfast goes a long way!

Sort of an odd place, because while it looks like a coffeeshop, it functions more like a restaurant--there's a sign asking for people to wait to be seated, for example. And the food menu is before the coffee menu. I had a breakfast there with a veggie scramble, which was solid, definitely above average. The coffee was solid too. Service is friendly, a little slow though.

The menu is fantastically Latino eclectic.  There were at least 10 other items I wanted to try.  Coffee was superb, with recommendations for the Honey Vanilla Latte, and Lavender Latte.  So glad I grabbed the bus from the strip to check out the arts district.

I ordered take out and the phone was answered promptly. The person on the phone was friendly and make good suggestions. Upon arrival I was greeted by a few members of the staff and I only waited a few minutes to receive my order. The good is really good (ordered bagels and lox and a breakfast croissant). And they come with a side of plantains. I would love to go and have brunch or lunch one day when I'm not in a rush.

This is the place to be if you want to eat off the strip, especially if you have a car.

The wait was not long and the atmosphere is great.  Real simple and chill, delicious organic food.

Prices are great ($10-12) and coffee/tea are around $5 as well.  So my grand total for lunch was $15 :)

I highly recommend this spot for those visiting LV for a good Saturday/Sunday brunch.
Loved it, only wish I knew about them sooner. Great coffee selection yummy eats and reasonably price for Vegas.
It's not my fav coffee in town but Good coffee. Cool place to hangout. I like the turmeric drink.

Here's a picture of a near empty glass of water that I received only after sitting down for 10 minutes without any help. Look, normally I wouldn't write a petty ass review but this situation was ridiculous. I live downtown and like to support local businesses. Normally I go to Vesta but I decided to give these guys a try. 
Pro Tip: Insist in sitting at a table, the girl at the front sat me in the couches in the back where apparently you're not waited on at all. 
All together 30 minutes pass by and I still don't have my breakfast bagel or at the very least my damn latte that takes less than 5 minutes to make. So I walked out and I will stick to giving Vista across the street my business. 
#DoBetter
Heard so much about this place and decided to check it out during my downtown Vegas cafe crawl. The trend lives up to its reputation but they back it up with good grub to boot.
Love this place!! Wish it was closer to me. I had there breakfast and it was fresh and the delivery was good. The chef even came out and checked on us. Pretty cool spot! Wish it was closer though ;(

Came in on a Saturday morning and it was quite crowded.  Luckily for me I came in by myself and was seated at the bar immediately.

The restaurant itself is very chic.  Art on the walls, comfortable chairs, outdoor seating.  The service I got at the bar was attentive and not rushed.  Actually, the people sitting next to me on both sides were working on their laptops and I have a feeling that they were probably there for a long time.  

I ordered a lavender latte and it was very very delicious.  It was very large as well and was able to sustain me for the entirety of my meal.  I am quite excited to come back in a try another one of their specialty lattes.

The food was pretty good.  I really appreciate that they label menu items for dietary restrictions and that there were a lot of gluten free options.  The only problem I had was that I ordered avocado with my Latin Hash and didn't get any.  I told my bartender and she was more than willing to get me some but I thought it was good without it.  And if that's my only complaint then I definitely had a great breakfast.

So I came here on a recommendation from a friend.  Arriving it was a cute little place our server came over right away and took our order.  The food was great!!!!  Working in the food industry and customer service there are basic Do's and Don'ts that go along with working as a server and our server did a HUGE DONT!!!! before we even got our bill we got kicked out because they had people waiting.  They clearly have a patio area that they could open up and serve there but instead they chose to let their customers know they need tables cleared and people are waiting so we had to either hang out at the bar (which was clearly full) or leave.  This was all before dropping our check.  I've never been more insulted in my life.

This is probably my favorite coffee shop since moving to Las Vegas. They have the best coffee. My favorite during summer time would have to be a Vanilla Chai and during the winter a Mexican spice latte. They also have amazing food. I've gone 3 different times and there food is to die for. Their staff is all amazing and very friendly. A place that is a must while visiting Las Vegas.

I like the atmosphere and would rather give my business to small, cute places like this than to Starbucks. It's definitely a place for young hipsters though. I'm middle aged and not a hipster (my children are) and I feel like when I went inside I was purposefully ignored. The waiter saw me, but I had to stand and wait what felt like a long time to be acknowledged. I finally told him I wanted a latte "to go" and gave my order to the guy behind the bar. Again I felt awkward and out of place, idk just got that vibe from the staff. My latte took an uncomfortably long time to be ready, and when I got it, it was cold! The place wasn't crowded at the time, so I'm assuming they're sending me the message " Don't come back! You're too old and not the type of cliente we want here!! Won't be going back.

This place seems a little over-the-top with the whole vibe they're putting out but whatever, seems like a cool enough place and (pleasantly) the workers are nice/friendly vice stuck-up which is a bit what you expect when you walk in. By this I mean it's clearly hipster and hipsters aren't nice to people.

I needed some caffeine and it was too hot for coffee so I opted for an iced coffee. I had to ask for some cream and sugar as there is none hanging around as you might expect. Once I got my levels situated the drink itself was good, nothing too remarkable about the taste of the coffee really. 

Of note however was that I emptied it in about 5 sips. As it turned out it was more ice than coffee. This was extremely aggravating when I paid just over $4 with tax. Ouch. I went back up to the counter and requested a refill in order to get somewhere near more than 2 oz of actual coffee - they did this without hesitation and with a smile so that was nice. 

I might check this place out again as they seem to have some innovative drinks and the food looks/sounds pretty good.

The ambiance here is good. The staff is very friendly. The service, although pleasant, was awful. The food was passable and not great.
I do not think I will be back. Nice idea poorly executed.

My husbands friend recommended this place. I have never been to a place yet where I was totally satisfied with everything. I had the Nutella latte iced which was amazing. I also tried the chicken empanadas which were even more amazing. My husband is super picky, he got the beef sandwich and he was in love. It's truly hard for this man to really like a restaurants food 100% but he was as equally impressed. We will be back soon for sure!

Great vibe, excellent music, and most of all some seriously great food and drinks.  For anyone who has ever been to the Montrose district in Houston, you'll feel right at home.  10/10 would eat here and recommend.

Great atmosphere. I had brunch with a friend and our server was very helpful. Had iced cold brew with almond milk (yum) and their Avocado & Egg White Breakfast Special. Highly recommend! FYI FREE Parking 2-Hours on Main Street was a plus!

Had a lavender latte & coconut turmeric latte. Flavors are too subtle for our taste. We couldn't taste the additives. Service was prompt & very friendly. I'm excited to try the menu options next time. Nice coffee house with alcoholic beverage options. Interesting decor & ambiance. Patio area out front. It was near closing, but staff did not pressure us to leave quickly.

Great service , great food, most important great attitude !! I don't know anything about coffee and I got a full lesson with out making me feel stupid lol !! It always great to see local people going into business I'm very proud of these guys !! Keep up the good work !! 

 Cheers to your future success !!

Best lattes ever we came for breakfast it was so hard to decided everything sounds so good.  We had the arepa benny and el paisa arepa and both were awesome.  Looked like small portions but was more than enough.  Service was great too it's clean,good, chill atmosphere . Will definitely come back every time we come to Vegas.

This is quickly becoming one of my favorite coffee spots in Las Vegas. The coffee is incredible, thoughtful, and unique with the addition of a bomb breakfast and lunch menu. Where else can you find a Coconut Turmeric Latte? Lavender infused? The list goes on as their beverage menu is bananas.

You can order in and sit at a table or grab a stool at the bar. Whether you're there when the doors open at 7am or for lunch in the afternoon the menu is surprisingly large and full of flavor. The Latin Hash is packed with potatoes, roasted vegis, and pulled beef. Feeling like you need something lighter? The Egg White Omelet is fluffy and full of flavor. I highly recommend adding a side of bacon because, it's delicious.

Two hour street parking is available right in front or along the side streets, but you might end up wanting to post up here a bit longer.

This is one of my favorite spots downtown for lunch. I have yet to order something on the menu that isn't delicious. A bit pricey but totally worth it. My go-to is the lavender fog, or the fries here are delicious. The empanadas are all amazing as well as the tomato bisque with a delicious, buttery cheese croissant. I've also had the chai tea latte, tastes like a warm churro. Yum.

There's a charming little area where you can sit outside in the shade. The chair are really uncomfortable, but there is the option of sitting on the couch. 

If you're ordering coffee to go, it might take a bit longer than you'd expect but still so good and it's worth being five minutes late to work.

Side note, all of these artsy little coffee shops downtown have that vibe where it seems like they're going to forget about your order. This hasn't happened to me yet though.

The best! I always get the croissant sandwich. I've been meaning to branch out and try new things, but whenever I go, I always want what I usually get. I'm a big fan of the honey vanilla latte too. :)

Quick turn and burn trip to Vegas. Searching for a good breakfast and came across this wonderful little spot. Not a long walk from Fremont.  We had the arapas Benedict with a tomatillo sauce. It was probably the best Benedict I have ever had. Also ordered a machaca and spicy chicken empanda. These were on point as well. If we were not leaving the next day, we would have came back. I will definitely eat here next time i am in vegas. Chill little spot with great customer service

The staff is very helpful and down to earth. Food is delicious and so is the coffee. They have plenty of seating (choose your seat) and strong wifi (ask staff for password). I will be back to this spot.

I loved their Bon Bon latte. I ordered it with Almond Milk , and it was a flavorful coffee.
Very cool place to chill , specially in a hot summer day .
We didn't know they service food as well. We will go back definitely and this time for sure will try their food menu.
Recommend highly!!!

Wow, just finishing up a delicious breakfast and coffee with my girlfriend when we were told to move from our table. I know you want to sit the 4 top asap but I was getting ready to pay and leave. ASK if we wouldnt mind moving. This guy told us TWICE within 3 minutes. The bill wasnt even paid yet. Im not trying to be hugh and mighty but damn. I just paid you 35 bucks for coffee and eggs and youre telling me to move or leave....C'mon man. My first ever yelp review too

The place is situated in the arts district that is undergoing a major remodel.  They will be in the middle of this neighborhood once all the roadwork is completed.  My coffee was great, a Cortado that contained espresso I could really taste.  Some coffee shops their coffees are weak, this place serves the strong stuff.  Also, I ate a breakfast sandwich/bagel, I would have given this place 3 stars because the bagel had no character.  They customer service here was highly attentive, yet not over bearing.

Artsy but not pretentious. Like having s bunch of random people over for coffee. Great to go service. Fast and friendly. Got a dark roast pour over and a Cuban espresso! If it wasn't so far I would be a regular.
Been here several times, always have good food and coffee. Friendly staff. And it's kind of hidden from the tourists so it isn't always crowded. Recommend highly

So, me, my sisters and my cousin who lives in Vegas wanted to go cafè hunting. This was found by my cousin in Instagram and some decided to come here for lunch after a thrilling ride in Stratosphere. 

The location is in downtown Las Vegas but in Arts District. Not a lot of people know where Arts District is because Las Vegas is still in the process of developing the area. Parking is difficult for only you could park along the street. It was a Saturday, so it was kind of expected that it will be a busy day for Vegas but I didn't expect that there's no parking lot nor structure.

Nevertheless, everything became so pleasant. As soon as I entered, I fell in love with its "urban-artsy" ambience. Coming here with only few customers on a Saturday, kind of gave me some itsy feeling to eat here. But oh boy, their food and drinks are AMAZING!!!!! I ordered Grilled Chicken Arepas and I was speechless how flavorful and delicious it was. My company ordered egg benedicts and Chicken Tinga empanadas and they were bomb!! 

For drinks, I got their lattè. The temperature was just right and with a little sweetness...thanks to the caramel drizzle on top. The froth is inadequate but not bad. My company ordered matcha lattè and salted caramel lattè and they are the best!! 

For dessert, I fell in love with Espresso flan. It's a slice of flan poured with a shot of espresso, topped with whipped cream and strawberries. I wish I could've saved more space for dessert because I would've tried more for sure!!

Service is so fast. Food and drinks were served right away. Our server (forgot his name sorry, I'll do better next time) was very knowledgable and helpful. There are also artworks displayed and being sold. The place is so cute and I couldn't stop taking pictures! I just love how low-key this place is but has better food and service compared to a lot of overrated restaurants in the Strip. I'm so glad I found this place.

i love this place!! there iced coffee is clean n smooth. 
i fell in love with there cream cheese... the atmoshphere is great and employess are friendly n knowledgeable, and its cool you see the owner valerie coming out talking to people n bringing food out awesome love it,,

M&F is a great place to start your mornings.

My son and I sat down at the bar and enjoyed watching the baristas rev up the awesome stainless steel coffee maker.....costing more than some cars in some garages.......for near perfect espressos.

If you want a substantial meal to fuel your day.....try their Bandeja Paisa platter.....comes with grilled skirt steak, fried sweet plantain, over easy egg, avocado slices, artery clogging fried pork chicharrones, spanish style rice, and black beans.......and that is just the appetizer......J/K.
Seriously, though.....this is my favorite dish!

Did I mention the awesome coffee maker??????

Will come again!

Terrible service took 20 minutes to serve expresso. Food arrived and it was cold. After asking them to heat up the food they said they can't. No offer to refund the food only after complaining did the manager do anything. Poorly run establishment honestly could do better going to a fast food spot.

Love this place! Delicious food and quality coffee. Everyone on the staff seemed to really enjoy working there. 
So glad we stopped here on our way out of Vegas. Totally hit the spot. Thank you for a nice visit, we will be back!

I'm definitely a fan! I had their Ripen Mango Arepas and the Mexican Spiced latte...both made to delight my taste palette. You have to go and see for yourself. The food was so fresh and so delish. The mango arepas go well with a side balsamic sauce the server handed me like it as a secret for my taste buds only kind of thing. I'm sure he's given it away to many before me, but hey don't harsh my mellow. Haha. The coffee was very subtle and creamy. Everyone there was so welcoming and attentive. I would definitely go back especially knowing its 10 mins away from my work!!!

Left a mediocre review awhile back & finally got around to going again. To be honest I was nervous because I was contacted by Omar, the manager because of my review (he was very polite & wanted to prevent the situation from happening again) so it shows that they care about their customer's experience. Very genuine people! When I went in I sat at the bar again & was automatically greeted by Ruben. I was super awkward since it turned out he recognized me from my review  But he was very chill & attentive. You can tell he was genuine the entire time. When Omar contacted me he offered me a free drink next time I came in but I personally didn't wanna bring that up  I didn't want anyone to know I wrote that review xD But nonetheless, Ruben comped my drink. I never even brought it up so I was taken by surprise. SO FUCKING SWEET! He apologized for my last experience which I didn't expect at all! Definitely give these people a try! They're worth it! P.S. I had the veggie bagel this time, AMAZING.

Oh. My. Goodness. 6 star option please. Fabulous service, ambience, coffee. Oh, the coffee. Mexican for my sweetie, coconut turmeric for me. Food is the perfect mix of Latin flavors. We went two mornings in a row. Best coffee and breakfast shop in Vegas!!!

This little gem is a great spot to chill and have some excellent coffee.  The empanadas where a spicy delight and the latte was a fusion of flavor well balanced and tasteful.  I will be coming back again to this spot.
If you want to go to a cool, chill, and flavorful spot with mellow music.. This is the jackpot!!!
Their lavender latte is one of the best I've had hands down. The food is always delicious. I just wish they had easier ways to park and maybe a second location closer to Henderson!

Poor service, long waits for food. Super overpriced! Tasty food but for the size of the portion not worth it. Got an empanada sampler with three small empanadas for $15 must be kidding me! I would go back for coffee only.

I'm rarely this enthused to write a review for a coffee joint, but this place really fit my image of a perfect coffee place. It was spacious while also feeling intimate. There are delectable things on the menu. The drink menu is also unique and made with high-quality ingredients. And the people here were totally chill. 

I sat at the bar and got to watch the magic happen. I really loved my coconut turmeric latte ($5.50), which was unique and wonderfully balanced. It was rich but not too heavy and really woke me up.

This is such a charming, off the beaten path spot. You should definitely check it out.

Me and my girlfriend split the Chicken Tinga Benny, the Breakfast Empanadas, and the Coconut Tres Leches Waffle. Everything was SO good! 

First time eating in Downtown Las Vegas and I wish that I lived here so I could come back more often! I would highly recommend this place to others
